column1: i walked in with a lot of "hair baggage" - heavy processing, regrowth, etc. i needed to get damaged hair cut off while retaining as much length as possible. stacey nailed it. she was easy to talk to and understood what i needed pretty quickly.

if zero stars were an option. checked in on line, when we arrived i explained that my daughter needed a shampoo/blow dry. the girl that came up to the counter began to act strangely and rudely said she could do a shampoo and 'i can do a finger dry".apparently they didn't have time to dry hair with a brush because they are having a hair cut sale and "customers for haircuts might come in"i have never heard of a business that didn't want to take your money for services.my daughter spent almost 2 months in a burn hospital and is unable to wash and blow dry her own hair. this was the most ridiculous display of customer service, i have ever experienced. wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy.maybe they should display a huge sign on their door and on line...stating...."we are only able to do $7.99 haircuts right now even if no one else is in here...because they might come in at any moment!

this review should be negative stars! do not get your hair cut by the older hispanic lady with the glasses, she will butcher your hair!!! she messed up my kid so bad he had to buy a hat just to cover what she did to him  it was such an easy cut..smdh! this lady cut half of his head bald, honestly she should not be cutting hair! she should be fired!

crummy service.  seems like every time i come here they shorten the time they spend with you.  hurried cut, leaving hair all over your clothes, face, forehead.  don't even think about going back to work or anywhere after this cut except straight to a shower.  pathetic.and now let's talk about the actual haircut.  crappy to say the least.  shoddy job, crummy uneven cut by all stylists, not even a fraction of what a true barbershop could accomplish.  simply put don't go here unless you want pure garbage.
bad experience. i went there because i had a coupon but apparently they don't take electronic coupons. we live in an electronic world. would never go back

some new girl just gave me a crew cut. said my customer info said that was my cut. week before big business. trip.  i am not a vain person but this is ridiculous. never going here again.  told girl i get it cut every month of 6 weeks.  can't she tell i don't get a crew cut.  ignorant and inexperienced.
crappy place, does not take expired coupons. doesn't state on window about there coupon policy. will not go there again

if i had known that i was going to get my hair chop-chopped  by edward scissorhands then i wouldn't have even entrusted my precious hair to them.  i realize, of course, that by going to great clips i wasn't going to be getting a grade-a  haircut but then again i wasn't going to great clips for anything but a trim.  a very minimal trim that should have been anything but difficult...instead i got a hair trim where way too much length was taken off and the cut itself looked too, top choppy.  my hair now looks as if i had taken a pair of kitchen scissors to my hair and just started cutting away.  when i went in i specifically asked for a teeny tiny trim so that my dead ends could be done away with and i also specified that i did not want any thinning or layering of my hair.  what did i get?  an inch and a half cut off of my hair and the most choppy layers imaginable.  the cost of the haircut was $14 and for females (who, sorry guys, need much more effort and acute attention put into our hair) you get what you pay for.  if i'd known they'd be so incompetent at simply trimming the ends i'd never have step foot in here. i'd never have come for an actual haircut and i guarantee that i never will.  however, for males, great clips is a good option and in fact my fiancé comes here and gets his hair cut regularly and it always turns out well.

been coming here for years and love this place. so much so that even after i moved to the city i still find myself coming back to them. go see ross, wait for him if he's busy with another customer. he is absolutely worth the wait. i promise you that you will not be disappointed.

stopped in today for a haircut. i have been to great clips before so they have a write up on how i like my hair cut. things seemed to be going smoothly when the lady cut off a large chunk of my hair. it was late and dark, so i paid for my haircut, tipped her and left. i get home to better light...the lines around my ears look like an impressionist painting. it is basically a buzz cut because she left so little of my hair long on the top of my head. i will never return to this location. waist of time and money. guess i have to wait for my hair to grow back.

went for a quick haircut during lunch and got a great one from ross.  he was attentive to exactly the haircut i wanted.  made sure the top was the length i wanted before he actually cut.  i would definitely come back here for another cut from him.  in and out in less than 30 minutes too!

horrible service. checked in online, arrived on time, and was asked at the counter if i checked in online to which i confirmed. then sat there and was repeatedly skipped for 20 minutes beyond my time until had to ask why i was being skipped for people walking in without appointments and i was blamed for not checking in at the desk when the lady obviously failed to mark it after asking me initially. what is the point of an online app if you ignore those that use it? and where is the customer service to ask why 1 guy has been sitting there for 30 minutes while the person walking in now gets helped.

great place for an inexpensive but decent hair cut. bill (owner) is very friendly, and makes sure his service standards are kept high whether he is there or not. a great plus when the place is open long hours for your convenience. most stylists do decent with my frizzy, thinning hair. as with most things, some do better than others.a great option is to sign up online to save your place and cut wait times! you can't pick a stylist, but can save 15 minutes by getting in line before you leave the house!also check for coupons. great deals in the mail! tip well if you like the service, too.

went in to have about 2 inches cut off the bottom of my straight long hair. i asked her for a perfectly straight even bottom line cut. also stated that i absolutely did not want the front to be any shorter then the back & that i did not want a curved look. started with a shampoo which was optional by the way, and a conditioning treatment to detangle. the shampoo job was ok but i didn't think she rinsed much of the conditioner out. the stylist didn't organize the hair very well as she was cutting it, and literally she finished in slightly over 5 minutes. when she was finished she showed me the results whilemy hair was still wet. well , you can't tell anything when the hair is still wet. i guess at that point i was done and expected to leave. so i asked if she was able to blow dry it and style it which is pretty easy with straight hair that's all one length. she used the blow dryer and tossed my hair around with her fingers a little bit and then asked if that was ok. now it was worse and even harder to tell if she cut it straight. my head was still very wet so i asked her to finish drying it. i think she was bothered by this because now a couple people had come in the front door and were waiting. she never used a brush to assist in the drying process. when she said she was done the 2nd time, i still had wet sections throughout my hair and it wasn't even brushed or combed to lay flat so there was no way to tell if this was a good haircut. once i got home i rewashed my hair because it felt like there was still a sticky layer of conditioner left in it from the stylist, and i wanted to check and see if my hair was cut straight. after i dried and styled and smoothed my hair as i usually do i saw that the haircut was a disappointment and a fail ... it is not a continuous straight line, the front is shorter then the back and there are areas that are jagged throughout. so, skip this location if you're looking for a nice simple straight line . mine turned out crooked and the overall experience was not great . the conversation she initiated was a downer too. all she talked about was cancer... i should probably go back and ask someone else if they'd be willing to correct my cut, but i'm reluctant thinking the place is really centered on the "quick get em in and get em out" business mode, not quality. i'm not sure why i even gave it a 2 star rating . it did however appear to be clean.

friendly and clean in and out 30 min no appointment just walked in. they did a great job. i've used them every time i'm at the all state arena doing a show. i've used great clips all over the u.s. never been dissatisfied or disappointed!!

so i just witnessed one of the most rude customers in my life at this great clips. i was patiently waiting for my haircut when this lady starts yelling at the one of the employees about how she's getting screwed in her prepaid haircuts. i don't know the background and whole story why she was so upset. it doesn't matter. there's absolutely no reason to yell across the store when the person you're speaking with is two feet away, especially when your children are with you. what a wonderful example to set for you kids. throughout it all, the employee was professional, helpful and kept her calm. at one point she did end up tearing up, excused herself and walked to the back room to compose herself. the customer then complained and yelled about how she just left her and didn't resolve her problem. ridiculous and embarrassing. she should be ashamed of herself, but she won't. she never will. she's ignorant to the world and will always think she's right no matter what and will teach those lessons to her kids. let's continue the cycle. as for the employee? thank you so much. you are an amazing person to be able to put up with people like that. i couldn't have done it.

i respectfully disagree with a previous comment, this place was over priced and not a good haircut.   i actually went to another barber shop after leaving this place.   this was easier than to keep on trying to explain what was wrong.

been here twice. i had different styists each time but i don't mind not having the same stylist every time i get a hair cut.  service is always super friendly and courteous. the owner/manager (guy who greets customers) is always friendly & accomodating. super clean place. hair on the floor are swept/cleaned right away. called ahead to set up appointment but owner said no appointment necessary for a hair cut. service is straight-forward, quick, no muss/no fuss, and affordable (i believe approx. $15 per hair cut).  keep up the great work!
ross cut off my long hair into a short style on my lunch! when i got back to the office everyone complimented me on the beautiful cut. 5 stars for ross talented, professional, personable .

if i could put no stars in i would. i went in here today with my mom. both of us have been in before and had good and bad experiences. after today though, my entire family will never return. i was there a month ago and the man who cut my hair did not really do what i asked. when i got home, i wasn't too happy but i decided to wait and see if it would grow on me. it didn't. and everyone i talked to about it said my hair looked uneven and everything i did didn't help. i went in today and started to explain how unhappy i was and the stylist began arguing with me about it. she told me i was wrong and that it wasn't uneven. i told her i had even consulted with another stylist before going in today and that the stylist said it was uneven and needed to be fixed. she continued to say i was wrong and i decided to get up and leave without a haircut. i'm not a big believer in "the customer is always right" but i do know that i am the one who has to style my hair everyday for work and no matter what i do it looked horrible. my teenage students could even tell that it was a bad cut. my mom received a haircut that was way shorter than she asked for and it was uneven as well. we will not ever return to this salon. we are currently at another place altogether and getting our hair fixed; we will go here from now on.
they cut extensions!! hair cuts for purchased hair (lol) is getting increasingly difficult to find. stephanie cut my hair and did an amazing job. very happy.

my hair is pretty simple to do. and mike took all of 5 minutes to do it. the top seems ok but the back is asymmetrical and with a weird invected half circle instead of a straight line. maybe at 9am they are still a little groggy.. dunno. i expected a little more attention to detail. disappointing.

mike is my absolute favorite stylist in chicago. i've gone to other places to get my hair cut and even sat in other stylists' chairs at this great clips location, but nobody listens and cuts like mike.i'm growing out my hair right now so i'm a relatively "easy" trim, but it makes such a difference when i can walk out the door still feeling like my hair is long. mike is also great at evening up my bangs and layers each time so i don't look too scraggly.i've loved coming here for the past three years and will continue to stop in no matter what neighborhood i move to!

i came here right when they opened at 9 am to get about 4 inches cut off my obnoxiously long hair. they offer a special where you can get your haircut for 10 bucks between 9 am and noon on weekdays. stephanie was my stylist and she was amazing! very kind and gentle with my hair. the salon was clean and the service was amazing.

i always come here to get my hair cut or trimmed because of it's convenience and also because it offers a great student discount. i've never been one to pay $20+ for a trim so great clips is the perfect option. i never check-in online (their version of an appointment) but there never is much of a wait which is nice. the hair cut itself, since it is a trim usually lasts pretty short so it's quick and easy! however, last time i was here the hair stylist was so rough with my head by the end i was sure he had pulled out more hairs than cut. i understand my hair may have been tangled but he was really going at it with the comb to get the knots out and i feel like it could have been done a lot gentler. in general he was rough during the cut as well and while the final look ended up fine it wasn't the most enjoyable hair cut i've had.the venue is nice and clean but this experience really caught me off guard and i will have to check who is working next time before i walk in so as not to experience the same thing.

walked in this morning and was seated immediately! just wanted to leave a review thanking stephanie, you did a great job with my fade and it was really nice chatting with you about school and chicago!hope to be back soon if i'm in the area. good luck with your upcoming internship too! thank you stephanie!

mike, the manager here, is the only person that i go to for a haircut.  there are 20 other places to get a haircut that's closer to me, but mike is the absolute best so i go here.  the overall vibe here is very lively and very friendly

we recently moved to california but i needed to leave a review for the wonderful, fabulous mike at great clips. he cut my family's hair for the 3+ years we lived off clark street in lincoln park. he is a wonderful person and a very talented stylist! we miss you mike!
they dont know how to cut hair, i literally asked for a trim. how hard can that be? its uneven its a wreck. they are not professionals.

i have been to this salon before and generally get a decent cut, but tonight i am unhappy because i explained that i was growing out my hair on top and i just wanted the sides and back cut with as little as possible cut from the top. it looked fine when i left the salon because my hair was still wet. when i arrived home and it was dry, it was much shorter than i wanted. i am very disappointed since i have been growing out my hair for months. i think i will start looking for a new place to get my hair cut where they actually listen to you.

stephanie is easily the best hair stylist i ever had the pleasure to go to.she likes her work, does it to perfection and has an awesome sense of humor too.i, personally, have a kinda weird style statement and i mostly don't listen to stylists, etc. but stephanie definitely understands what i look for and gives me perfect suggestions, which i listen.

this great clips is alright. the staff is friendly but the few times that i've visited, they made mistakes. the first girl that cut my hair was excellent, so i came back. the next one gave me a slightly uneven hair cut but it wasn't anything i couldn't touch up myself. the most recent experience was embarrassing because the stylist said my previous haircut didn't look great, which i agreed with but after she gave me a trim and tried to fix the uneven sections, she said she still didn't like it but there was nothing else she could do. i let her know that i didn't mind losing length as long as the mistakes were corrected. my hair at the time was mostly all one length so i thought it would be a fairly simple correction.i decided to pay more at another salon to receive more consistent cuts. i hope to return in the future because it's so close to home and reasonable in price but unfortunately it's not an option at this point in time.

this shop just relocated but i went to their previous location on diversey several times and i've always come out with a good haircut at a great price. this may not be the place if you have some complicated haircut that you're anal about but for a basic haircut they get the job done.  they usually have three or more people working so there usually isn't much of a wait.  if you can get in weekdays between 9:00 a.m. and noon, a haircut is only $9.99. otherwise, it's $14.

alex is a real star:) she is amazing! i went and had an up-due for a very important event with her and for a fraction of the salon price she absolutely knocked my socks off with her creation. please ask for alex and you will have blow out of a lifetime... love love love my experience!

i love this salon! i have a boyish pixie cut that i am very particular about, and a fear of haircuts has had me cutting it myself for years. this is the only place i've been to with stylists who seem to really listen to what i want and give such satisfactory results! i've been seeing stephanie here for months (by coincidence! she always ends up the one cutting my hair) and she's incredibly sweet and funny, and so easy to talk to! she always does a great job -- i know i'm going to have a great day every time i see her! she's really respectful of me trimming my bangs and sides in between haircuts, too, which i appreciate! she cuts off the extra bulk, but leaves my style exactly the way it is. i am so grateful for this great clips!

definitely a great deal. i was paying double + tip for a great haircut nearby so decided to try and cutback on expenses and check out great clips. the shop is clean, the price is great (i had a coupon but weekdays 9-12 are $9.99 and usual price is $14) and my barber joey helped alleviate some of the usual awkwardness of a haircut by adding some decent conversation!
great haircut, great service, and what a clean shop.  mike gave me one of the best haircuts i've had in a long time!
great new place- they just moved from their old location on clark/diversey.  this new place is very clean, nice, and the service was great.  i was in and out in under 15 minutes with a great haircut.

checked in online way before noon, braved the - 25 windchills to get there, ended up arriving due to traffic and weather at 12:02, and they wouldn't honor the early bird special that ended at 12. the former store on diversey would have honored it as long as i was checked in, and in fact did so in the past. not the way to treat a regular customer, so they lost this one.

i went in for a simple 1inch trim of my hair and ended up loosing about 4inches. i had long hair with a slight angle, i don't think the girl knew what that meant because before i knew it i was missing half of my hair in the front. it was a waste of money and now i'll have to wait months for my hair to grow back out.

never too busy when i come in. they always have great staff and a cheery demeanor. the cuts i get are always what i want and they have no problem fixing up anything i want touched up. consistently great men's cuts!edit: after waiting 20 minutes a couple who had called in were bumped in front of me. i was not told they might have someone in front of me and they didn't let me know what was going on when they took them instead of me until i asked.

i wish i can give this salon a zero stars but i can't. walked into the great clips on elston in chicago; i asked for a haircut. first of all they stylist both were so rude. one literally screamed across the salon to get the attention of the other person who would eventually cut my hair. so few things about this stylist who serviced me, 1. she had dirty clothes on and just messy ( the insoles on her shoes were out and flapping as she walked )2. she took literally 5 mins to cut my hair. i asked her for a bob i even showed her pictures. she split my hair in 3 and cut all the same length. i've gotten plenty of bob haircuts and no one has taken that approach would not be back to any great clips. even that 15 $ i paid was too much.

the owner of this location is garbage, and so is the staff. hence why it shut down quickly after new ownership. it's sad how they tarnish the name of a big company simply because the owner of this specific location puts zero quality into it's establishment. zero customer service whatsoever and terrible haircuts all around.
i receive by far the worst hair cut i've every had and will never go back to a great clips ever again. this women should not be allow to cut anyone else's hair. beware!!!

wow these people are terrible. they closed to early when online it says 6pm. and when you call them they literally hang up on you. i understand it's sunday you want to go home and rest but do your job right. especially if it says open until 6pm it's 4:28. stop hanging up on your customers.
5:34 on sunday store closes at 6:00 but the guy won't cut my sons hair . doors are locked and he is cleaning . thanks great clips i

this place is busy,but i understand why.. lydia is very nice. she was able to cut my daughter's hair with no issues. very friendly staff. if you want to get in on time, use their app. you can schedule your cut. nice touch...

sometimes this place gets really busy and the wait can be 45 minutes.  but the workers are friendly, and the interior is clean.  they do give out these coupons for savings off of cuts and since it is next to me i been going here.  shares the lot where i work so it has huge parking, and if you do have to wait, there is a subway and a starbucks walking distance.

being a huge fan of great clips i went by and picked up a haircut. this seems to be a new location. the lady who cut my hair did a great job and i have no complaints. the store was clean and service was fine. i'll probably go back here again since it's kind of close to where i live. nothing else really to report. just another great clips.../shrug
lydia the manager was very friendly & helpful after i had a bad incident there. since then i only go there to get my haircut now & i always make sure she is the one to do it. i am quite satisfied.

went here for a haircut two weeks ago, it was my second time. i say, wasn't too crowded. was called and said that i wanted a shampoo and wash. so, i have very thick and wavy hair. i had rose who was nice.  went out to dinner with my friend tonight and she informed me that my hair is completely lopsided and uneven.  i was mortified.  she took a pic for me to see and since i wasn't offered a blow dry with the haircut i guess that's why it wasn't noticed. i wish i never wasted my time or money here, and i wish i went to gallery of hair instead.  more money,  but at least i would have been happy the first time.  now i have to go get it redone and even shorter than what i wanted.  on my job interview tomorrow i have to wear my hair down, but not with this embarrassing haircut, that looks like i did it myself.

friendly staff, clean atmosphere, quick service and extra coupons to save you a few bucks!!! i get my hair cut here regularly and i use the handy app to check in... in and out in approximately 20 minutes with a great haircut!

i never actually got my haircut here...i was in the shopping center and thought i would get a haircut. when i walked in a women from behind the counter barked out "phone number?"  i was the only person there so i knew she was talking to me. why does an off-price/chain hair cut place that doesn't take appointments need my phone number? what happened to the canned chain store greeting? "welcome to our mega company"i quickly realized why i was the only person there and left.

i love this place. you can get a great, top notch haircut for under $20 including tip! eyebrows trimmed/cleaned up for free....as a guy i am not good with my eyebrows! parking is also very easy as it's located in a strip mall type setting with lots of available spaces ... the stylists (espcially lydia) are very knowledgeable and friendly.... all of the information about your haircut is saved in the computer for next time...for example the number buzzer you need, length on top etc...i also was told you can check into the waiting list online to save time.....(though i've never waited that long ). and they also have an early bird special and free haircut after ten cuts...... really happy with this place and location!!

well .. walked in about an hour after they opened. one stylist working .. one client in the chair .. on in the waiting area. she checked me in, and told me to "run an errand for 20 minutes." .. no worries , i was a walk-in, and it was only 20 min. ran my errand , came back .. apparently, when i was told to "run and errand" .. 4 clients before me were also told to "run an errand".. waiting area was full, still one stylist, and i was 4th in order .. translation , and hour and a half / 2 hour wait for a basic cut. if the stylists would have been more honest upfront , or a bit more welcoming , perhaps i would have stayed or tried it again.. i know it's a cheap, assembly line haircut. you get what you pay for ..thankfully due to the one stylist and several clients , i didn't even get the chance to pay for anything.
very good customer service, usually in and out pretty quick. i've seen them be very understanding in tough situations and i've never had an issue.

very friendly service, open minded staff who is open to anything i want adjusted in a haircut. always clean when i come. or stylists are cleaning. love the clip notes, they know what to do before i sit down unless i want to change it!

horrible! rose cut my hair. she was rude and chopped up my hair like one of the previous reviews on here. it was not busy when i went. she was complaining about previous clients while she cut my hair to the other hairstylist that was there. she complained because of my online check in. she did not let me check my hair. stating it was all even. never again. i should have checked yelp before coming here. do not let rose cut your hair!

force of habit:  i've been using great clips at home in california for years, so i naturally gravitated to the one in my temporary chicago neighborhood .  no surprises.  not busy at 10:00 on a monday morning; two clippeuses on duty, tending to two clippees, out of a total of five barber chairs.  i sat for just a few minutes in the seven-seat waiting area rather grandly referred to as the lobby.  i'm a pretty un-fussy customer; "lob six weeks offa this" is about as persnickety as i get.  and the lobbing proceeded quickly and efficiently.  i noticed that my clipper made more use of scissors than most great clips personnel.  i walked out fifteen minutes later and only fourteen dollars lighter (senior rate).  not bad.

third bad cut here. are we sure they're licensed? do i need to explain what a pixie cut means? first time the dude left it misshapen. second time, lady left one side longer than the other. that grew out ugly. just left the place, i've got the worst haircut i've ever had in my life. i sat down and she reads the notes from last time which should say a 2 and 3 on the sides then finger length on top. she goes so "so it's a 2 and a 3? i said yes because i thought she was just clarifying razor lengths. she used a 3 on the whole thing and it took 3 minutes. i know it's a cheap haircut place, but when someone comes in with an overgrown pixie wouldn't you ask twice before giving them a buzzcut? don't just look at your "last time" notes. talk it thru with the customer. that's my dignity you're messing with. god, i don't know shit about grooming but do i really have to hold miss beauty school's hands thru a haircut? at least i wear a hat at work and don't have to get another for like 6 months.and the thing that's been an issue the last 3 times, they're not paying attention to you because they're chatting with their co-workers the entire time. they just want you in and out. sometimes it baffles me how much people in customer service don't care.

debbie = avoid. do not get your hair cut by debbie. i love great clips and have been going for years (and still plan on going) but this is by far the worst haircut i've had as an adult. debbie sat me down, and asked me what i wanted. i told her "i normally have a combover on top but i just want it shortened and thinned out a little, and that i normally do a 3 on the sides faded nicely into a 2 near the neck". interestingly, she wasn't paying attention to me while i was talking, but i just assumed that she was experienced and she was listening. apparently not. of what i said, the only things she seemingly heard were "top want shortened" and "sides faded". so the end result is i have essentially a buzz cut on top like someone had gone over it with a 5 or 6 razor (combover completely lost), and the sides are completely buzzed as she went over it with a 0.5 or no guard at all. when i put my glasses on at the end, i was shocked at how short everything was, and i told her this is not what i wanted. debbie responded "you asked for a fade, this is what a fade is". i told her that i said i wanted a 3 faded into a 2 on the sides and neck, not a straight up fade. debbie said "well nothing we can do now". on top of that, there was essentially a "military look" where there was hair on the top and no hair on the sides without a clean fade/transition between the two. when i told debbie that this was way shorter than i had wanted and it's too choppy and not transitioned well, she said "well you don't have to pay for it if you don't want to". i said that wasn't my concern, i just wanted it improved or fixed as best as possible in the situation. her response was to turn her back to me, walk away and stand by the register, as if to imply that her job is done and i need to check out. no attempts to fix anything, or improve anything. she literally walked over and leaned on the register counter and started staring out the front windows. of note, she also didn't say a single thing to me during the haircut. no "how's your day", "any plans for the holidays", etc. she just wanted to get the haircut over with. i believe the haircut lasted 7 minutes total..i still plan on going to great clips, as i've had great experiences in the past. i've definitely let store managers know when their stylists do great jobs and are very personable (i.e. maria at great clips on s halsted is phenomenal). but i felt the need to warn people about this stylist in particular.

god why didn't i read these reviews first!!! horrible what a joke this place is they should be ashamed of themselves and they're not "stylists" there butchers. my hair was beautiful before walking into this place and i should have walked out the min this guy said they don't flat iron or style just damp blow dry. i always go to great clips so i figured this place would be fine. hey jerk off if you don't know what an inch is look down your pants. i specifically said 1 inch not 10. my hair was as long as my arm now it's a little longer then shoulders length. i stopped him 5 times and told him he was cutting it to short and then he wants to argue with me!!! are you kidding me!!!!! then has the nerve to say is it ok do i have a choice anymore.  stay away from this place you give all great clips and quick service salons a bad name

want a cheap haircut, expect a cheap result.....i went to see gilma today who gave me what might have been the worst haircut of my life. i don't need much as i'm a 2 on the sides and needed a general trim. my bangs are completely uneven as she chose to cut it without using the brush to ensure evenness. it turned out completely uneven with a gap in the middle. i asked her to please even out the front and she free eyed it again. now my bangs are   short compared to the rest of my hair and still uneven. i'm going to another shop to see if they can fix this mistake as i can't go into a work setting looking like this. if you need a buzz cut, sure come here. if you're a business person, i'd avoid.

what's so great about great clips, i ain't never goin back againcut my bangs down to the quiff, made me look like a lesbiansittin in that chair with a thousand yard stair, anything to kill timegot a b***** names sally byrd, committing a hate crimei tipped you too, tanya. how you gonna mess up a 4 guard with a 2 guard - unless you're rick pettinos trying to play zone defense.-db

luis was fantastic! i was in town for a conference and in desperate need of a haircut, this was open until 6 and walking distance. the staff was courteous and professional, i showed luis a picture of what i wanted and he got it done in 20 minutes, with quick precision. he was a consummate professional and i could not be happier. i've had haircuts that were twice as expensive and took twice as long and were only half as satisfying! would definitely recommend. great quality for a great value

less than average. in first place i never felt welcome and was never greeted well on arrival. haircut was decently done - but below expectations. it was a dry experience overall.on review of the recent haircut after the shower, i  noticed it was a cut horribly done..completely uneven on my head and very unprofessionally dealt with..cant believe i even tipped for this..never going back there..
stay away from luis. he seriously messed up my hair. the couple of other times i am cut my hair here i have had no issues but this time was really bad.

we went there to get my husband a much required haircut. checked in online beforehand which is great. you get coupon for a dollar off with your receipt so don't forget to bring it next time. they have a regulars card as well where you collect points and you get a free haircut after a particular points value. now about haircut, my husband is hard to please when it comes to his hair but he was satisfied with the cut. we will be going there again surely. i think it's a good place for male haircuts with a decent price of 15$ only. with coupons and points it gets even better.

went i for a cut before important meeting, the guy who cut it just lopped it off as i wasn't even facing mirror, i always go to great clips in columbus and had to get it recut the next day when i was home. my regular stylist said "how long did he take, five minutes??? what did he use to cut it??" she was able to restyle it the way it should look and i will never go back to the one in chicago. had to pay for two cuts in one week but second one worth it.

the staff was courteous. the experience was the same as any other great clips i've gone too. quick, affordable, and friendly. i was glad that this location was near my hotel as i needed a last minute haircut.

my hair is easy to cut and i'm not super anal about my hair anyway. the lady that cut my hair never attempted to talk to me, which didn't really bother me but a simple "hello, how are you?" would have been nice. she cut my hair exactly how i wanted and was done in about 10 mins. i'm all about saving time when it comes to haircuts. i have much better things to do then sit in that chair and wonder what the hell is the blue stuff the combs sit in comprised of.
they have new staff who i guess are first timers. they are generally good but i had a bad experience last time
john did a great job .. in and out fastreasonably priced  in a good location

my hair is kind of sad--it's thin, long, straight, i dye it with the same $7 box of hair dye every 6 weeks, and i don't have any layers in it. so i balk at the prospect of spending $50+ on a haircut. this is why i love great clips--cheap, quick, and gets the job done. granted, because i have long hair and i just get 1.5inch trims, there's a very low likelihood that someone can mess it up. i'm not sure i would come here for anything more complicated than that. i went for the first time today to this brand new location, and i'm glad i did. there was actually a 40-minute wait, but they happily took down my name and i left to go shopping for a bit. when i came back, i got right in. amber was a great stylist--extremely friendly and helpful. today they were running a $9.99 special--i'm not sure how long that extends. one of these days, i should probably realize that i'm a "professional" and should pay good money for my hair. until then, there's great clips.

debbie was great! i'd gone way too long without a cut (months) and needed a quick cut before an 11am gig. i didn't know anywhere else i could get a quick walk in so i apprehensively went here. so glad i did! i've gotten $60 cuts routinely in the past but debbie made my cut look just as good for $15! plus! i checked in on fb as a newbie and got $5 off! so boom: $10 hair cut and a new go-to stylist.

needed a quick haircut so i walked in without an appointment and was assigned to this guy..he was so unskilled and clumsy with the razor/scissors, he must have at least grazed my neck area 2-3 times!  at one time, he even grazed my ears so badly that it started to bleed..no apologies whatsoever and he didn't even bother cleaning up the blood..haircut was pretty bad too..wasn't happy with it at all..reminded me why i avoid places like this...i did't catch his name, but he's of hispanic origins i think...avoid!
probably the worst salon ever. i tried three different people at this place and they are sucked.

you get what you pay for at great clips.  i've been to them twice and they either cut it too short or too long, and don't bother asking me if i like it or not.  i realize they're one of the bargain basement hair salons, but i've been to hair cuttery many times, and they've always done a stellar job.  the difference is communication, which the great clips stylists need to learn.

i went to joe's barbershop in chicago for a few years, and while i appreciated the great work by joe and his cadre of barbers, i got to a point where i didn't have 2 hours to give to wait in line for a haircut.i have been going to this great clips for over a year now. it's close to work and i really like being able to check in online and then jump in a chair right when i get there. i've had quite a few different women cut my hair and all have done a great job. $17 is fair price and they have haircut sales now and then, which is nice. highly recommend if you have easy to cut hair and need to get in and out quick.
worst haircut i've ever had. i'm not sure the lady that cut my hair could be trusted with a steak knife.
horrible is the word. a young lady did the haircut. no sectioning of the hair just snipping from any directions. without a doubt it turned out asymmetrical. never going back.

i been coming to this greatclips for over a year and it's always been a great experience. online check-in is useful, it will save you time! my stylist ariana is absolutely amazing! she is super friendly, professional, and she understands what you want. i will definitely recommend this great clips to a friend.
had a great experience at the great clips at presidential towers. the staff was very friendly plus the cut was great. this is definitely going to be my go to spot for a haircut!
this is my second time coming to this location. great experience both time. first time i had monica and this second time i had ariana. both great! will definitely come back again.

i'm a huge fan of this place for a three main reasons: 1. the location is amazing for those that work in the area2. checking in ahead of time via the app or their website is incredibly convenient and a huge time saver3. in my experience the stylists there do an amazing job and are super friendlyi typically go after work on thursdays while danny and/or sam are working - one or the other has been cutting my hair every few weeks for a little over a year now and i am always satisfied with how their cuts turn out. i'll switch my hair style up every now and then and they are both very good at hearing me out for what i'm looking for and translating it into a finished product. danny actually cut and styled my hair in the weeks leading up to my wedding in march 2016 and i will forever be grateful, i received numerous comments on how polished it looked. as long as they are working at this location it will continue to be my go-to hair cut stop!

efficient check in process with their online app. they get super busy during peak times, like lunch and 5pm, so definitely download the app and check in online. at times they will sell their "great card" where you can pre-purchase haircuts for $9.99. if you are regular customer, this is a great value.
super convenient location. really nice people, you can tell the owner really cares and it flows from there.

ok seriously all these chain haircut places are the same right?  super cuts, great clips, hair cutlery?  yes!   well, usually...that is, unless  you visit this particular great clips.  i feel these chains all hire the latest licensed stylists right off the hair-u bus, the good ones get experience and move to a  fancy salon.  if thats really the case, this location has amazing campus recruiters b/c all the stylists are awesome!  but, what is more likely realistic is here you have quality experienced stylists and not newbies.  thankfully that means you won't have the roll-the-dice after check-in and hope you get the good one experience - here they're all great!!!  disclaimer:  i'm not 24 anymore and wearing the latest bieber or whatever is trending hair style, nor do i have the same amount of hair i had when i was 24 (damn you propecia side effects...) so all i require is a pretty simple cut and they do an amazing job.bonus: near work and open early and can check wait time online?  score!  did i just get excited about a chain haircut place...? don't tell anyone, mmmmkay?

i have low expectations for any kind of great clips, super cuts, sport clips, or any other mass-produced high volume places where guys can get a haircut for 10 bucks. and, yeah i still only go to those places.   but, seriously, this is the worst great clips i've ever been to.   both times i've been there, my hair came out looking totally uneven, and the salonists who work there were super spacey and bordering on rude.   only redeeming feature to this place is that it's close to work. even the great clips on elston ave is far better.

hair cut was ok however the hair dresser messed up my side locks as she was in a hurry to finish up & attend to other customers. this was my second time so i would not recommend this place to anyone. the first time experience was just fine, hair dresser was a bit curt but i guess it has to do with the fact that this is a big chain so they do not really care. now the second time they have really messed up big time - went there the second time only because i live in pt.will not recommend this place to anyone.

i'm a fan. great value haircuts for $16, and the barbers are friendly. this venue fulfills both location and speed, with very experienced salonists. on a weekday evening, most of the customers were male. i wish i remembered my barber's name.will be back.

where do i start. i'm on a student budget and have been going to this establishment for years because the prices are under $20. today was the last time i step foot in great clips. the hot and ready of haircuts has officially pushed me away. over the years i've had a few minor issues but i've always gone back because mistakes happen (and i'm broke) but this is it. my hair is pretty easy to cut. 2 on the sides and leave it longer on top. they save your information in their system because turnover at these places are higher than 2012 gas prices. this lady called my name and right away i knew i was f*****. she was dressed like we were at underground on a saturday night. she confirmed what i wanted (2 on the sides and longer on top) but said "eh that doesn't look good, i got you". she didn't "get me" guys. this chick went ham on my head. cut the hell out of it like she was salt bae and i was some lean sirloin fresh out the grill. i kept telling her over and over to please keep it long but she wasn't listening. all she was hearing was snip snip snip snip snip. i couldn't jump out of the chair because i didn't want to walk out with half a hair cut, but now i realized i should have done that. i started to give in and looked into her eyes noticing that my displeasure was kind of turning her on. it was as if she took a lawnmower to my head.  i don't know what i did to deserve this. finally she stopped cutting my hair and she ran to get hair gel. i told her "no please don't i'm about to go home and shower". she didn't care, she dumped a bucket of pomade on my head and made me look like a jersey shore character. at this point, i wanted to cry. i was about to jump from the seat but she held me down and started shaving my eyebrows( no joke). i started laughing uncontrollably and i begged her to stop. "nope, i'm not letting you leave here with these eyebrows like that". i finally escaped fearing that she was going to shave my legs and arms. paid with no tip and ran out. i currently look like a circumcised penis but i've learned my lesson. spend $20 guys. god bless.

yup i am giving this review 5 stars - as good as it gets. before i moved back to chicago i hadn't paid for a hair cut in over 2 years. my friend was a stylist. she would cut my hair every two weeks if not every week and never charged me for it. i cringed at the thought of someone else cutting my hair - screwing it up - and having to pay for it.well i went to a few places before i visited the west loop great clips. i originally had danny cut my hair. he was good, had great conversation, and was pretty consistent. life wasn't so bad. then one day i met sam. she cut my hair since danny wasn't available. i was immediately in love with the cut. she was great, easy going, and best of all took the direction i gave her and made my hair look awesome.however, its not just her talent that is making me come back consistently. her customer service is exceptional and it shone through during my last visit. my last visit i decided to take a sunday run to do my errands. before i got to great clips i severely sprained my ankle but was still able to hobble to the store front (barely). sam went above and beyond during this visit. after she cut my hair she took a break and assisted me to wal-mart. she insisted i rested while she got the appropriate aids to take care of my ankle.  she went above and beyond and i am forever grateful.thanks again sam! you made a customer for life!

lately i have been choosing businesses that are conveniently located to either work or home. this great clips fit the bill and they are synonymous for affordable haircuts. i gave them a chance and i was very pleased with my first trim. jasmine put my previous 30 plus dollar haircut to shame.this recently opened location on madison sits a street level connected to one the presidential towers. very clean as one would expect, brand new build, and welcoming staff. you can check-in online and arrive within 20 minutes and you get to hop the line. almost like an appointment but different. if you can't check beforehand your name gets added to the queue when you arrive. i haven't had to wait more than 10 minutes at this location after work. the stylist keeps notes on each visit so there is no guessing the next time you come in. they pay attention to the details and provide you with what you want. this is important when providing a service and they do it well.men's haircuts run $15.99 and they seem to hand out coupons on the street often. first time at his location? your next visit will run you $6.99. they also offer a prepaid gift card providing 5 cuts for $49.99 and you get that haircut free when purchasing. you do the math it's a good deal.

i found this gem about a block away from ogilve transportation center, where i work. i walked in and was immediately taken care of. my haircut was fast, cheap, and exactly aligned with my specifications. i am pleased with the results, and will make a return appearance!
the hairstylist sam is great here.  she understands what you want.  she is careful, efficient, and friendly.

i passed by at saturday and asked about something they told me it called " outline trimming"i went there today and asked for the " outline trimming " and told him i don't want to cut my hair cuz i want to grow it tall but he gave me a haircut. i kept telling him that i only want the outline trimming and he kept saying he have to cut a little bit so it blind in. then he called it a misunderstanding and wanted to charge me for the haircut ...i think this is my last visit to them

worst salon ever !! you would rather not visit this place !! only this store at presidential towers is bad other great clips stores are better !! the staff come up with lamest excuses not to take up appointments ... bad customer service !!

environment: (1/5)only one employee at the time. there was a man sitting directly behind you in a small room with security cameras, staring at you and the stylist the entire time. very awkward and i felt very uncomfortable.  very small space and felt cramped. service: (4/5)stylist was great.  gave me recommendations based off my style and the products i use. very helpful and was very thorough. appreciated the time she put into giving me a haircut that i liked. pricing (2/5)with tip this cut cost me around twenty bucks. i'm sorry but if i'm going to a greatclips, then i'm going for affordability.
terrible experience, maryan golzanez a name like this...she ruined my hair!she cut my hair so bad i am very very very very sad with her work. dont go there

walked in with no wait. hair cut with alex started immediately and went really well. she was professional, nice, and made me very comfortable. the hair cut looks good too! will definitely be going back.

i've been coming here for about 4 months and usually they're pretty consistent. however, today is the final straw. today, i think they have a new hire and she completely destroys my hair. i had a combover look and in 5 minutes she turns it into a fohawk/mohawk. wtf?! i told her i wanted a one on the sides and thin out the top keeping the same length. literally i can not emphasize how simple the cut can be. i give people the benefit of the doubt but she just uses the razor and shaved away. in my mind, i knew i wasted ~15 dollars. maria is the only best stylist for men's haircut, but i was never fortunate enough to actually book an appointment with her. but seriously, bruh do you guys hire ladies who says they know how to cut hair and they actually don't? do you even train them? my hair legit looks almost like puck's hair from glee! how can you mess it up!!!!! how?!?!?!?!? peace out great clips.

terrible. short latino lady cut my hair and literally the entire time would not stop critiquing my hair! yes i know i have split ends... which is why im here. i never once asked her her opinion yet from start to finish she kept making rude comments about my hair cut, dye job, and apparent damage. like calm down, thats no way to treat a customer.horrible experience.

i didn't even want to give one star. i never do bad reviews but the "workers" here didn't have the courtesy to greet me at the door. she insisted on engaging in her conversation rather than assisting the customer. i see why there was no one in the facility. you would think they're closed because the barbers are not working. terrible service. matter of fact i can't even say that because i wasn't serviced. they probably would have jacked me up anyway.

i highly suggest you make an appointment to come here because you'll find yourself waiting 40-60 minutes after lunch hours. you can make an appointment online and it's super easy. all of the barbers are great and they all have their own ways of cutting hair. my hair style is super easy, i usually just get the fade with a scissor cut on top and these guys do an excellent job with it. it's $13 without tip. you can walk over from uic, or meter park on halsted. make sure you make an appointment otherwise you'll be sitting their bored for an hour.

bad experience!i have been coming to this great clips (our family) for years and the experience we've had worsened throughout the years (it is close to home). we purchased a great clips card (with discount) and each time when my teenage daughter comes in for a haircut (twice),the card machine does not work. first, they don't tell you that it does not work when you come in, when her haircut was done they told her the card machine is not working and my daughter felt so embarrased (the staff were all just standing around her talking to each other that she should be charged full price without consideration [she can hear them talking like she was not there- rude and without manners]) and they insisted that she pay the full price. second, they have poor choice of staff (beware!). the people who have been working here definitely lack customer service. we will not be coming back. we would rather travel a couple of miles than go back to this salon in halsted st. it won't be missed. i would not recommend this place, you can find other salon with reasonable price with "fine" customer service.

i generally review after a few times to get a better understanding of a business. in general they do their job, simple and quick. i recently had two haircuts there and found one of their employees to be racist. this is a very bad way to treat customers. there are other employees who are mexican who treat customers better. i would suggest great clips management to better train employees on social diversity as they clearly lack experience in communication towards a multicultural group of customers.

this place is a total joke! check-in online only to arrive and have them take walk-in after walk-in ahead of us. brought my three sons in for haircuts and it took 20 minutes of arguing because i would not register them under their own phone numbers. who the hell are they, the nsa? the woman told me that they need it "to monitor their haircuts." i told them they do not need my childrens' phone numbers nor do they need to monitor my childrens' haircuts. then today was the last straw. i checked in online and arrived only to have them take walk-ins ahead of me, again. bye, felicia.
dont go to this place, one african american woman fucked up my hair.... donot go here, and donot deal with her.peace

very nice job. i am actually very particular about my bangs and length. based on the reviews i was hesitant at first but given my budget and the convenience of location, i gave this place a shot. honestly, if you want ombres and the fancier services then go somewhere else. for $13, i was delighted that i could get the same quality and style cut i paid $35-50 at my regular salon. even if it's just a trim and style cut. i had julia and she was great. i waited about 5 minutes before being seen and julia took less than 20 minutes to finish my style. quick, simple and affordable place. but be aware that their services and capacity are limited.

i needed a haircut and found this place while driving by one day at about 11:00am on a weekday. my hair is curly and i wear it medium length. i did not have a wait. fern spoke to me and asked me what i wanted. she took the time to show me some pictures. she gave me a great layered cut. she had good suggestions and was very attentive. i paid $13.00 for the cut. i also bought a good product she recommended for my frizzy hair.i advise anyone who is on a budget and needs a decent haircut to give this place a try.

i have short hair. i don't need to spend more than $15 for a haircut. came here on a weekday morning where they have a $10 haircut deal if it's before noon. if you come here after then or during the weekend, i believe it's $14. since i'm a guy and my hair is short, it was done quickly and efficiently. if you need a fancier cut and you believe you're high maintenance, go to paul mitchell across the street and do all that head massage and such. how do you if you're high maintenance? one way to tell is check your bottle of shampoo and see if you paid $50 or not for it. if you have a family size head and shoulders from costco because you thought it was a good deal or your mom bought it for you, then this place is for you. fyi, my wife buys my shampoo.   if you like to keep it simple and short, walk-ins are welcomed. it's a haircut. it will grow back if you are unhappy with it. i was happy with after my first visit. as long as they don't spit in my hair, i'm good. i will see all you fellow head and shoulder shampooers here in the future. all others, i'll see you crossing the street to the paul mitchell. who the heck is paul mitchell anyways? he's madonna's stylist or something?

for the last 2 years i walk down to this location about every 10 days to get a buzz cut, very simple and quick. the last 6 times i have waited close to an hour and have had at least 3-4 people go ahead of me that checked in online. if you don't appreciate walk ins then take it off your advertisement. additionally i always get a hair cut and shampoo and can't remember not paying at least 25 bucks, because they work hard. they are way to under staffed and i will no longer be coming here. the manager obviously does not care about customers
i've been very happy with my haircuts from cecilia here.  she listens and cuts my hair better than much pricier salons. and i've had terrible experiences across the street at paul mitchell.

first of all, why the heck are you looking at great clips! there is a wonderful paul mitchell's *right across the street*. if you need a haircut more complicated than a buzz, call up paul mitchell's and book an appointment with their level 2 trainees (about to graduate). it costs 15$ and will be one of the best haircuts you can get in chicago.so why do i come to great clips? because i'm lazy and don't need to make an appointment. i get a 4 on top and a 2 on the sides and i'm done with it - 20 to 30 minutes on a saturday. even that can be a bit dodgy though (how can you not cut my hair evenly using a freakin' buzzer!).

great clips is, as a chain, nothing special.  but today, i was in the neighborhood, and needed a quick haircut.  cecilia was friendly, efficient, and left me with a respectable looking haircut.  here's a hint for folks-- don't expect a $100 haircut for $13.  you get what you pay for.  these quick mchaircut places never promised you a $100 cut.    but, if you're fairly low-maintenance, are looking a bit of a beast and need your 'do' trimmed, this great clips will meet your needs.

i come here every 2-3 weeks to get my fade or faux hawk done by maria or whoever is on staff.  the girls all have their different methods of giving fades, but the end result is normally pretty good.  they keep your "style" in their computer so when you come back they already know what kind of hair cut you normally get.  while the price of $13 for a haircut is high for a fade, they do a good job overall so i can't complain.  depending on when you arrive, there could be a 15-20 min wait, but again it depends if you come after work which could be busier, or just during a weekday (9-5) its not so busy.overall for the type of hairstyle i get, they do a great job.

just took my nearly 3-year old boy in for a haircut and was very happy with the result.  his hair is fine and curly, and i wanted to keep the curls but shape it up.  the woman (leticia?) was nice and patient and she did exactly what i asked her to do.  she also trimmed my 1-year old's bangs. total cost was $11. i should add that i've always taken my boys to snippets or kid snips in the past (yeah, i know), and this was just as good.  will definitely keep coming back.

this place is great. i use their app to reserve a spot for my haircut, and i never have to wait more than five minutes after i get there to get started (frequently i don't have to wait at all). the stylists are great at what they do, and they're always friendly. the affordable price is great, too!

style: mid-long face frame with long layers, rounded back, and point cut. when i was checked my hair at the end of the cut, sue assured it was beautiful and perfect for me.  once i got home to check again with better lighting, i noticed the back was jagged, the layers were choppy, and no point cutting was used.  so i went back to get it fixed.  sue assured me she did it correctly and used a point cut method.  she kept defending the cut, and saying it was fine.  thankfully, edith was kind enough to fix my hair.  she apologized for sue's attitude, and did exactly what i asked for.  edith made nice conversation and wanted to make sure everything was the way i wanted it to be.  my hair looks great now.  she also gave a coupon for the whole mishap.  next time i'll be requesting edith to cut my hair.

so i came in for a hair cut for my son for school pictures tomorrow. he grew his hair for the past 4 months to be able to get it styled the way he wanted. this lady went took it to about 2 inches from his scalp! i'm so livid! the ugly hair phase he had to go thru just to do it all over again. uugghhhjoel's hair cut came out great. the white haired lady does a great job.

hi, i visit to great clips once a month. you cannot beat the parking, there's plenty of it.my stylist this time was kristina. i had never had her before. she seemed to know a lot about cutting hair and gave me plenty of interesting advice. in the end i walked out with a haircut that i really liked. you cannot beat the price of a cut here and you never have to wait very long. i liked kristina and would sign up with her again.

sloppy cuts, don't go. uneven neck line, got one sideburn cut higher than the other. also i've never been able to see the same stylist. there's always new faces. other than that they're fine but won't be returning.

samantha cut my hair well, chatted up the bristol renaissance faire, video games, and the angst of adulthood. friendly staff and good value. other favorite stylists are sue, diana, and esperanza (hope i spelled that right).
my new go to place for haircuts since i moved to bridgeport. everyone is always nice, i always get served quick, the quality of my haircuts are always good, i def recommend!

one of the worst great clips in the states. the inexperienced stylist does not even care about what customer says. the just want to finish up early that's it and go home. she didn't even spend 10 minutes for hair cut, according to them greatclips is supposed to work  very fast. she even told me don't tell me what i have to do and don't argue.

my last visit about a month ago i arrived before 1pm was told i could get the early bird price.  sue cut my hair and when i got ready to pay, she said i got there later & charged me the higher price.  i also heard her whisper to the other stylist to charge customers the higher price.  i thought that sounded rather unprofessional,  especially since i could hear her.  she used to be customer friendly.   she will never cut my hair again.   she always seems to like to use the shaver without asking if it's okay.   it burns my skin.

i had such an awful experience here yesterday. i have been growing my pixie out for the majority of the year, so all i needed was the back trimmed and i wanted it thinned out a little. i had gotten my hair cut here before by this stylist, i wish i knew her name. she told me very rudely that thinning it was wrong, and i politely told her i prefer how it lays when it's thinned out. long story short i walked out of here with the back 3 inches of my hair shaved and the top left long. i was literally in tears when i got home and saw how bad it was. i was forced to go to another salon to get it fixed and the stylist laughed and said it looked like a mushroom. the only way she could fix it was to cut in back into a pixie. all the time i spent growing my hair down the drain..and stupid me still tipped this woman. the other stylists are very nice,  but i will never come here again after yesterday.

it's last minute on sunday at 5pm and this was basically my only option. i think this place is only good for simple haircuts. i went in there with hair up to my butt and the shortest length past my shoulders. i specified that i wanted it cut shorter in a simple v-shape, no crazy layers, to have the length at about my bra strap and the shortest starting below my chin. i got off the chair with the length i wanted but the shortest was above my chin. there were basically two noticeable layers-nowhere near v-shape and was not even. i'm not one to complain about a haircut but as soon as i walked out of there i cried my eyes out. never have i ever had such a bad haircut experience. i was told i didn't have to pay and was offered to come back the next day to have it fixed. honestly i'm going to pass. i'm not going to chance it and rather go to my usual stylist. i thank the lady for spending so much time on my hair because there was so much of it and it's thick. but i will never go back to any great clips again.

the older lady was so rude! my boyfriends haircut turned out soooooo ugly. i asked politely for her to trim the bangs and she questioned if i was a stylist and if i even know about styles. i'm like can you trim it? she raised her voice and said no no no no no no thats the style. idk what style that is, but the haircut is ugly. when she was fixing my boyfriends haircut, she was so rude and kept on instigating an argument. i don't even know why!!! the chinese lady cut better hair.

this place is unprofessional.  the manager eddy is a thief.  she will take your money for a gift card and not give you credit.  she is dishonest.  the owner marylou pretends not to know that the staff is stealing, but won't do anything to change it.  don't trust these people with your credit cards.

i was not at all satisfied. first- i only went here because it was close and i needed a desperate trim. i got there and the wait was fine.. the staff was friendly and the facility was clean! i checked in at the front desk and asked for a wash and cut. when it was my turn - the last took me straight to the chair without washing my hair at all! (at the time it wasn't a big deal because i had showered the night before.) my haircut took about 5 minutes (which is unusual because i had hair halfway down my back and it's super thick). at the time it looked fine but who really knew.. i got home and went to put my hair in a braid and bam!! my hair is uneven and all these hairs stick out and aren't long enough to complete the braid. the next day i straightened my hair and could see the unevenness and physically had to take scissors and even it out. needless to say i will never be going back here and i suggest you just stick to a salon that you know will provide you with a great service.

walked in and was immediately attended by sammi. i had a great experience and will be definitely coming back. i had curly thick hair that was hard to manage, especially with a toddler running around. sammi took in what i felt and she worked miracles on my hair. she gave me a long bob cut and made my hair soft and easy to style. it's so light weight and fun. she made great conversation and made me feel very comfortable considering i was cutting my hair short for the first time. she attended to my every concern and answered all of my questions. thank you sammi for my amazing new hair!
paid $12 for a cut and wash which turned out to be great, listened to exactly what i wanted and gave me the perfect haircut! thanks josephine
alma rocks! not all listen and are as talented, but now i ask for her exclusively. i'm a regular at this location.
love this place!!! all of the barbers are outstanding and fast, especially edith! overall, this place is nevet busy and always consistent no matter what time you come!!!

online check in available. very nice hairdressers. quick quick service. just the way i like it. i also love how they have my last haircut details saved in their system. definitely use the app. also, great price.

i have curly hair which many stylist have a hard time cutting because they are unexperienced. at great clips i love going there because sue the stylist knows exactly what to do with my curly hair. she understands maybe because she too has curly hair, lol. that helps also i can tell she is an experienced hair stylist. i only go when she is there, keep up the great work sue!

the stars aligned on my first visit to this great clips location in lincoln square. i got a good quick haircut from a stylist who was professional, friendly, and polite. and it was cheap.random factors worked in my favor. susana was the stylist on duty. her work was efficient and correct. clearly, this young woman has good training and experience. she's is also friendly, personable, and bright. i happen to like smart people, especially when there's no escape. you know what i mean, fellow yelpers. you're a prisoner in that chair while the stylist works. being forced to listen to a someone's inane chatter, especially when it's punctuated with "like", "you know", "basically", or any other filler words, will drive you nuts. susana was articulate, bright, and personable. i actually enjoyed chatting with her.things that could go wrong with a visit to great clip went right with me. susana was on duty by herself, and she had no customers when i arrived. that was great for me, because i didn't have to wait. but i imagine it could be a different situation if several customers come in around the same time, and there's only the one stylist working. there could definitely be a serious wait.susana mentioned that business is slower on a cold day, and the day of my visit was frigid. also, i went on a weekday morning, a time that typically is slow. i can't speak to how busy great clips is at other time, but considering that there are six work stations, the place must get busy.i paid $13.00 for a cut and blow dry that i liked very much. there is an additional charge if you want your hair washed. it's rare for me to give any business a 5-star rating, but i don't have one single criticism of my great cuts experience.just one thing, which is not the fault of the business -- the parking lot is metered! you do have to pay for parking. that's one thing that has always annoyed me about visiting the businesses in this small strip mall. as a long-time chicagoan, i hate hate hate paying for parking. i parked on a side street and walked a block. no biggie.

i went in with my 11 month old baby today. and he has serious hair growth every few months. wanted to give great clips as try. i normally get it done from another local barber. i understand my baby will cry his lungs out and hates getting his haircut but never has my kid ever had a horrible haircut. the lady at the counter told me how the stylist was a pro at cutting baby hair. my baby's first birthday is around the corner and i dont know what to do. the front is uneven. and has huge dents. the sides are unevenly faded. its a disaster. had another guy complaining while i was there that the stylist went too high .

i went in spur-of-the-moment because i really wanted a haircut immediately and no one else was open or available before 10 am. the haircut was pretty bad. not quite even and with a chunk of hair shorter in the back. i pointed this out to the hairdresser, who insisted it was just layers. i didn't make a big deal out of it because my hair grows out pretty fast and i never stress about it. but she knew -- she couldn't even look me in the eye when i paid. on the upside, the shampoo included a very nice scalp massage.

i desperately needed my long hair cut, but my regular salon was closed. i wanted 4" cut off in long layers and bangs trimmed. i searched around for salons that were open after 7pm. i called ahead & was told i could walk-in. hours are super convenient! online reservations are available. i walked there, but there is ample car parking. extremely clean & bright. very friendly staff. i discussed what i wanted with susana. she skillfully cut my hair exactly as i requested. i could not be more satisfied with the result! i highly recommend susana at this salon. i was regularly going to a small, independent salon for many years, but it closed permanently. i work late, and needed a salon with hours that fit my schedule. i have had my haircut at a franchise salon once or twice in my life, because of convenience, but it's not my preference. i was so happy with my experience here that i have decided to make this my new regular salon. why would i pay boutique salon prices when i can get a beautiful style and great customer service for less?convenient & affordable!
great price, nice hair cuts, talented employees. if your hair cut is pretty straight forward, this is the place to go!
had a great haircut yesterday. my haircut is a bob style and its actually never looked better!! thanks for the great haircut and excellent customer service.

been going here for a while. really like the girls that work there. they are friendly & accomidating. my hair dresser's name is belkis. she really knows how to cut hair. even thou i moved to the burbs, i will make the trip in just to get my hair cut here. prices are reasonable, place is clean. love it.
friendly staff and bekys took care of me. very professional and very experienced. also friendly and made me feel welcomed. great haircut!!
stopped in yesterday and had a boy's cut by susana. she did a terrific job, was personable and really knows what she's doing, would give 6 stars if we could! will definitely be back!

a perfectly fine place to get in and out for a hair cut.  employees are kind and somewhat efficient.   prices are inline with the going rate for a chain haircut in the area.  place is clean.    you can check in online to avoid the wait, but there is usually not much of a queue even on the weekends.   no free parking, which is a bit of an annoyance.

took my daughter here today for her first shampoo and cut. sonia was great made my daughter comfortable. franchise that feels like neighborhood salon. love app with check in.  parking lot with meters available
what a great, friendly neighborhood spot for a haircut.
the lady was very nice. she did a good job and i was taken care of promptly. we're good here.

okay, let's start with what you're probably thinking -  it's a great clips so the cuts aren't that good. and maybe you're thinking that this is just another chain coming to take out the independent shops in lincoln square.and to you folks, i say - you're probably right. howeveri rather enjoyed the cut i received at this location. the shop is brand new, so everything was fresh and clean. the service was excellent (they brought in stylists from other great clips to easy the transition) and the online check in was actually pretty cool. instead of sitting there waiting for a cut, i checked in online and showed up exactly when it told me to and i was escorted right to a chair in front of other people. it's a time saver. as for the not so good cuts, i think if you like your hair cut a particular way or want to pamper yourself a bit, this wouldn't be the right place. but for me, a guy who just wants a short fade cut, it's perfect. i was in and out in 20 minutes, didn't feel robbed when it came time to pay, and left knowing i'd be back.

i only gave 3 stars because matthew was an awesome person and great customer service! i was a walk in and no one was there so was taken promptly. i gave him a great tip for him being so good at asking what i wanted; however, he cut my hair waaaaay too short! i can tell he knew he messed up and tried to cover it up, but by the end of my haircut, my head looked like a tennis ball with how he styled it. completely way off from what i wanted which was shoulder length hair with texture at the bottoms and swept bangs.  he's an awesome guy and probably cuts men's hair better since he said he has a lot of experience cutting men's hair. i should've listened to my intuition and stuck with my salon with the high prices but great results. the good thing about hair is that it grows... but never again going to a great clips!
i have nothing but raves for this location!! i walked in and got the exact cut i wanted by jj. he is awesome!!! thanks for my new look! i will be back!

i was in the area running errands. i dont know why but i finally wanted to get my haircut. i walked in and debbie took me right away. she is so friendly and did a great job on my hair. it's a bit of a drive from home but i'm definitely coming back to have debbie cut my hair.

they have been amazing with my severely dd son. he is cooperative but it takes a few tries to get him to understand basic instructions, and he tends to like to look around and sing loudly with the radio. they are so patient and kind yet his haircut takes no longer than anyone else's and ends up perfect. he loves it so much there that he's become brand loyal and won't go anywhere else. he has specific stylists that even want to work with him now which is so sweet, and they all do a fabulous job.they also did an amazing job with my teen daughter as well, who showed a photo on her phone of some funky cut. i wasn't sure a chain was the place to go - it was so specific and she's very particular - but it ended up amazing, took like 20 minutes tops, and she was so happy with it. she's gone back for variations and every time, it's just what she wants. there is a little section of the waiting area set aside for kids with books, a few toys in decent condition/clean, and the online check in is definitely the way to go if you don't want to wait long or want to check times before you go. i cannot recommend them more highly. just pay the parking...it's pay to park although great clips has nothing to do with that, be aware, that lot gets checked.
not sure what the $9.99 advertisement is but i was told $13 when i asked about $9.99?free parking on sunday yea!
nice lady to cut my hair! highly recommend if u need something simple and cheap, even a bit complex
