solid $14 haircut, i've been looking for a local bargain place to get a stylish haircut for men. i definitely found it here this place is super updated on the inside and staff is pretty knowledgable of what they're doing. i got my cut with darlene i believe, needless to say i was content with my haircut i will be back.

many people look down on chain places like this. you tell them what you want or if you want it the same as last time they save it. i love the online check in on the app. they always do a good job for a fair price for me and always take time and care with my hair focusing on the details. i love this place and have been using this franchise for a while, but this location is always above and well beyond others. good stylists and kept running this well by excellent management probably goes up to the owner. this will now be my only location i visit. they take care of me well. thank you. please stay around with superb service for a long, long time.

having shoulder surgery and not able to use my right arm i have been getting my long hair washed and flat ironed.  today, being in a hurry and not able to get to the salon i typically have been going to , i made the mistake of choosing great clips in addison,texas.  i checked in  when i left my house and my wait at that time was 15 minutes. but, when i got to the salon i waited an additional 30 minutes before being served. then,  incompetent stylist, an older hispanic woman, soaked my back while washing my hair and then put the soaking wet towel back on my neck and shoulders. i made her take it off. then unbelievably, she could not figure out how to turn on the flat iron  and had to get help from another stylist.  from there i knew i was in trouble.  she barely dried my hair and started to attempt to use the flat iron,which if you know anything about flat ironing, would have fried my hair. fortunately, i looked over at the manager, darleen, who came over and tried to help the stylist at which point i asked to just dry my hair and let me out of there.  my stylist couldn't even pull that off and the manager again tried to help. at this point i just told them to finish drying my hair without styling. at the checkout counter the stylist tried to charge me a for a shampoo and full blow dry/style until the manager told her that she couldn't do that and only charged me for a shampoo.  i have never not left a tip but this time i refused to. in addition, i have been to several upscale salons in the dallas area and have paid a reasonable amount for the same service. had this experience gone flawlessly, at this low cost chain salon, the cost they quoted me when i got there would have been for the shampoo and then another $40.00 for the flat iron which is an outrageous amount of money!  i plan on calling corporate office of great clips on monday and sharing this with the district manager. awful, awful experience!!

i've been going here since 1997, yes, that's 14 years.  why do i keep going here?  because i'm a creature of habit and don't like change.  i know what to expect and my expectations are almost always met, sometimes exceeded.  when i was unemployed and volunteering full time, the stylists wouldn't accept a tip from me, that's probably a pretty good reason too.at regular price, the haircut is a little pricey.  but i almost never pay full price.  previously, they had a $50 gift card that you could get a free haircut, so it was, 4 haircuts for the price of 3.  not too shaggy, i mean shabby.  they stopped doing that and went to the $9.99 unlimited haircut gift card.  buy as many haircuts as you want for $9.99 but they had to be purchased before a certain day.  i bought 10.  recently, they had a card that gave you two free haircuts in april, deeply discounted in may, somewhat discounted in june, so on so forth.  not too bad, plus you can get coupons in the money mailer for $6.99.i've seen many a hair stylist come and go and i'd say the experience and talent of the stylists has remained the same.  some are better than others, but i'm not too choosy.  i'd rather get in and out quickly, than wait for a particular scissor.  my hair has never been messed up, but it has been cut shorter than i wanted.a couple things i've learned here.  cowlicks can only be mitigated, not eliminated.  hair paste is much better than gel (at least for my thick unmanageable hair).  if you come into the shop with a hat and are all sweaty, you get a free rinse!
great place to go if you want to get your hair cut and be treated by rude staffhaircuts are ok, staff is about as rude as you will find

i got a hair cut here yesterday and i asked for a trim. she didn't wet my hair to cut it and i have wavy hair so that obviously isn't gonna work. my hair cut was done in about 7 mins and it is not straight at all
as with any place like this, you can get good and not so good.  ask for tiffany. she has cut hair for me and my sons for the last several months and done an excellent job.

been going here since 2007. it's going to be my last visit here today. worst haircut of my life last two times. my 'hairstylist' today was someone brenda torres. last name torres for sure. it was 2 pm and not even crowded to think she may have done it to get moving faster. i have attached a pic so you would realize what messy job she did with the sides. my haircut was complete in less than 4 minutes. all she asked me was if i wanted to buy those conditioners and gels they display. i know it is great clips and can't expect anything good - but can you at the least cut the hair like an average grade barber?can't wait to have my hair back and go to a better barber. thanks great clips for ruining it. not giving you a chance ever again.
one of the worst saloon. the guy who did the hair cut was very fast and started doing in his own style, despite i told him my style at the very beginning. i don't recommend.
been going for a while.  at first watched and observed who people were requesting.  most ask for cee.  since i've been going to cee, have always had good cuts.

unfortunately this place is getting very greedy. not only have they increased their prices, but they're now getting rid of both the utd discount and the $9.99 haircut cards. they say they're more of an "upscale" salon, so that's why it's more, but as you'll see from other reviews the service is on par with salons like the ones you'll find at walmart.
please don't go to the arab or indian or mexican looking lady there. she just cut off my side burns without giving me opportunity to do anything. i am so furious right now.
i been coming here for years and they are always appreciate me  coming here. i recommend this place to anyone. you can always online check in too since place is always packed with utd student.

i have blunt cut bangs that needed a basic trim. the lady who cut my hair named bunny gave me the worst hair cut of my life. she had nooo idea what she was doing. she tried to layer it? when i really did not ask for that then there are just huge chunks out of my now super short and uneven bangs. she tried to send me on my way when one side of my bangs was a whole 21/2 inches longer than the other side. i politely asked her to even them out. man did i make the wrong move by asking her to touch my hair again because yes she cut the long side short. really really short. . i asked her to leave my bangs touching my eyebrows and they are now half way to up my forehead and too short to even clip back to hide this horrid job. if a little asian lady named bunny tries to cut your hair. run out the door. she is awful.now i have to live with this horrible excuse of a hair cut. seriously didn't even know it was possible to mess it up this bad. i wish i could post a picture. it's almost comical.
it's not too bad as most of yelpers comments. don't forget the price is inexpensive. impossible for you want everything with low price.

i've been a customer here for the last 13 years, but not any more.  the online checkin app is a complete joke.  it will tell you there is a 1 minute wait, then you will show up and wait for 20 after you checked in online.  i would say my last three hair cuts have been bad, and have gotten worse each time.  today, i had an asian lady (not that it matters... many of the good stylists i have had over the years are of asian origin)...  but this one could not speak english well enough to do her job... i would ask her a question like "are you making it straight in the back" and she would answer with "thank you"...  um... what?   hair cut was terrible, but i couldn't explain well enough what i needed done.walked out frustrated and i think it showed... one of the regular stylists stopped me to ask if everything was ok...  i just asked if i could have a brush to brush my hair (which was still dripping wet), paid (no tip) and walked out.  won't be back.  you shouldn't be back either.

horrible service!!! if your not a man do not go here as they will rush through your hair cut to make more money! they will not even wet your hair prior to cutting it! to top it off when i asked to have someone else finish the hair cut on my child the employee hit me on my hand and began to scream!! when i called to speak with a manager they blew it off! bad service!
i have been going here at this place since last 1.5 years and every time i have returned with a shabby haircut. the only good thing is you get a utd discount. not going there henceforth now!
nothing extraordinary about this place. my hair has been messed up a couple of times. the bald guy is good. you get some discount if you are a utd student (that's probably the best part).

i have been going to this place for years and britney does a great job! most of the staff is the same since i have been going so that's always a plus and they all do a great job! britney is the bomb though she will give some great advice when your not sure what you want !

i've been here twice and i absolutely love this place! the first time i came in i was 8 months pregnant and had my toddler with me, my stylist was so patient with my baby (she was getting antsy because it was nap time). my hair was so long and i just wanted to chop it all off. she gave me the best haircut, just like how i wanted it. and today i went in to get a trim because my hair had gotten long again. and i had the perfect experience once again. i totally recommend this place. clean place and the staff is super friendly

the woman here are so classy and beautiful in their physical and spiritual appearance.shout out to brittany, keisha, ann maria, loren and marlene . they are so kind and loving towards me when i go there. i've been blessed by them. may god continue to bless their business. love you ladies

fat lady with pink hair was so rude. literally kicked my kid out because he was slightly upset and crying even though he wasn't moving or refusing to be cut. he is slightly autistic and upset with noises and the lady not apologetic and said find business elsewhere. extremely rude. never go to this location.

the hair stylists are great people but at the end of the day, my hair is crooked. i asked for a three inch trim and normally go to a great clips type place if i'm not doing anything drastic. i ended up with 1.5 inches cut on the left side and 2 inches cut on the right. kind of guesstimating those measurements, but the point is that one side is definitely longer than the other. the hair isn't even on each side either so it's really an all around disappointment. i'm too scared to go back and get it fixed for fear that they chop off more with the same janky result.

i went in for seriously one of the easiest haircuts someone can do... a trim. i have long hair and i wanted 2 inches trimmed off but after looking at it closer when i got home i noticed the guy who cut it wasn't able to cut it evenly. you can imagine my frustration. i wouldn't recommend this place.

i have been in dallas for 8 years, before that i lived in san diego, ca and had the same hair dresser for 18 years. i have been back to san diego for a visit and returned to my hair dresser but my visits were few and far between. i have tried several different stylists in dallas but none of them seem to know how to cut my hair to my satisfaction, at least until i went to great cuts. the lady there did a great job. she listened to what i wanted and did exactly what i requested. their prices are reasonable and they have a senior discount which is a plus on a low income.

i went for a shortish hair cut but the woman cut literally all of my hair off and made me look like a child. when i asked her what she was doing she said she was going to go as it develops. now i have a hair cut that is nothing like i wanted and never recommend going here. horrorible experience and doesn't listen at all.this woman should not be cutting hair at all. don't go here if you want your hair cut not to go right.

in and out in less than ten minutes. half of the haircut timing was spent stylist/butcher chatting to another. my hair style instructions said a little on the top, and yet 1/3 of the length was chopped. very unpleased and unhappy

worst corporate policies ever.  can't even go in to set an appointment for the person you want to cut your hair, no times for when available and most of their stylist are new and do not know how to properly cut hair.  i want the only person there who has ever cut my hair properly but can't get her standard working hours as great cuts changes them all the time, can't ask for her online as that is not an option, can't go into the facility to make an appointment.  worse customer service by a corporation ever!!!! do not use!!

about a month ago, i had posted a negative review about this place.however, they have changed my mind today, and i need to fix my comment. i guess i just got bad luck when i was there last time.the manager not only give me a free hair cut, but she also makes sure that i got the best person in the store to fix my hair, even after a month ago. of course, every staffs are talented and have amazing study hands. they will cut and fix your hair on point ... i don't write this review because they give me a free hair cut. i just thought those hard working stylists should be appreciated and customers should come to this place if they wanna get their hair done in the best way. i wish i had known every hair stylist's names... so, i could list the best ones and prefer to the new clients. as i said, most of people, who work there, are great. so... if you did have bad experiences, like me. don't abandon this place. just come back, talk to the manager. she will fix everything for you and you won't be sorry. i just can't stop smiling at my new hair

i've gotten a hair cut from every staff member.  most do a good job.   nothing to complain about here.  staff is very friendly. my suggestion is to open up yourself as a customer and you will get great service.  music is up with lots of laughter.  good place to get your grooming on.

my hair was very dry and rough. the lady started off with complaining about my hair. she cut it in like 2-3 minutes. i ask her  to re touch up the sides and she gives me a look like shes doing it for free so im not supposed to ask twice or something. and she does it in a hurry. prices are reasonable but not their attitudes. bad experience uh oh

the way they cut was pitiable with absolutely no perfection in handling and working with the scissors. i could say that either she never got any formal training in hair cutting or she was totally ignorant. she kept blabbering away with the other stylist who was cutting my boyfriend's hair. his haircut also turned out quite messy with jagged lines and uneven lengths. she was also a little rude and stared at him when he asked her to do make some changes, seemed like she had to run off somewhere. we have got better haircuts for the same price in other salons.

this review is for matthew keys, not for great clips!it's been a while since i last visited dallas and every time i need my hair done, not just done, but correctly, i always hit up matthew.  he is by far the best that i have ever been to and he knows what the hell he is doing.  he's a rock star, and a god with his profession.  i've been to quite a few hairstylist/ barbers in dallas and i have t found any i like, until matthew came along.  not only is he a great person to do your hair, he will also exceed your expectations.  you'd be a fool to not go to matthew!

my boyfriend and i went into this great clips on a sunday afternoon after being referred to matthew keys from numerous 5 star reviews at his old salon. we were not disappointed! matthew cut my boyfriends hair exactly how we asked and was so nice and quick! my boyfriend looks for things to be cheap and efficient and this was above and beyond those expectations. we will definitely be back in here to see matthew for future hair needs. you can text him directly to see when he's working- but it sounds like he's in there ~6 days a week. +1 (214) 394-8678
super busy locale but you can check in online for your appointment!
matthew keys is so awesome. my favorite barber and i have yet to get a less than superb haircut!

absolute disappointment. i took my 13 year old son in and the 'stylist' did about half of what i specifically asked her to do.  not that it was anything special, just clean up and shorten a typically teenage mop of hair.then at the end she just laughed, thinking somehow my comments of specific deficiencies were funny.obviously zero tip and won't be returning...

i'm new to town, and when looking for a new place to get my hair cut, this great clips had the best rating in the area. i checked it out, and it's obvious why.i checked in online, so didn't have to wait very long when i arrived. that's an important step to take though, because this place is busy!i told my stylist what i was looking for and she went above and beyond. she was kind, checked in with me as we were going along to make sure that it was to my liking. she was so professional, fun, and overall great at her job.i'm really pleased with my haircut here and would strongly recommend it. i will absolutely be back. also, if you live in the area, watch your mail because i got a coupon for a $6.99 haircut. great price and great haircut!
got a haircut here about 3 weeks ago. staff was friendly and efficient. will return when i am on this side of town

wish i could give negative stars or even 0!this place has gone down hill in the past 6 months to year. different stylists at every visit. went in today to only have the absolute worse cut ever in my life. she never spoke, never confirmed what the ticket said, never asked me anything. i felt like a couple of times i thought my ears were going to get cut off. feel certain this was one of her first cuts and had no idea what to do. now i need to find a new place for hair cuts. do not go to this great clips ever. i will report to their hq. today the owner of the location contacted me to apologize and discuss my experience. he assured this issue with the stylist has been resolved. very nice for the owner to reach out to me. i will return.

took my daughter there for an updo, never had been there before. tatiana did an excellent job with my daughter's hair and it stayed all night!! she made my daughter feel right at home by interacting with her throughout the process. she is such an awesome person! also reasonably priced! if you are looking for a great stylist, ask for tatiana!

first off, go see claudia, she's awesome! i have very tricky hair, i.e. cowlicks & wavy, she nailed it! i showed her a picture of the style i was looking to achieve she offered input and the final look sparked compliments since. great personality and talent, what more could you ask for?now besides great stylists, as the other girl working was very friendly and stylish as well, the store is well kept. smells nice, very clean, as well as the tools are well cleaned & maintained. last but certainly not least in today's economy, the price was very reasonable. i will certainly be back and if you're in the area and need a cut this should be your first stop... and ask if claudia is available lol.

we came here because our normal place, sports clips, raised their prices.  here, they are having a back to school special for kids- $7.99 haircut.  the cut was decent, not fantastic but not horrible, but the woman was a tough nut to crack.  my little guy is a total charmer but this lady didn't want to smile or talk to him.  it was odd.  but his hair looks a bit more clean cut for preschool tomorrow.

if your normal stylist isn't there, be prepared to get skipped. got there, checked in, waited a few mins (nobody else there, mind you) some other person walks in gets checked in and the lady calls him over. the stylist tried to explain that he was there earlier and left. he was removed from the check in log, so in theory, he lost his place in line, right?? nope, she puts him back on the list and calls him first and decides to skip me. wow, way to be fair! thanks for making me feel like a wanted customer!! bye!

only went to check it out because of $6 haircut coupon.  was maybe worth $0.25. don't remember her name but lady in the front was less than friendly , couldn't make any type of conversation during mediocre haircut. 2 stars because it does has reasonable prices. save your $ and get pizza next door :)

i am not very particular on who cuts my hair as long as they do a good job.  when you get your hair cut here the first time they record it in the computer and print out that request the next time you show up.  they always confirm that is still how i want my hair cut.  the employees have always been polite, some are more talkative than others and most importantly the haircut has always been consistently good.  the whole family goes here and none of us have ever had an issue.  there is also a military discount as long as you bring some sort of id.

tatiana did a fabulous cut and style for me!!  came in on my lunch hour using online check in and she listened to what i needed and made it happen.  added plus was that she has a great personality and i really enjoyed getting to know her.  price is very affordable too!

tatiana is the best stylist ever. i usually just let anyone cut my hair but not anymore. 6 weeks ago she cut my hair in a cute short style and even when it grew out i was getting complements. i love great clips and i love my stylist, she is very talented and super friendly!!!!!
meghan did such an awesome job cutting my girls hair that i came back the next night to have her cut mine! we all love our new haircuts.

been going to this place for over a year now. i am always pleased with the service and great attitudes from the ladies. tatiana and mystery specifically, are always on top of things. they always do a great job, and are great folks as well!
i have brought my son here since he was 3. michelle always does an amazing job and she's fast!

i have been here two times in the last couple weeks taking my kids for haircuts. my little boy was given a stylish haircut that i am very pleased with. i figured after having a good experience and a coupon from my receipt that i'd go again for my little girl.i went in and the worker started asking a few questions about what i wanted to do for my little girls hair. i told her and she kept telling me, " no you don't want to do that." she kept repeating that even after i'd ask why not. she kept saying we'll give her a trim which i had already mentioned i wanted her hair cut and even. this was her first haircut. well the haircut turned out horribly. she then goes to blame it on my girl for "moving" well, first off, she's two and she wasn't moving that much because i had her on my lap and keeping her pretty still. she chopped her bangs so high and barely touched the part i actually wanted her to cut. i was not a fan of the stylist and i could tell it was not going to end well, she was older and seemed to not be up to date on the styles. let's just say i'll return but be more selective on who gets to cut my kids hair.

i really like this place because it's so conveniently located.  it is probably a 5 minuted drive down the street from me.  the online check-in app is great... and really cuts the wait time in half, if not more.  i've been coming to this location for about 2 years now, and come in for a cut maybe  every 2 1/2 to 3 weeks.  they def. make you feel at home because they greet you right when you walk in the doors.  they def. know me by now and it's easy to feel comfortable.  i do have my go-to stylist.  they are all very personable and strike up pretty interesting conversations.  only a couple times i have felt a little unimpressed/unsatisfied with the work done.  on one occasion they gave me a taper, but totally forgot to do the other side!  i didn't bring it up at that moment because i did not notice it right away. thankfully i knew how to fix the situation myself with my own clippers back at home.  on one of my more recent visits, the stylist adamantly thought she knew what i should do with my hair, even though it was not what i was asking for.  i ultimately got my way and she cut it how i wanted it but it was just shocking that she kept trying to cut it her way.   with that being said, i now ask for particular stylist to cut my hair. that easily remedies those situations from happening in the future.  i'm due for a cut at the end of this week and let's see how it goes.
very choppy. layers weren't blended and they stick out i have to wear a ponytail until my hair grows out
my teen son got his haircut here. he's very picky and really liked the cut. we will definitely be back!

horrible.  had a bad experience the first time and returned (shouldn't have) hoping it will be better.  majority of the workers are rude and are not genuine on their "welcome to great clips" or their thank u s.  i will definitely not be returning nor my husband.

hadn't been there in years (since the stylist i liked left), decided to go back and try my luck with it being under new management. my hair was short but wasn't quite how i hoped for (having it cut about a 2 wks prior to this visit). the wait wasn't  long at all, i was actually #8 on the list so about 10 min later i'm in the chair. michelle listened to what i wanted, then did exactly what i hoped the outcome would be..i was so happy (finally). the other stylists there all seem friendly & i enjoyed chatting with them. the establishment is very well kept & clean & they now have an app that you can check yourself in and cut the wait time. as long as michelle will be there i'll definitely be back..thank you michelle

this was my first time at this particular great clips. i walked in on a tuesday afternoon around 4 , the wait was about 15 minutes.  i showed the hairdresser a picture of the haircut i wanted, she wavered back and forth on what type of clippers to use.  she did not seem confident in her estimation of the length of hair a particular clipper would cut. after she was done, the hairline was not uniformly even and i asked her to repeat the process.  when it was all done, i found out later that the back of my hair was also not cut evenly.  for $13 haircuts, i will not return to this location.  there are places closer in houston that will cut your hair for $5 and do a better job.

great place for boys haircuts! i use their app to sign in and hold my queue before heading up to the salon. really makes it efficient to take care of their hair between obligations.their hours are convenient  and promotions are a great deal. all with a great haircut by a friendly barber!

very good salon. i can walk in here and get the perfect haircut for a reasonable price. this is a great place if you want to get your hair styled for not that much money. the stylists are helpful, and they listen. remember to check in online to avoid wait times!

i have the worst luck with hair stylists... in that when i find a good one, they leave the salon/move away/quit doing hair within the year. so i'm constantly on the prowl for a good stylist that isn't going to break the bank when i need a cut! i was in desperate need of a hair cut, and hadn't had the time to find a new 'permanent' stylist, so in a desperate attempt to look decent before heading back to work after having a baby, i took myself to the oak forest great clips one night for a quick cut. they do offer online check in, which also displays the current wait time for a stylist. there being no wait (and only about 5 minutes down the road), i opted to not check in online and headed straight over. there not being a wait actually meant that i had to wait for the stylists to finish the customers they had, then clean up, and then it was my turn in the chair. this was approximately 12 minutes after arriving at the shop, which was 630pm one night (30 mins before closing). i'm not sure if there are options for hair cuts, but i wasn't asked anything when checking in (wash and style, just a cut, etc) but i wanted a wash, cut, and style at the end, which isn't what i got. i got a dry cut and left with wet hair- ugh! i hate that, because i couldn't tell how the layers looked. it's stressful enough getting a hair cut by someone new, but when you can't even check the quality of the work until you get home is agonizing. the stylist was also not friendly at all, she kept talking with her coworkers the whole time i was being served. i'm not usually one to chat, but i felt like an intruder in her fun chat time circle, which made me more uncomfortable. being a nervous wreck from the experience and the new stylist, you might be wondering 'why 3 stars then?' the cut turned out to be ok, i wasn't in tears when i got home and dried it out. was it amazing, the best hair cut i've had in years? no. would i recommend coming here? again, probably not... unless you don't care much how the cut turns out and want something basic done. i may not be coming back, but i did get my hair trimmed up and looking much less crazy, and bought myself a few more months to find a permanent stylist!

check ins mean absolutely nothing here ! i checked in thirty minutes prior and still have to wait while they let others cut in front. very unorganized and didn't even know we were here before or were here to check in.
i need to know where carla went to. she was the best hair stylist there. somebody please let me know some thing. thank you!
i cant believe that carlita is not anymore with you guys, she was the best stylist ever and she was the only reason that i drive 10 miles to this great clips ,

i have never gone to get a haircut and had the stylist be so rude as to skip me to get the woman behind me in line because she had requested her. i usually get my hair cut here but this is the worst service i have ever seen. the other stylist even said he is next and she said no she was waiting.i told her to take me off the list i'll get my hair cut else where.

you can't beat this $13 haircut. my "do" is nothing too special, so i trust the great clips staff to trim it up just the way i want it, and even to shape my side bangs. the staff is very friendly. i've had cuts by three of them, two gals and a guy. they're down to earth and i always have a great conversation. this is my "go-to" to get rid of those nasty split ends.
these hair sylists have messed up my kids' hair twice! i don't know why i keep coming back.
loud, rude employees who should be ashamed of their profanity-laden language.
my haircut is easy and can't be messed up.  they do the job based on what i ask for.
been coming here for so many years.  i'm always greeted by name and get great service. love that i'm able to check in through the app for a less wait time.

this little strip mall location was polite to accept two of us right at closing time!  my cut was done quickly and professionally- my friend said he was pleased but that his stylist was really "new" and didn't seem like she was comfortable in the role yet.

in my great clips has changed with the staff, geslle and tameka were the only people i've trusted and they left and i have fortunately found them if anyone would like to know where they are at message me.

after coming to this location religiously for several years, it's time to search for another place to get my haircut. the last several times i have visited, the haircuts and shampoos have been sub par. additionally, there is a specific employee who will bother you continuously trying to up sell products. i say no, and she asks. "are you sure?" this goes on a couple of times. i finally told her she's being pushy and she replies that she's only joking. pretty tacky. same haircut person today and the photo is the back of my shirt after a shampoo. ugg. she asked if i wanted some product on my hair and i said yes, some gel. she then tries to use a gel product that's new, i tel her i use a specific brand and then she offers an even lesser priced brand. uggh. they have the brand there because i buy it from their shop and there was an open bottle at another station, but i guess she didn't want to spend the extra .15 of product. :(also, two of the stylists were speaking badly about the owner or manager. don't know if they realized i could hear them, but another reason not to return to great clips. the location has taken a noticeable turn for the worse in ambience and quality. recommend sports clips right across the street. they have much better reviews and stylists.

this place is not the same without tomeka. i've been getting my haircut at this location for 2 years now and i've been able to trust almost the entire staff (dulce, tomeka, and kristen are great) when i drop in for random visits. they must have replaced most of the staff after tomeka's exit because i don't recognize any of the new stylists, and no offense, they aren't nearly as good. so not only are the stylists not as good but now they shove product marketing down your throat the entire visit. very sad day.  you can tell it's new management/ownership... and it's just not good.

since tomeka left the energy in the salon has shifted, and not really for the better. a lot of gossiping across to each other (sometimes about other customers), and just overall downgrade in customer service with the newer staff. i only go for dulce now. if she's not there, i'm not getting a hair cut.

on a normal basis i would give this place a good score, but today, only a few flipping days before christmas we made a big mistake by coming to the wrong person! my 15 year old has wonderful hair.  all he wanted was a trim. we told her that!  terrible hair cutter.  just chop chop chop away.  i guess i should have babysat her while she was chopping away. this is no trim. and then. they were like "well don't pay".  what?! it is not about not paying!!!!  it is about doing what the customer wants. we specifically told her that he likes it long.  to leave it over the ears...long in the back. look at these pictures. go practice on someone else.  not my son. lady needs more training before she gets paid again to cut hair.  listen to the customer.  not every man wants short hair. and then they blamed my 15 year old for not speaking up?! jerks. manager and owner need to contact me!

i just had an amazing hair cut experience with tameka. she was very professional and quick but showed great attention to detail. i felt that she really cared about how my haircut turned out. she mentioned that she wanted my hair to look great because she is "putting her name on it."this kind of accountability and pride in work is hard to find these days especially with a haircut under $20.thank you tameka and i will request you from now on.

i've been getting my haircut at great clips for a little over a year since i arrive to houston.the stylist's have always done a good job for me. i've had my hair done by other salon's in the surrounding area and this particular great clips seems to have their act together. the management and staff is receptive paying close attention to my hairstyle even if i don't know what i want to be done with it. and if i don't they provide me with good examples and deliver satisfying results.i've had my hair styled from everyone on the staff. there isn't anyone here that doesn't know what they're doing. i'm immensely pleased and as long as i'm in houston i will continue giving them my business. and the price is nice always falling under $10. can't beat that unless you're deployed. :)

i've been to many different locations of great clips and this one remains my favorite. even though i have to drive 1/2 hour, i prefer it to the three locations near me. i've had both crystal and jess cut my hair and i'm very happy both times.

great haircut for a great price! i am a female with long hair and could not believe it was just $13. dulce cut my hair and she did a magnificent job! i would highly recommend great clips to anyone who wants to save money and get a great, fast haircut. i was in and out in less than 20 minutes!
the wait time here is not good they need more help. the hair cuts are decent, if you need a quick cut and nothing special this would be a great place for just that.

how does a chain haircut store get 5 stars?  let me drop some knowledge on you.i pulled into the parking lot and got the spot closest to the door.  when i walked in i was promptly greeted, and did not even have to sit down in the waiting area.  i was led straight to a chair.  this was at 5pm on a week day; when i believe it should be turbo busy.  upon being seated my stylist talked with me about my haircut.  it was not the usual formality, she really discussed how she was going to cut my hair, and what she was trying to achieve.  i appreciated the focus, and i did not feel like a part of an assembly line.  she cut my hair exactly like she said, and i was very pleased with the results.so i got a great haircut with no wait.  that's good.  now what made it five stars?  the price.  it was $6.99!  i haven't had a haircut that cheap since i was a kid and my mom would drop me at the navy base to get my "regular boy haircut."  i wonder if there was an "irregular boy haircut?"  i will probably never know.  either way, i will be going back!
dulce is the best by far! she always listens to what i want and delivers! always in and out. she is super sweet and i  hope she stays for a while! love my hair!

i stopped by before jumping a flight to dallas for a big sales meeting with a customer the following day. one of the worst hair cuts i've ever gotten. i told the lady to taper the back & use razor #2.5 to fade halfway up then blend it. this b**** use #1 & scalped me. look at the picture...it's uneven & looks like i'm losing hair. i was furious & refused to pay! i walked out & told her it was the worst hair cut i've ever gotten. a customer in the chair behind me looked at me & said - wow that is bad!

what ever you do, criticizing an employee named jazelle will get you on her bad side. she does not take criticism well and i won't be going back for sure after having her cut my hair for the past couple of years.
ahh, it's ok.it will grow up again. why?? could be my fault communicating what i wanted.very polite and cheerful girls otherwise!!

great experience! checked in online after getting my car washed and upon arrival, i waited less than 5 minutes.i will definitely be coming back to this location.service was great and stylists were friendly and complimentary of my haircut ;)yu

they lost a customer for sure. i have been going here for the 2 years i've lived in town. at first, things were ok, but then they start adding notes on my haircut. they never listened to the words i was saying, "cut my hair short!" all they did was follow the notes, that were wrong.i've had three of the worst haircuts back to back to back. i tried, but this is ridiculous. listen to your customer, if i say 2 on the side, don't give me a 3-4 crap fade. if i say cut it as short as your finger lengths will go, do that!i cut my own hair this morning fixing this place. don't go here. not worth it!

since there really isn't much to tell, this will be quite a short review. haircuts for men are almost $20 and combined with subpar customer service and performance this wouldn't be the first place i send a friend.
called at 8:52pm asking if i could get a quick hair wash and they said they'd take me if i got there before 9. i got there in time and was only $5. lucky they took me and price so reasonable.

do not allow charlotee i believe is her name ever cut your hair. i specifically said i have sensitive skin and scalp please use scissors she refused and only would use clippers. i politely asked if she did not know how to cut the style i've been getting for years at great clips is in my notes with no issues and she only responded it's the same. she severely screwed up my hair. worst hairstylist and customer service ever.

extremely fast and high quality haircuts and very cheap. their online system makes it easy to see how long the wait is and get your name on the list from home, avoiding wasted time. they also keep your haircut preferences stored in their system making it more consistent. highly recommend getting your haircut with lydia, kim or margerita. i've had experiences with other barber shops where it was awkward to tell a stylist to make a change at the end but here they will ask you at the end and be very chill about anything that you ask to change (e.g. asking for a shorter cut).

my husband recently got a haircut at this location from michelle. he has been here multiple times in the past, and has always had a good experience. as soon as he got home i noticed how much care and detail she took on his haircut and style, even slightly trimming his facial hair to match his new style. great job, great effort.

this location is awesome!!! the stylist are always attentive and genuine. ms. charlotte cuts my hair every week and she is always super sweet. she knows exactly how to cut my hair, but the best part is that she is always asking how i'm doing. i love this location.

been going to this location for two years.  first stylist was excellent but relocated.  have used my current stylist, named charlotte, for about a  year.   she always does a good job. some stylists listen to you and then do what they want.  she always asks how you want your hair cut and cuts it that way. charlotte wants you to be satisfied with your hair cut and in addition, she has a great personality.
very fast service but terrible haircut. i asked for just the the ends of the top of my hair to he cut and se took of like an inch! awful haircuts
i've been to this location several times now and each time the haircuts get worse. it's safe to say i won't be going back because my hair couldn't take a worse haircut than my last one here.

love the online check in. i drive from katy to this location because of fredia. i only want her to cut my hair. i've been to other locations but keep coming here. the music can be a little louder than i like but not that bad.  i gave five stars for fredia but everyone else here would be a 3 and 1/2 to 4.

have been coming here over a year.  your experience will vary greatly based upon who you get. as others mentioned, fredia is great. however, they seem to have high turnover because i often end up with someone i haven't seen before with varying quality. the last haircut was terrible. the young lady was sweet, but literally didn't know how to cut my hair and all i get is a buzz with 2, 3, 4. i'm questioning whether she had been through any training at all or had a license. the other lady had to come over and try to help her, but it just ended up being a mess. it's noticeably longer on one side.  i have tried other locations as well and had another bad haircut there as well so i gave this one another try. just looking for some place i can get a simple buzz with clippers, but it seems to be a challenge!
don't bother. first time coming here, was not even acknowledged by anyone to be checked-in but two others walk in 5 minutes later and got checked-in.they don't believe in helping everyone apparently.
best hairstylist in town! ask for tamika!  very attentive and receptive for hair needs. will give you constructive feed back! been coming to her for past year!

sometimes you just need a simple haircut.  my default hair cutting chain has been tgf, because most of the times you know what you're going to get.  nothing too fancy, but they won't totally screw up your hair.  well unfortunately, the tgf near my house sucks! so i had to search for another simple hair salon.  good ole yelp showed me that there was this great clips not far from my house.  i called and they were open until 5 pm on a sunday.  i wish they were open a little later, but this will do.  we came at about 4 pm and they had about 8 total booths and 5 of them being filled with a stylist.  which was a pleasant surprise because even though the waiting room was full, we were able to get into a chair fairly quickly.  they keep notes in the system so that when you come back the next time you can have the same stylist and similar hair cut.  it's $14 for a basic cut which is comparable to most basic salons.

i don't know who i had for a hair stylist this time, but i normally come here for a trim and i always get the same lady who is super sweet and nice. she always does my hair really well. this time however, i came in wanting to donate my hair and cutting it right below the shoulder. i didn't get either one. the lady cut off 8 inches of hair which left my hair below my shoulders. which isn't enough to donate. i wasn't mad i couldn't donate it, i just wanted her to keep the hair at the same length it was or trim off a little bit (maybe an inch at most) but she cut off 3 inches more of my hair! leaving me with a dora hair cut, that is not only uneven but also unbelievably short. i have picture day at school in a week and i don't know what i'm supposed to do with this mess
they don't not know how to cut black people hair at all they messed up my friends haircut and only used one kind a clippers the whole time and cut her hair uneven

came in for a simple haircut and beard trim. my directions are always very clear. number 2 on sides and fingerlength up top .. just enough to comb backwards. my hair dresser was difficult to communicate with because she was not very good at english. she was showing me the back and turning me loose. i had to tell her it was to long and that she had forgotten my beard.she makes the top a little shorter and then does my beard with the same number 2 large clippers used on my head. she uses no smaller or more precision clippers required. as a result my beard looks unkept and lazy. i'll have to redo it myself. she was clearly uncomfortable as if she had never done it. i'm not one to start trouble so i paid my bill. tipped and left. i'm not sure she would even have understood my directions to fix it. not sure what i paid for as i'm going to have to do it properly myself. this is the second great clips i've been to that did a rushed sloppy job on my beard.maybe they should just stop offering them?the get it right about 60% of the time and it's 1/2 the price of a haircut. gonna have to find somewhere else.

i was done with people that either don't speak english and/or only know one hairstyle for men.this place was good for me until my last 2 haircuts. yesterday was terrible as i had let my hair grow out for a "pompadour" style only to be mowed down by yet another hair stylist from their never ending turnaround.it will grow back and blah blah blah but what really pisses me off is having to pay $14 plus tip for a -5 dollar haircut-

these were the nicest and most professional staff i've experienced since living in houston. i went to sports clips and had the worst haircut of my life. i immediately drove to great clips to explain what happened and multiple stylists gathered around to help fix my hair cut. they truly cared about providing me with a satisfying experience. my hair looked 100xs better when they were done. i will never go anywhere else in houston. if you need a hair cut and want to have a great experience while you get one, go to great clips at myerland.

so i've had rather inconsistent experiences with this place before, which is a pet peeve of mine when it comes to running a business, but this last experience was just inexcusable and led me to vow to never stray from my usual barber no matter how inconvenient his scheduling.this place has done for me in a pinch in the past but the experience of the barbers/stylists (which they don't seem to hold onto) can vary widely.  in my last experience i decided to use great clips app to check in.  50 minutes and the timer starts counting down.  okay, so i can chill at home and check in a few minutes before my supposed appointment (after all, it is a timer counting down to zero - a survey of my friends seems to make this a reasonable assumption).  arrive ten minutes ahead of time according to the counter and take a seat.  after waiting 15 minutes and noticing people walking in and going ahead of me i get suspicious.  look at the app...seems it reset to 33 minutes.really?  this is doctor scheduling.  they overschedule and plan for people to be late/cancel and end up with a waiting room of people sitting around for hours.  i hate it when my doctor does it and i hate it when a business does it.  my usual barber knows what an appointment means and will have you seated within seconds walking into the door.after waiting another 15 minutes i finally get called up.  i sit down and make my request (zero around, clippers up top to style).  it's not the easiest haircut to make look good, but i've consistently tipped well to make up for this.  what do i get?  "do you mind waiting for another girl?  i don't know how to do zeros."she wasn't rude.  she was perfectly polite and reasonable.  but, from my understanding, i just walked into a haircut place and sat down for half an hour only to be told "i don't know how to cut fucking hair!!!!"  if i sat down at a shoe repair place and got this response that would be reasonable.  if you asked me i think it'd be reasonable since i didn't go to fucking school for this career.  but why the hell are you here with clippers and a pair of scissors if you don't know how to fucking use them!?  even if her response was to offer to attempt it but tell me she has never done it before, i would have been fine.  my not having a haircut at that moment would be on me.  but this was just fucking ridiculous.skip it.  go to matt over at bellaire's original barber shop.  he may cut old conservative white dudes for a living but he won't even flinch if you request a hitler youth cut - and he'll do it well.

haircut days are the best. i love this place. as a low-maintenance kind of girl, i feel totally comfortable and happy coming here. though the clientele is majority male, they do ladies hair just perfectly. i was shocked to be able to walk right in on a saturday at noon, and be immediately placed in a chair. ana did a perfect job, just what i wanted, was kind and conversational but didn't waste time either. great place for a basic trim, undercut, short cut, or more complex stuff. (my understanding is the only thing they do not do is color.) kudos, beechnut location!

i can't stand this place. been here several times hoping to think it would get better but apart from a few good experiences, they've all been horrible. the latest experience (12/31/17) was unsurprisingly miserable. the woman who cut my hair interacted with me like a robot and refused to understand how to communicate. i asked her for her thoughts and she goes, "it's however you want it". i could go on but i don't really care to and will never be back at this miserable place again.

i usually use thuy, & she no longer works here and i am so sorry that i asked for a bob with a very long, angled front because i now have a bowl haircut and i have no idea what i am going to do with my hair tomorrow.  i am in tears & my hair looks really crappy.  why didn't i just ask for a trim?  if the lady had not spent all her time worrying that because i had curly hair, i wouldn't like the cut, she would have actually heard me say really long asymetrical front instead of bowl, which i am 100% certain i did *not* say.
online checkin gets you pushed to the front of the line and they have a mobile app to make it even easier!

i can't comment much because i only use this place about once a year when i am visiting my old home town.  bottom line...plenty of stylists who can do plenty of options (i am a guy after all...how many "options" are there really???).  i do make life difficult with the way my hair can be and i have not had any problems from this place (though i have had issues with other places).  they also offer your typical haircare products and the staff is very friendly.there is a reason i always go back to them when i am home and i recommend them if you are in the area.
great clips great place!! amiling faces....i luv this place!

while driving i tried to find a saloon, the gps pointed out that there is one in the next exit. with doubts i took the exit. it is a neat saloon without any big expenses. i walked out happy and satisfied. i never expected and now this is my to go place for haircut.
for the price, this is as good as it gets. i always walk out of here symmetrical and well taken care of. their employees seem better trained.

i have been to other great clips and was surprised that they couldn't find me in their system. the other great clips did a great job cutting my brothers and my hair but this location is definitely not worth it. it is like they have not style hair before or be able to visualize how the customer will look if they took too much off on the side or on top. i will not be coming to this location again in the future.

i am giving this great clips only one star due to the fact that their hairstylist (blue hair) moves at the pace of a dying sloth. i arrived and there was two people in front of me. for your information these two men were getting buzz cuts. i'm not a hair stylist, but i know that it should not take her an hour to complete two buzz cuts. having to wait that long is insane. they also take priority over online check ins even if you have been waiting for over an hour. i would save your time and go to sports clips one block over.

i've taken my son there several times and the staff had been very nice, and cut my sons hair to our liking. today, we were there for about 15 minutes, someone walked in and was seen before us because he checked in online...which is a bad practice. the perception, because the woman didn't explain the procedure, was that because we are of another race (yeah i know, but just a perception) that those who may be perceived privileged got head of line. so, waited and asked the woman who cut my sons hair what was the practice, and she said she thought walk ins get seen first and checkins thereafter. check in just means that you have confirmed your appointment??? lastly, the quality of the hair cut was disappointing. positives, place was clean and tidy. dr. p

we walks in to get the hubby a quick hair cut and got right in.  elizabeth did his cut and she did a great job! not too short and she did a scissor cut instead of with the clips.. looks wonderful and all for $14! who can beat that??
worst haircut of my life, and i'm 57 years old so i've had a lot of poorly done haircuts but nothing like this disaster. now i have total anxiety about ever letting anyone ever touch my hair again.

my regular hair stylist moved out of town, and i just haven't found a new one yet. however, my hair didn't get the memo that it needed to stop growing and splitting its ends, so in a last-ditch effort i came in to great clips for a trim. i have mixed feelings about this place, but haven't decided if i would go back. to make this review short and sweet, here are the pros and cons: pros:-open late and on the weekends-takes walk-ins-check in online and they'll be waiting for you when you arrive-cheap cheap cheap! $13 for my haircutcons:-i only got a haircut. no shampoo, no styling. it wasn't offered, but i would have taken a shampoo had it been offered. - the lady asked if i wanted my hair blow dried, and i said yes. however, she only blew my hair for about 2 minutes and i left with damp and unstyled hair. -my hair is crooked. since she didn't dry the style, i didn't notice until the next day when i straightened my hair, but the layers are choppy and there are random long strands hanging around my face. would have liked her to go into the layers and make them fall nicer. not like cake layers.i'm not at all pleased with the way my layers look, and she was only supposed to take off 1/2 an inch to trim up the bottom. i didn't imagine it would turn out crooked! i'm not sure if it was just this stylist or i'd they're all like this, but i would say use caution when coming here, and make sure to have them fully dry and straighten your hair to check the layers before you leave.

terrible.  worst hair cut of my life.  stay away.  rude. asian women chopped off all my hair, talked about her african american co worker being robbed at gun point, and said homophobic statements such as: "straight men don't take selfies" and "you look straight with short hair"....wtf????    the price is cheap -- and now my hair looks like i escaped from a mental hospital!!  she could not taper hair, trim edges, round the top.  no skills.  zero.  shouldn't even be allowed sharp objects.  she's a dangerous to society with scissors!this woman smelled bad and kept talking about how she dresses up as marline monroe and gets sexy for halloween.  so inappropriate. i will never go back -- and i hope you stay far far away from this business!!!

this review is for the vietnamese lady, i think her name is kim. don't get cut by her. you will regret it. everyone is an okay hairdresser but she ruined my hair by using thinning scissors without telling me on my curly hair and now you can see big patches of scalp on random places. its been 2 months since then and my hair is still bad. seriously man, i hate this woman.

i took my 9 year old nephew jordan to great clips yesterday after his dental appointment. the barber named kenny cut him behind both ears. kenny was dishonest, unapologetic, and uncaring. he tried to hide the fact that he cut him then he proceeded to say, "go ahead, report me, nothing can be done, these things happen." i just know that in 8 years of getting haircuts jordan has never been cut. he cut him not once but twice...both ears. he blamed jordan then he blamed the clippers. took no responsibility, didn't even apologize. one ear has the skin shaved off and took a long time to stop bleeding. i sent photos with an email to the corporate office. the owner just called and said that kenny was "talked to" and is going to go through customer service training. i hope it helps his future customers because we will never go back.
trust the one star reviews.  went to get a shampoo and blow dry.  she charged me for the time she spent and not the service!  what!?  and that is why it took forever for her to dry my hair.

i am new to houston and have been cutting my hair due to how expensive hair cuts are in this city. i decided to take a chance on great clips as it'd been fine in indiana when i was in a budget.today, i went to gc and was very displeased. first, i was greeted, barely, by an older gentleman. he ended up being the one to cut my hair...in 15 mins flat! isn't look twice, didn't wash it (even though it was very greasy), didn't ask how i parted my hair, nothing. he didn't even brush my hair all the way and was like "done". i thought maybe i was just going to need to brush it out and fix it a bit(no big for a $14 hair cut). when i got to my car, it was disheveled, the side swept bangs were not well cut and were blunted.i went back in and had to hold the pieces i wanted fixed, every time, how i wanted them to be cut and he still did not cut there! what?!left with greasy hair, funked up bangs, and the understanding of what women mean when they talk about the feeling of helplessness you get with a funked up cut. not something i want to feel again. that was a disgrace! i have no education in styling and do better cutting mine and my husband's hair than that man...who didn't even apologize and didn't seem surprised...

i normally go to the great clips location in oak forest but went here because i happened to be in the area. i asked the stylist for an 8 on top and 4 on the sides and back. unfortunately, the stylist disregarded my instructions and just cut it with scissors and seemed to just do what he thought was right. also, he was very aggressive with the clippers and it felt like someone was cutting into my skin. i won't be going back to this location again.

decided to come here for my weekly cut and was really surprised. i tend to stay away from big chain places but i'm glad i stopped here. as soon as i walked in i was greeted and put on the waiting list. they offered me a magazine and a water, which i respectfully declined. i got my usual cut (high fade the sides and blend the top) and it was at its usual cleanliness. she kept a small conversion going but seemed bored lol. she was also a little rough when she would grab my head and when she was brushing the hair off my shoulders. still a great place for a good cut. will be returning soon!
great place!they accept walk-ins, give lollipops, and when your hair is brushed, it doesn't hurt! i will definitely come back here for future cuts. shoutout to chuck for being an awesome stylist!

i'm at great clips now, this is my second time visiting and i'm extremely frustrated. first time i visited i walked in and got taken care of right away and received great service, before leaving the stylist that helped me recommended i do an online reservation next time to avoid a wait. so now i'm here my second time, made my online reservation, waited the 40 min at home and then drove over. when i arrive i find out i still have to wait for two more people -_-.. what's the point of the online check in if customers still have to wait. disappointed
we love andrea!  i have been to others here but no one compares to andrea. she knows how to cut a toddler boy's hair and it's only $11.  can't beat her, here!

let me preface by saying that my rating is based on the stylist, specifically, and not on great clips. i've taken bradley to many places, but andrea has been our go-to when he needs a fresh fade. she listens and then takes her time to make sure we're  satisfied. i've used other people here, and it's been a disaster. i've never used them for my hair, nor has hubby, but andrea does an excellent job on bradley's hair.

shocked at the low reviews here. i get a great haircut every time, never wait in a line to get it, and you can't argue with the price. they even have a few dedicated parking places. james is new, he just started cutting here today, and this is the best haircut i've had in years.
checked in online and arrived to be next in line and they took someone that just walked in, never coming back.

i was surprised by this location's level of service and quality of haircut for their prices ($13 for haircut, $5 for shampoo). after a few nightmare experiences at common haircut places like great clips or supercuts, i started getting haircuts at pricier salons.my first haircut here was back last year with janel, who was very attentive, careful, and thoughtful with my haircut (asking me whether the length, layers, etc.) were okay, which made me feel a lot better about how the haircut turned out.this week, i went back in and wasn't able to see janel since she was already with another customer, but latasha was just as awesome and my haircut looks great!i'm usually not too good at getting regular haircuts every 3 months or so (because of my past bad experiences), but now that i know i have two hairstylists i can trust, i'll definitely be coming here regularly!two quick recommendations: if you can check in online before you arrive, it should help you be seen quicker since they do not take appointments. they serve customers based on order of check-in (either in-person when you arrive or online).coming during off-peak hours is also a good idea too because this particular parking lot rarely has enough spaces with all the other businesses during busy times (e.g. 12 noon-5 pm on weekends).

so this is the place that i take my son bradley to get his haircut. he's only five so i can't justify paying for him at the place that i go to. i have tried a number of places and really didn't like them enough to keep coming back. i think the only reason we tried this place was because they sent us a coupon in the mail and it was down the street from my house. the first time i went, i had aundrea and i thought she did a good job. since she did a good job, i decided to bring him back but she wasn't working that day. i went ahead and let whoever was working cut his hair and they were horrible. after coming home and being real disappointed with the outcome i brought him back a day or 2 later for aundrea to fix it. luckily she was able to fix it. i'm giving them a 3 star review only because they won't let you put 3.5. i wouldn't really rate it a 4 but i would definitely give aundrea a 4 star but based on the business itself, i would have to say it's a 3.5 for me.

yep you already know i'm yelpn'. i come to this salon every time i get a drastic hair cut. it doesn't happen often but when i do i go here because of what i thought was great customer service for such a good price. unfortunately that was not the case today. came in to get bangs done for the first time in 22 years, so kind of a special occasion. walked in no hello, then as i watch this customer thank his hirdresser for the great job she said nothing. he continued to thank her but nothing, not even eye contact. already put off, and if i'm put off by some hairdresser my ass ain't getting no hair cut. so funny stuff right here, she asks my name. i say brittany, she says, last name or first?? um...lol... my first, don't know many brittany's as a last name, look story short this ginger i think, april or something like that was horrible, just mad at life and wondering why she was cutting hair. the other hairdresser was smart to tell her to stop. poor man next to me was going to get his hair done by her, i told him good luck. $13 is $13. i'm not wasting my time or money on a shitty hairdresser. and one more thing, as someone who is in the restaurant industry constantly dealing with customers i know that if you want a repeat customer, you do everything you can to give that customer a great experience from beginning to end. some people have it and some don't.

mixed feelings. i come here regularly because it's cheap and i just get a trim, no fancy styling. but when i've been sitting and waiting for half an hour before someone even comes to put my name on the list, and people keep walking in and getting helped immediately because they checked in online, you can imagine why i'd be a little frustrated. i'd be first in line if they'd acknowledge customers when they come in the door.

i walked in and was seen in 5 minutes. i didn't check in online because i went on a whim. james was great! i guess i expected mediocre, but i received an excellent cut, style, and service over all. i usually go to a higher price salon, but i am just as happy with my cut and style from james. he is a gem!

very ridiculous when i am waiting for 15 mins and two people come in who "checked in online" get to be served before me. if the only requirement is to say "yes" to "did you check in online", then i'm going to say yes next time. i don't care if you checked in online, if i have been waiting for 15 mins, you should serve me first. common customer service.

it's cheap and it's in the neighborhood, and for boys that's half the battle. this location is new (and they sweep your hair into a vacuum thing in the wall, how spiffy!) so i'm going to guess the slow service and computer issues are a new location issue. i still prefer sportsclips over at taylor/sawyer for my kiddo, but there's another option in the neighborhood now for a kid haircut.

a very clean location. both stylist had a very nice, practical hairstyle that looked good on them. they both were working like busy bees since during lunch time they had a semi-rush. for some odd reason some   customer's walked in and kept on asking for a lady natasha whom i found out is the manager. i don't know her but i think she needs more practice in scheduling so she will not schedule only two stylist during lunch time. i felt bad for those two hardworking ladies.

came here mainly because i'm lazy and its close/cheap. but i soon learned you get what you paid for. i've gotten 4 haircuts here and only 1 of them was what i would consider a "good cut". the rest were terrible. honestly, i almost told the woman to just buzz it all off cause she screwed up so bad. uneven blends and just overall bad. i was embarrassed after getting it cut and 3 weeks later it still looks bad. i will definitely go somewhere better next time and pay a little extra. trust me, don't go here unless you want to look like a doofus. luckily i already have a girlfriend and she's understanding. if not, i'd be more angry cause it'd limit my ability to pick up girls. avoid this place.
came here just to get my bangs cut a and fixed. they came out terribly. now i have to go to a wedding looking like an idiot. you expect people to know how to do their job correctly.

went in to see adrianna not too long before closing hours towards the end of the month this past november.  i almost never leave reviews on yelp but i wanted to sign in and specifically post this as she gave me a fantastic haircut and we enjoyed some wonderful conversation.  she was a pretty big football fan and had to school me a bit on what was happening in the league!anyhow, i travel very frequently for work so i often have to get haircuts on the run in various cities around the country.  it was refreshing and honestly unexpected to have such tremendous service and quality from adrianna at this great clips location.  please do not hesitate to visit this location and get a cut from adrianna!!  a++++ service!

i have been to great clips before and had excellent experiences. i am trying to save money so i came in today because it's cheap. i showed the lady a picture of what i wanted and she did nothing like it. i wanted a bob about an inch above my shoulder. i showed her the picture, it's an easy cut. by the time she started cutting the front it was too late. what she gave me was a very short bob about an inch above my jaw line. it's the worst haircut i've ever had. i don't want to go anywhere or see anyone. i went in wanting a cute trendy haircut for summer and i came out looking like an overweight teenage boy from the 90s. there is nothing i can do to save it or make it look better. if i didn't want to pay for another haircut, i would just go and turn it into a pixie, at least then it would look a little better.

absolutely terrible, she couldn't even manage to cut the hairs around my ears. there's long hairs scattered on the sides of my head. one side is longer then the other. my fault for going to such a cheap place. you get what you pay for.
i've had monique do my hair here many times in the past and it's always been great.

before coming to this location, i used to go to fantastic sam's on 1960 and eldridge but then my favorite hairstylist left and so did my favorite hairstyle. now i have had a whole bunch of experiences from oh my god i feel like a million bucks to oh my god wtf happened to my hair! last time i went i got a haircute (yes, i wrote haircute) from matthew. excellent customer service, super hilarious, and oh yes - great haircut! he cut my hair exactly as i told him. if my haircut was based on just this one experience then this location would have five stars but unfortunately that is not the case.one time i came here and there was a guy who i have never seen before. i gave him clear directions on how to cut my hair but unfortunately he used the clippers all the way up to the middle of my head. i looked like i was back in high school and was going for the "i got my hair cut so that i won't have to go get it cut for the next two months" look. fortunately though he managed to make it all even and in the end it was not a totally awful experience.over all, really friendly staff and mostly great hairstylists.
adriana at great clips did a great job cutting my daughter jade's hair. she took her time, and was very pleasant. thank you!
i haven't had a problem with my hair cuts here, but i am disappointed that i received a coupon on yelp when i checked in and they wouldn't honor it. nice job great clips.

always such a great experience here,  i love it.  everyone is nice but best of all this place is the best haircut i've ever gotten.  and not pricey at all.  i would recommend this place to everyone in a heart beat.

don't bother coming here.  i literally just got a haircut here, and i felt compelled to write a review.this lady named evelia cut my hair.  i just asked for a trim on the back and my sideburns, and that's what she literally did.  took all but three minutes.  went up to pay, and they charged me for a full haircut.  i was flabbergasted because all i wanted was a trim, and that's what i got.  still, she stood her ground and charged me $13 [they advertise $5 for a trim]  for 3 minutes of her time.  i'm furious about it, and i will never come back here again.  they rip you off and charge you for something more than what you asked for and received.so word of advice....1) never come here again because they will charge you for more than what you receive2) if for some reason you feel really passionate about coming to this particular great clips location, don't ask for evelia to be your stylist3) people that nickel and dime you like this should never receive anyone's business

nice barber shop. the barbers in there were very social, entertaining and professional. i'm so used to going  to a barber shop where the barbers talk amongst themselves and i'm just a number.. the barbers actually talk to the customers and seem to enjoy what they do.the quality of work was good. i got compliments on my hair.
great price and great haircut. plus it's super-fast!

i usually go to great clips because its a decent price and haircut. i went to this location right before christmas and got a middle 20s girl as a haircutter, her name was kerstin or kirstin. she was on her phone more than half the time, appeared to be under the influence and slurring her words. she did a horrible job on my haircut and i let her know it was not the cut i asked for and she was directly rude back to me. i will never return and great clils needs to revise their hiring requirements.

i started going to great clips a few years ago when i lived in michigan.  since then, i've been to several great clips salons in various part of the country.  i tried gc-ashford center after moving to the houston area and have been very impressed.  the staff is very nice and they've always done a great job with my hair.  i have never had to wait more than a few minutes to get in a chair and the stylists are usually very efficient with quick haircuts.  the price is extremely reasonable.

i made my first visit to this salon back in july.  i was greeted as soon as i walked in and didn't have to wait long to get my hair cut.  i was very happy with the service and the quality of my hair cut.  the price is right and the service can't be beat.  if you're in the area, i would stop by.
doesn't matter who you get to cut your hair here. they all will do you right.  if you don't want to wait , make sure you check in on line before coming.
omg... the best customer service and quality on their hairstylist. everyone on the salon have the same standards but tammy (the mgr ) is my girl... #1
my first time going, didn't know you could check in before hand but it was still a quick wait. very happy with the way andrea cut my hair.

as others have mentioned, use their app to check in ahead of time and avoid the wait.  i checked in on a busy day where the wait was over 45 minutes, and when i arrived 45 minutes later, i was attended to within 1 minute!

this is my first time here, and i loved it. i haven't been able to find a good hair salon ever since i moved to the us two years ago but kathy was a joy to work with. i will definitely be a frequent customer here.
fast, friendly, fun for kids and great stylists, especially ms kathy! thank you all for your patience and consideration with our kids!
i checked in on the app, is easy and fast. when i arrived the lady was waiting for me. silvia did excellent!! i definitely go back
great place to get haircut and shampoo or conditioning treatments. our family favorite salon!

my daughter went to get a trim - just keep same style and trim layers.   when she came home and flat ironed it - we saw how bad it was.  choppy layers that don't even make any sense, random pieces of hair sticking out.  no way to fix it right now unless she goes really short and cuts off 3 inches.    i was very surprised because my  younger daughter has gone there and always had a good haircut and the older one went once too and was happy which is why she returned.  but won't be going back again.

it's a good place to have a quick haircut. most of the staff in the store are very friendly but there are some people who have attitude but if you're lucky you'll find a good one.they have a online check-in app make sure you do that so that you don't want to waste you time sitting in the saloon.

very friendly! great customer service and attention to detail. i go here a lot to get my hair shampooed and styled and they always spend a lot of time and care on my hair. they don't rush at all, each and every single one has been really friendly . i complaints, i am very happy with this place!
my whole family uses this location.  great, friendly, hard working employees. you can check in through their app to speed up the process and decrease waiting time. highly recommended!

my kids begged me to go somewhere else for haircuts and they'll finally get their wish. i just received horrible customer service after giving them years of business. their stylist and haircuts provided are mediocre, not a quality cut. i went there mainly for convenience and it was cheap, always goes back to the old saying, "you get what you pay for".
only came here because i had a coupon and just got the worst haircut ever. i echo brian z's comment that the staff only cared about getting through as many haircuts as possible. i won't be back.

got hair cut by rosa she's super sweet and knows how to cut and style.  check in online it works wonders especially since i brought my 2 year old in. i didn't have to sit but for a couple seconds. very clean professional place.

actually, the whole reason why i remember this place is because they greet everyone with "hi welcome to great clips!" i get exactly the service i need for a price i'm perfectly willing to pay. if i'm quiet, the staff is totally respectful of that. idle chit-chat really helps me connect with the staff. you know what? i'm completely content with my experience every single time i come here, even if there's a little bit of a wait.
they always do a great job for my son.  i really needed a cut today, so i went today for myself.  dora did an excellent job on my cut! love it!! will be going back! thanks dora!
