walking in i wasn't even greeted by the lady at the front desk like i normally am at any great clips location i visit no mater what state i'm in. the lady at the front didn't even ask if i've check in online or anything. if you ask me i think she was overwhelmed with the amount of people already there and people coming in the establishment. you can tell the lady had an attitude. when she asked me what i came in for i proceeded to tell her a hair wash. she asked me how long my hair was and if i needed a style. i said no, just a hair wash and finger blow dry (which is free) she then told me that they can't dry my hair all the way without charging me an extra $30. as confused as i was, thinking that every location was the same. she said that if i wanted a round brush dry or style she wound have to charge me an extra $30. i told her i just needed a wash and finger blow dry. this lady had a bad attitude. i don't know what crawled up her butt but this is clearly not good customer service. as i met my stylist, keisha, who by the way was super nice and very friendly, she helped make a change in my mood about this particular location shift to the brighter side. keisha was wonderful. she did a great job with my long hair and her scalp massage game is on point!!! lol! while i was talking with her i found out that the lady in the front was in fact the manager. tammy is her name. i couldn't believe that such a person in her position was so rude. ugh!!! anyway, keisha did half way dry my hair and she did show concern for my shirt being a little damp which she did dry with her blow dryer. all in all i rate this place a two stars. the people who work there seem nice but the manager should have better customer service and show show a better example for her co-workers that maybe one day they would become manager... just a nicer one.

they're always very sweet here when we come in. my hubby checks in online whenever we're on our way to the salon, so there's never a wait when we walk in. they always remember us. very polite, very friendly, and very efficient when it comes to cutting hair.
tammy is the best stylist!  knows exactly what you want from your description. very professional,  must ask for her when you come for an awesome haircut!

was nervous when i saw that all the hairdressers were women, but it turns out that a barbershop down the street had recently closed down and many men were coming into this great clips instead. my hairdresser (didn't get her name) was very patient, asked lots of questions and seemed dedicated to giving me exactly what i wanted. i'll be coming back!
last week i took my son in for a haircut and the stylist cut it uneven, it has no shape either.  i'd rather spend 20.00 at a local barber shop than to come back to great clips.

i went in here the other day do one of their $6.99 cuts. i wanted a trim. she cut off 3 inches. i wanted a "v" not a "u" and she did that but she didn't make sure all the ends were matched up. it was a terrible experience. i cried when i got home. everything people say about great clips was confirmed. not going back. ever

got a chance to stop by this great clips location during their opening weekend and i am so glad i did. i thought great clips was mostly for men, but to my surprise they offer blowouts and my stylist was incredibly experienced and skilled with women's hair. i got a style done for a wedding i attended and was so happy with the quality, speed, and care of my stylist. i'll definitely be coming back for a cut or another blowout!

yadira cut my hair november 24, 2017 6:30pmshe did an amazing job!!!!she shampooed and conditioned my hair so well!!!!!! it smells soooooo good!!!!!!she trimmed my hair!!! i loved her technique. she was very professional. i was in and out she did such a good job!!!!!

i am so done with this place. i have been coming here for over a year but no more. they have this b*llsh*t system where you "check in" online and it tells you the wait... 15 minutes, 40 minutes, 90 minutes, whatever. i work very nearby so i can monitor when it gets down to 0 (zero) minutes and i check in and go. every freakin' time, it's not zero minutes. it's 10, or 15, 20 minutes. so infuriating, and completely unacceptable. typical corporate franchising nonsense. and then while you're waiting employees sweep up, use the restroom, fraternize... all with people waiting there like sheep. see ya' not-so-great clips.

stop by to see yadira, one of the best at doing fades for sure. she takes the time to check your haircut and she can style it as you like it. it seems that she has years of experience doing men's haircuts. highly recommended!!check in is easy, i usually stop by around 8:00pm or so when there's hardly any people and there's no wait. premises are clean and easy parking up front.

i went there to get my ends cut. i told the lady to only cut the ends because i am growing my hair. she literally chopped my hair. it took me a year and a half to grow it as long as i had it and in less than 5 minutes she chopped it. i am so mad about it. unfortunately i forgot the name of this person but someone that can't listen to what you are saying when it comes to cutting your hair, should not be working as a hair dresser.

if anyone who is inspired by bangs on pinterest, don't go here. and if so please ask them if they know what "fringe bangs" are, if they say no never heard of it. leave. i should of known that first red flag. i am seriously disappointed, mostly because i consider $20 a lot for a damn haircut. anything over $20 is ridiculous unless the person has inches of hair that needs to be cut and styled. i went in the other day and asked the guy if i can get fringed bangs, he didn't know what it was called and i showed him a picture on pinterest. they were light longish bangs with a gradual length on the side if you want to put your hair up. he first grabbed a few pieces of my hair (another red flag) like wtf is that? i said can you get a little more? and i was hoping he would style the sides. he didnt. he probably didn't pay attention to the length of my bangs. he sprayed alot of water all over my hair, i got a cut for a trim on the layers (he barely touched them) and left me with damp messed up hair. soon as i got home, washed and dried. i was pissed that my hair still felt super dry that i had to come back and do the layers. but i should of asked someone to fix the bangs. when i posted an ig story, i got comments saying i should of gone somewhere to pay $60 for stupid bangs!! because i got what i paid for??? $20 should not mean leaving someone with a terrible cheap ass cut. it's supposed to be a professional salon! not a training beauty school. a friend said he butchered my hair and she can't do much and to wait it out. i can't believe this guy left me out of my chair looking like that. i wish i can get my partial refund back. one star for the girl who did the extra trim. please pay attention to the stylist if they aren't focused on your hair or needs. it may just be hair but it looks ridiculous and a waste of money. i really don't understand this industry when it comes to spending a fortune for a decent cut. and the bangs was really nothing hard to do for someone in his position. age and gender has nothing to do with it either. he's hardly anywhere near what i called old, he can keep up to trends and this is not a difficult one. i'm just so upset i have to deal with this for months to it grows back!!!

my boyfriend went in for a hair cut and he told the lady how he wanted it and when he came out, the back of his head was uneven and cut too short..not at all how he wanted it..he says he's never going back and wish he went somewhere else. don't recommend.

i always got my cut with kim when i have coupons in the mail.  as of october 2017 prices are 17 bucks for haircut.  coupons in mail give you 3 bucks off.  this review is for the torrance location at hawthorne and torrance blvd.  i like how the computer system already keeps my style profile in place and that i can check in online.  no more guessing games and walking out due to the barber being fully committed for the day! unlike some barbers expect to shower on your own to get rid of stuck hairs.  shampoo and wash is extra.  no such thing as razor shaves for the back unless if you pay extra.  photos were taken the day of the cut, 5 on top medium fade with 0 on side.

got my cut today from angelica. i showed her a picture of how i wanted the cut and she went ahead and did her thing...totally different from what i  wanted.  asked her about using the scissors instead of the trimmer and she responds "not this time" !!! so what's the deal here??? a major disappointment and did not find her polite at all...$17 for a shitty haircut with rude behavior, never sitting in her booth again!

recently, great clips started giving preferential treatment to customers who give them a higher tip. these days, it's always a long wait there. so when you go there ask for a particular stylist, they will say 10 or 20 min or will say 1 or 2 people ahead. when you sit and wait, they will call someone who just showed up. if you ask them, they would say the other person checked in online, but that person's name was not there in the check-in list (as per their computer screen). if you ask them, they would say, it's the system that shows the other person was ahead. you could clearly tell this is a false claim by monitoring the way that they try to manage. finally noticed the other person paid a way higher tip than usual tips. this clearly shows if you start paying a higher tip, you could cut the line.

went for a hair cut last week. very disappointed. feels like i didn't even get a hair cut. i think the lady was too into talking with other stylist than to put focus on cutting my hair. had asked for front layers and looks like she didn't even touch the front. bangs were still long and had to get one of my family members to touch it up after going in for my hair cut. what a waste of $20. defiantly won't be returning. san pedro location is better.

recently i decided to cut off at least 4+ inches of my hair. mobile check in is a super cool feature! i typically spend almost $150 to $200 for a haircut. both my boyfriend's haircut, and my hair cut plus conditioning treatment came out so cheap and both of us loved out haircuts. we will be coming back for sure! great service, prices and haircuts! only downfall is that their parking lot can be a bit crazy during busy times

went for a small trim and i actually got that. everyone there is super nice, took the time to understand what i wanted when i said 1in  she cut 1in. i forgot her name started with a y, i would recommend anyone to this specific great clips.

i have been coming here for over three years. i am a satisfied customer! i really like how karla cut my hair; i have seen it grow fast when she handles it. she's nice, won't rush. just one reason i gave them a 4 and not 5 is because they will try to sell you products but you can find these items elsewhere and cheaper! overall, i like it here.

worst experience ever at this place. my 11 year old son literally got the worst verbal abuse ever by the lady veronica who cut his hair. for example when my son said he felt like a robot she came back with robots sit still better. also when hair got down his shirt she blamed him for taking his arm out of the apron and when she tried to pull his shirt out to blow dry it she yanked it telling him that he needs to let go in a rude manner. i have never in my life experienced a hair dresser that rude!!!! never will i return to this location again!!!! to add on my son hasn't had a hair cut in over a year because he grew it out to donate it and right off the back she said it wasn't long enough. i have the ponytails and when i got home i measured them and they were more than long enough. i honestly think this lady just doesn't like cutting kids hair. my daughter and i were taking pictures of the process not for youtube or social media but for his journey in life and memories and she asked him "do you get recorded a lot?" of course he said yes. she came back with a comment saying "well i don't!" it's the next day and i'm still upset about this experience.

nice place to get hair cut. i've always come here to get my haircut. it's best if you check-in through their website to get an idea how long you wait before you are next. staff is friendly. i get buzz cut which is really simple for the employee to do. depending on the employee, when they cut my sideburns it's uneven or its cut too much. i wish they can be a little more cautious or caring when cutting hair so it's symmetrical

i have been getting my haircut from yadira for 6 years now and i follow her wherever she goes. thank you for always giving me great haircuts and for introducing me to tapers. you are very friendly and very clean.
ive had many great haircuts at this place. they are fairly inexpensive but do a high quality job. the manager is great, they are always very friendly and they work hard.

i've been coming to great clips for the last 6 haircuts. so 5-6 month. i guess i got the luck of the draw my first time by getting greg to cut my hair. greg does a great job and he's a nice guy as well. the shop is busy, turn over is fast enough, it's clean, staff is always friendly and the price is right.if you don't want to wait the 10-30 minutes, download there mobile app and make a same day appt! just remember to set your appt within 15-20 minutes of your planned arrival!

my wife and i have been coming to this great clips for about a decade.  at some point in the first year or 3, johanna made an impression on us and became our regular stylist.she always does a good job shaping our heads and her fun and friendly personality just make it that much better.to be clear, everyone at great clips is great and we have used other stylists on those rare occasions when johanna was off and we simply had to get a cut right away.  always a good experience.as my household has grown a bit in the last few years, johanna remains our regular stylist and she now also does my little girl's hair, as well as my mom-in-law's hair.

my husband said to give this place 5 stars.  he walked in with 8 people ahead of him and he was still back to the truck within 25 minutes!  fast service, and his hair looks pretty good!he'll definitely go back here!!!!yay!

my daughter got her first haircut today and everything went as smoothly as i could imagine. walked in, got called in right away, got a haircut by kimberly (who was lovely), and went about our day!location has plenty of parking at no cost. will go back soon!

came in here a few days ago, the short lady and yes i said short, i'll explain why, who cut my hair had the nerve to make me slide down on the chair  so that she could reach the top of my head to cut my hair, rather than pressing the lever to lower the chair like what everybody else does there, to reach the top part of my hair.this lady needs extra training. since she realized that she was struggling with me she laughed at me and didn't say excuse me or anything, so unprofessional. most likely i will not be returning to this salon.

reason why i chose to use this barber shop is for convenience of closeness to home and making appointment for prompt service. i made an appointment on line and the waiting time was 59 min. i got to barber shop on my 50th min. and the one lady barber was doing hair on a woman and another lady waiting on a chair for her turn. my name was next to the lady waiting on a chair. that means that i have to wait for another 1/2 hour or more. told the lady barber that their on line appointment is not accurate and i left and went elsewhere to get a haircut.

they did not do a good job.  i showed the lady a picture of a lob and she said she could do it.   it turned out very choppy/uneven.  if the stylist didn't know how to layer, she should have admitted it!  so disappointing.  i got what i paid for since i was desperate for a cut, so i'm not mad.  but great clips should build a better reputation for themselves by setting standards and by hiring people who don't just practice cutting hair for dolls!  now i have to go to ulta in the same plaza to have them fix it hahaha

really bad customer service. they've always had two particular employees with a really bad attitude, i don't know their names. i was a long time customer but i left because of the service, today i came back hoping they improved or the employees not there but they're still there with the same terrible customer service.

i've been growing out my hair and this has been the process of how it looks thanks to nisha. she's amazing. so happy my hair is getting long. it looks fabulous with the products that this location has to offer.

wow.  this used to be a great place to get family haircuts. friendly stylists who took pride in their work and made you feel welcome. not anymore. under the leadership of temmika, this place has gone downhill.  zombie like greeting when you walk in.  they all seem annoyed to have clients.  temmika yelled at both of us during our kids haircuts.  at separate times, our kids has asked us a question so we stepped closer to answer.  temmika shouted across the salon that we couldn't stand there. the stylist could have told us, but temmika had to make a big deal in front of everyone.  it felt like the dmv.  we have 2 kids. neither stylist was pleasant to the kids.  overall, won't ever come back. there are better places to get your hair cut.  avoid temmika and her rude crew.

got my haircut today from quinisha!    she was fantastic.  she was super thorough, talented, courteous.  i've been coming to his place for a while and they're all great, but quinisha stands out! couldn't ask for more. i will be sure to request her again!  couldn't be happier.
jus had my hair cut. quick and jus what i wanted. selena. the one.with the nice eyes did a good job

worst hairstylist ever! this location is so close to my house it's easy and tempting to stop by . the few times i have ,i have regret it so much. every stylist in this location have cut my boys hair and they do a terrible job. on even hairs, marks of the blades . i had to go in once a second time just to get them to fix it. and they where outraged . but you could clearly see there mistakes . i'm not a hairstylist but i could see all their mistakes. this last time the guy took 40 min cutting my sons hair . at the end he didn't cut it like i asked for . the right side was higher then the left side. and the left side you couldn't even see the fade it was more like "0" and then all of a sudden boom there's hair ,straight into like a number 6. man will know what i'm talking about . my son does his hair to the side so you could imagen it

i've been a regular customer here for a while. been through a couple of stylist and the one i enjoy the most is selena. she's very good and has a good eye. it's usually clean and don't really have to wait too long with the online checking in.
this place doesn't have wifi so that's the only draw back ... feels like an updated super cuts

i have taken my son there more i would like to admit. i did go back repeatedly in hopes to get this one lady that had the best attitude as well as knew exactly what i wanted, i don't think she works there anymore, she is the only reason i'm giving this place two stars. sadly, he was stuck with others that did hack up jobs, aka uneven, hair in the back standing up because it was cut way too much. oh and their attitudes suck, listen to the other people that have stated the same. sorry that we bothered to come in for service, the last time i told the lady flat out (after her poor haircutting skills botched my kids head up again) i will never be back and i am definitely sticking to that word. don't waste your time or your money here, maybe re-training would be helpful. even some customer service classes may do this place justice.

great clips is a hit or miss.of course, that depends on the person who is cutting your hair. they don't take appointments and you don't know who's working unless you call ahead of time. their staff schedule changes so it's kinda inconsistent.you do have the option of waiting for your stylist to be free. and i do like they save notes of your last hair cut. however, the numbers doesn't mean you'll have a 'great clip'the online check in system is odd --but i do like that you have an idea of how long you have to wait before you get to the store. maybe eventually, they should add their stylist schedule to the app.there is a loyalty program, which is 10 hair cuts = a free one.parking is always available, it's on the 3rd floor of the midtown plaza next to gnc and pizza rev.i really like niesha. she knows what's she's doing.i liked michael - but he no longer works there.i also liked xxx (i forgot her name) but she's a manager that is helping to open the glendale store.i usually go to ulta after my haircut --but that has nothing to do with this review.$16 for adults if you are wondering.

will never come here again, it's funny how the owner of this place will offer u a coupon for a free hair cut for you next visit when they have already fucked up ones, ...  came in just to cut the sides and and trim the top, and i walked out bald.... don't come here employees look all tired and don't know what there doing

i came in today with pretty realistic expectations, knowing that i was at great clips and with a coupon from ralphs. as many say, you take a risk with budget haircuts. my stylist was a young woman with pink in her hair. i had arrived within an hour of closing, and the wait list was stacking up. she hurried me into my seat, asking me what i wanted before i even sat down.  i came in asking for an even cut, just to take off length (no layers, etc - just a straight cut). i usually have long hair but am not afraid of taking off 6+ inches at a time since shorter cuts usually gives me more time in-between salon visits. i showed her an approximate length to remove with my hands (8-10 inches) and apologized in advance for my hair, which was a wet and tangled mess from the pool. 1. she did not even bother to fully comb out my hair. she briefly whipped a comb through my hair, but there were still tangles and knots. to give some context, my hair looked "wavy" and yet i have pin-straight hair normally. 2. when she reached a particularly difficult knot, she flat out told me, "you have a really bad knot. i don't know what you want me to do about it. you'll have to deal with it later." 3. she hacked a chunk off my hair and started matching the length around the rest of my head. she was done in less than five minutes and handed me a mirror to approve. when i questioned the length being even, she then went back for another ten minutes actually double-checking her work (which i noticed she had never done) and even confessing, "oh yeah, some parts were longer than others." more snips, snips, snips to even everything out. 4. about halfway through the appointment she tells me, "sorry. i forgot to ask you if you like having your hair parted on the side or in the middle. if you want your hair parted in the middle, i have to go back and fix the lengths again because i already cut with a side parting." now, i really was fine with the side part which is why i did not say anything in the beginning, but i really did not trust her ability to tell if things were even - and a middle part just seemed simpler to tell symmetry. more snips, snips, snips. 5. at the end, i could still see uneven edges. she had already hacked off 30% more length than i wanted trying to "fix" all the uneven lengths. i was not willing to let her keep trying and leave me with nothing at all. i am now at home with a cut way shorter than i wanted and am terribly upset. pay the $10-15 extra dollars and go to fantastic sams. avoid the risk of this place.

i got a haircut from the short hispanic lady. i'm a nice person and i was nothing but polite to her but she was so angry for some reason. she had all this pent up rage built up and took it out on me. she asked what i wanted to do to the back of my hair, "clip or buzz" i replied, saying i didn't know because for almost all my life i've had long hair and short hair was a new thing for me. i chose to clip.after that, i looked at it and saw it was still a little too long, so i asked if she could buzz it. she proceeded to get visibly angry but then starting buzzing the back of my neck. as a kid, i've gotten buzzcuts before and i know it doesn't take that long. she buzzed the back of my neck so much that it was soooo painful and the next day, i woke up with blood on my pillow. she must've just been buzzing skin because even i knew it shouldn't have taken that long.after that, it still looked a little funky so i asked if she could kind of fade it going up. she responded with "first you want me to clip it, so i clipped it. then you wanted me to buzz it?? when is this going to end? i don't know what you want!"yes, she yelled at me in front of everyone over a harmless question. i replied with "sorry, it's okay you don't have fade it then" i'm really not sure what her problem was. she had so much rage hidden within her lmao. and on top of that she gave me one of the worst haircuts i've ever had if the person who gave me that awful haircut/bloody neck is reading this, i just wanna know why you were so angry that day lmaoo.

the managers are very rude !! my boyfriend was there yesterday and he said the person that was in charge i believe his name is william shouted at the employees then took one of them in the office leaving a client in the chair and you can clearly hear the yelling , so unprofessional made my boyfriend feel uncomfortable in this salon and every time we go there we get rushed out . bad customer servic! they always have new people working there every time we go  maybe because of the managers bad attitude toward them. the other day  tameka the manager yelled at some clients because they were standing close to the stylist chair. very very rude !  i would give 0 star if i can

well i just got here and i can already tell you the customer service is pretty lousy.i checked in through yelp a few hours ago, and when i entered i was asked whether i checked in, so i replied yes. the hair stylist said their online system doesn't work sometimes so i should check in again through their web site. i asked "if online isn't working, can i can check in in-person?" which was ignored. so now i get to wait after three other people with no real apology, least of all acknowledgement.totally understood online systems sometimes don't work, but don't (1) not ask more details about the appointment i tried to make, or (2) ignore your customers. guess gc doesn't want my business!update: pretty good and efficient haircut. during my haircut though, one of the stylists was talking about the guests (including myself) in spanish, i guess assuming that we wouldn't understand.

i have gone there for almost two years now but i don't recommend it to my friends. they have done my hair uneven and i had to go somewhere else to get it fix. also when i took my little brother they cut his ear and it was bleeding!!! horrible the guy doing it didn't even tell me plus his hair cut was also uneven they made a bold spot on him .

we came here simply because we did not want to wait at our usual barber shop.....i can honestly tell you, we are sold! the service we got was exceptional & the our hair looks fantastic (pic)we clearly found our new spot.sorry, ian we didn't come while you were still here!

i called this location and asked for today's availability.  the woman asked me to hold for a minute... when she came back on the line she said "yes?"  i said "yes?" "can i help you?" she asked. "you ask me to hold...?" i responded. then i can't believe it when she tells me, "whoa, calm down. this isn't the same person you talked to before."seriously?? if they can't even handle a phone call, i doubt they can perform a haircut.
very good and patience with children.nancy was very good with my son who has a fear of getting his haircut. he was very happy

i've been a client of great clips for a few years now unfortunately my usual salon got closed down. i checked in online and my wait went past 30 min the check in time. totally understandable if there was a big crowd but this was not the case. there was one worker standing by the register gossiping distracting the others cutting clients hair, supper annoying. after 30 or so min my son got called. he has never complained about a haircut in his life but this day he asked to never take him back. unfortunately this person has no experience with the tools she cut the back of his ear and lower neck, and quickly blamed it on him. she also didn't clean up his lower back line which is common when getting a fade. now i get kids move around but in his 8 years no one has cut him while cutting his hair. i will definitely no come back they sure lost a potential client..

i usually never leave reviews but i've been coming here for quite some time now. i've always gone with denise & she's amazing! if you want somewhere where they have good customer service and know what they are doing come here! ask for denise and you won't disappointed.

my son loves here to come get his haircuts. he has such a way if style and i love the fact that they save the information from the previous time so all i have to say is " yup the same as last time " lol so much easier . also i recommend you to download their app so you can check in before you get there so your wait won't be long.

for thos guys who like to get half on the sides with a nice blend, do not go with shirley! she is horrible when it comes to that. she not only cut too much, but she does not know how to blend.  damn!!! very unhappy with my haircut.this will be the last time i go there because of this bad experience.

came in today to see veronica for an overdue haircut. she's been cutting my hair for years, and is the only person who understands what i want without having to say much. i've gone through multiple hair styles with her, including long layers way past my shoulder blades, a-line bobs, and my current pixie with my mini taper fade. i've loved them all. i know i can always count on her for new styles, or just a simple clean up. thanks for always keeping me lookin' fabulous!!

i hadn't cut my hair in years due to salons attempting to pressure me into doing something i don't want + trying to upsell to something i don't need. today i had the pleasure of getting my hair cut by the stylist carla. she did a great job, made the experience extremely comfortable and quick, i felt at ease! i will definitely be back due to her outstanding customer service and have already recommended her to others.

young and beautiful women at great clips the women put in work. i got a taper fade "0" both my son and i got our hair cuts here. my son got a lollipop and a sticker. that's better then a dumb ballon from supercuts great clips is where the clips are great. denise: gets down with the clippers

they are awesome! the ladies there are super nice and make you feel at home. denise was amazing!! i'm super cautious about my hair and she made everything just perfect i usually doubt my hair after i leave but i felt pretty and had no doubt whatsoever!! thank you denise you are perfect!! don't go anywhere!!

this place is a joke..the two ladies especially the older hispanic lady were both condescending. the older hispanic lady doesn't know how to do a basic cut and booted me out of her chair and the other lady had to finish her job..pathetic..will never go back to this place again

i haven't had a bad haircut here since i started coming monthly since 2016. every stylist is easy to talk to when you have questions or want to change something up. recently i brought in a picture and had flor and she made an even better version on me.

very pleased with my haircut, denise is amazing she's been doing my hair for 8 years now and i literally trust no one else with my hair! she knows exactly what i want and doesn't get scissor happy when she sees long hair like other salons i've been to. definitely coming back when it's time for a trim!
quick cut for my boys. you can check in online which i love. service is always fast and friendly. nice selection of hair products, too.

i tried to go to the nearby great clips but found they were closed. i called this location because i knew i would be cutting it close and didn't want to inconvenience them. they told me they would take me if i got there before 9pm. i rushed to their location and got there at 8:58pm. they were locked up and refused service. horrible customer service.

i just got my hair cut here today. the worst hair cut i've ever had. she messed up my hair so bad. i showed her a picture of what i wanted. simple layers. it isn't even and looks horrible. i'm a teenage girl, i'm going to get made fun of so hard because of my haircut. don't come here, it isn't worth it.

definitely would rather pay $60 for a decent haircut then $15 for a sloppy job.as usual, they didn't listen to what i wanted but instead what they want. i only wanted my ends to be cut to minimum and she assured me "only the tips and minimum " even showed me how much she was going to cut.. well at the end she said i took all the ends off and i came home to more then one and half inches off and one side was shorter then the other. i wear clip in extensions so now i can't due to how awful the cut is.. my friend and i will definitely not return. nor i will recommend this place. don't want my money back. i will have to wait for my hair to grow and go to a real hairstylist!

i just want to let everyone know that i recommend verónica, she is such a great stylist! she gave me the best haircut, wash and blow dry. she knows exactly what she's doing and listens to what you ask for. thank you veronica for making me feel beautiful!
got my haircut by veronica, i've had my hair cut by her before and she always does a great job. never disappoints me and always exceeds my expectations!

service : quick stop for a haircut, the lady who cut my hair is awesome.i loved my hair! she's very detailed with what i want.note: you need to log in on th website to be able to check in and be on the list. it will show you how long is the wait. is close by costco too.price: $15 haircut  parking: street or parking lot

i went in with my friend to get a hair cut. my friend supposed to have a bob style hair cut and i just needed my bang cut. my person still works on my bang but my friend hair cut was done.i was chocked. i look at my friend's hair and it was a sloppy work. some of her strands are more than a centimeter longer than the others.we had to walk back to get it fix by someone else. still, both of the stylists did not shave the back of her neck! these people give great clips a bad name!i was gonna no star but i gave two for mine since i have no complaint for mine.

i've been here several times since this location opened last year.  the parking is hell on earth, because it's in the same plaza as the costco, but you don't have to wait if you check in online ahead of time!  i remember coming in on a busy weekend, and there were at least 4-5 people waiting, putting their names down.  i walked right up and was seated in a salon chair first, because my name was on the online check in, #1 spot!  all the other people in the waiting area gave me the wtf looks, ha.every member of my immediate family has been here, and it's a decent job each time for the price.  the best part, i got a ton of coupons for 2017 last year- for $9.99 cuts.   i handed them out to my friends like candy, and two of my friends used them.i usually see two, older ladies working when i'm there.  they are nice and do a decent job.  one time, a patron was mumbling and acting like an asshole to the cashier, i stared him down and ending up tipping the nice stylist extra because some people can just be mean unnecessarily.

i love great clips and i love that this location opened close to home. i went in the staff was friendly and location was clean. i met my new stylist, maria f. she totally understands my hair and my needs. i have been to see her about 4 times now and i love my hair!!! she's definitely a character, but that's what makes her great! doesn't hurt that she's an awesome stylist too

good cuts for kids. no waiting this sunday morning. denise and maria did a great job. this place is only for haircuts. so make sure you know what you want. bring a photo or take a photo on your phone-is highly suggested. i was looking for may as she is the best, but call ahead to find out her schedule. all in all the girls are fine.

i came in after work for a bang trim and maria was the one to cut my hair when she was going to call out my name, she looked at my name all weird like a substitute teacher taking role and scared to mess up a students name. i mean you don't hear the name season a lot but still i am your customer and you have the nerve to criticize my parents for giving me a unique name instead of "any other generic name". when i told her i wanted a bang trim she acted like it was a hassle and that she won't that much money on me. when she thinned out my bangs she used the thinning scissors way to high up to the point that i have short hairs fraying out of my bangs! how hard can you mess up a bang trim?! if you had a bad day lady you shouldn't take it out on your customers.
this used to be fantastic sam's. i left when they closed down and my hairstylist left and that is mei. but she is back. she is very popular because she knows how to cut asian heads with hair.

i am kind of glad i walked out when i did the staff is rude especially the elderly lady maria. yelling at her co worker i felt uneasy being in there and so i left i told her i had signed in but was leaving bc all i wanted was a simple trim and she gave me a dirty look didn't even say anything. not going back never! guess it was a sign
the place is great but staff is very rude and unprofessional especially her name is "maria"

my new go to hair stylist is selena. so i came here after the holidays since i was in the area shopping and thankfully was quickly seated with selena for a haircut. usually i'm super basic and just get the clippers shortening my hair to a length i'm used to and have rocked that style for 90% of my life and mentioned that i was looking for a new look but had no idea what to even attempt. i told selena "i'm trusting you to make me attractive" and she gave me a fade which is a style i've never considered. thanks and i'll be back!

cheap prices like supercuts but way worse results. i'm not ageist but i knew i was in trouble when i walked in and it was just 3 older ladies waiting for their next victim. and for a place with no other customers i have no idea why the one that took me was in such a rush. 5 minute haircut with no exaggeration. snip snip snip and then she basically pushed me out of the chair. no fine tuning, no offer for product just a "you're done, get out". she also called me hairy which was odd. yeah i have hair and want it cut but i don't think anybody else has ever described me as hairy.
maria - very rude to her customers and co-workers. avoid at all costs!i'm going to call ahead to see who is working whenever i need a haircut.

wow! unable to follow directions on the hair cut. both of my boys had to sit back down with different people to get the hair cut we verbally requested. if there was a negative -1 i would leave that. smh

i actually hate this location so much. i've been going to great clips for about 2 years now, going to a riverside location and back here when i'm in the area. this one is horrible. i've been here 3 times and 2/3 times, i've had the worst haircuts of my life. my first mess up here, they were nice and all, but my chair was flipped around the whole entirety of my haircut. when she finished (cannot recall her name), i was practically bald on the sides of my head. that was her definition of a "fade". i didn't bother reviewing even then but fast forward to today, i was furious. i got cared for extremely fast, but the lady, "maria", had such a horrible attitude. she was a carefree older woman, but did not let me finish talking. she prompted to ask about my sides and i tried telling her what i wanted overall and she cut me off 3 times, "only the sides". i would try to continue but she would repeatedly shush me. i am an extremely patient guy but also very anxious with all the bad hair cuts i've gotten in my life. maria is extremely rough and careless with her close cut razor and when she cut my ear, i said ow pretty loud but she just ignored me. i wanted to cut the top but at that point, i did not even trust her anymore. i told her really short on the top but she prompted that she had it under control. moreover, at the end, she scratched up my neck even worst than my ears. my haircut overall was extremely amateur and i am so dissapointed in this establishment. i don't get why this place hires such horrible people.

i will preface this review with the usual, your miles may vary... i've been to several super cuts and also fantastic sams before... great clips is the newer chain that i finally tried out. for the most part, i've had okay to good experiences to most of these chains. i have had a few really bad experiences... but keep in mind that can happen with any type of business experience. i don't fault these types of places because they serve a niche... but you can sometimes truly say "you get what you pay for..." at least there is more a chance of that at places like this because you generally will see newer stylists with a whole lot less experience. and you typically may pay more for those that have more experience. that statement isn't 100% since sometimes i've had great experiences and haircuts from stylists at super cuts and felt it was a better haircut than the fancier more expensive (almost twice as much) places i've gone to as well. i generally pick to go to places like this because i didn't have time to go to my regular person and just want something quick and affordable. my hair is always cut short and it's pretty simple imho.in general, this place is well kept. very new looking, and clean. the shopping center shares a parking lot with costco alhambra... and to be honest, the parking here is probably some of the worst in la county. so definitely not convenient during costco hours. i came around 7:30 pm, so i did manage to find a parking spot right out front. there were only 2 people stylists when i got there. i did like that you could check-in online and i got a discount on the visit... when i got there, i had a tickle in my throat and had a coughing fit. the lady who cut my hair offered me a bottle of water, so if not for that and the discounted haircut, i probably would have given a 2.5 star for this stylist. she was really nice and the bottle of water showed good customer service, but that can only cover so much of a lack of experience or ability. as i mentioned, there was another stylist providing a haircut already when i arrived... so i assume that maybe he was halfway done? well, i love a quick haircut... but i was done with my haircut had her wash my hair (paid and was out the door) and the other stylist was still not done with the other gentleman's haircut. so perhaps that tells you something... i basically told the woman that i wanted about a 2 on the sides and back... which basically meant i just wanted a trim. i sometimes have gone short like a 1 or 1.5 with a fade, but when i try new stylists, i play it safe and don't go too short until i know they know what they are doing. by the time i was done, i knew my hair wasn't cut evenly. when she stopped to show me her work, she ran her hands through my hair to check the levels... and there were obvious areas that were way off in terms of length. lol. she did correct that, but thankfully she didn't try too hard to compensate because it could have gotten way worse. luckily my hair is styled in a way that can hide the poor haircut... at least until it starts to grow out and get long... then it becomes more obvious. the lady was on the shorter side... and i'm 6'... so she might have had a harder time seeing the top of my head if i'm sitting... but if she was having difficulty she could have asked me to slouch down to make it easier for her...anyway... the experience will get a 3 star... but i likely would avoid this place in the future... if i was really desperate to go back, i would wait for someone else besides the lady. i wish i could recall her name in case some of you are wondering who to avoid... granted perhaps you would have a better experience then me or over time, maybe she will improve, but i won't be 'chancing it' again... when you play russian roulette with your hair, you might as well try someone else next time...

i rarely decide to write bad reviews, but this time i wanted to write one almost right away. i went last sunday to get my hair cut, from long length to shoulder length, bob alike, with layers in the back. the man who was doing my hair seemed ok, no problems with anything. he seemed knowledgeable. i had thought to myself that a man will probably make my hair look horrible, but i gave him a chance. so when he was done, my hair was still wet, and it looked great. i was happy. i didn't do much with it the rest of the day, let it dry. today in the morning, when i was styling it, i took a mirror and when i saw the back of my hair i almost dropped the mirror. he simply cut a "lawyer" of my hair horizontally two inches from the bottom from right to left. it looked like a huge step from one "layer" to the second one. there was so layers! it was a mess, butchered, and cut stupidly. my 5 month old would have done a better job! i had one a meeting at my job today and i tried not to turn backwards to anyone, so embarrassing. during my lunch i went to my hairstylist, and she fixed it the best possible. it still looks kinda off, but much muuuuuuch better. so....if you go there don't expect too much, and try to have a lady cut your hair. i'm really mad, and i'm considering calling my bank to dispute the payment.

i just got my hair cut here again today because i had such a good experience here the last time and the price is good. today's experience was, unfortunately, not as good. the person who cut my hair was heidi. when i got home i noticed that there was a piece of hair that was still long so i had to trim it myself. one side of my hair is also longer than the other side. good thing i always wear my hair in a ponytail so it won't be noticeable. i think i will be going to a different place next time or ask for mollie instead if she's there.

oh man. went for a trim on my long layers. the lady had no idea what she was doing. they're serious when they say "you get what you pay for". first the two ladies took 5 minutes in how to spell my name for the check in. they finally asked me to write it in a post it. she sat me down and i showed her a picture...i've never had uneven layers...not to mention the way she cut my layers...it was tugging on my hair and i just felt split ends galore! i'll never go here again. i miss the old fantastic sams :( also i noticed they don't have their licenses in cosmetology posted like most hair places. i should of known better than to sit down!! :( on a good note the little asian lady was nice but she kept asking me how to cut my hair when i was trusting her as the stylist to know what to do. now i gotta go pay to fix what she did. i guess i'll be getting a real haircut for 5x the price...

had an awful experience today. went in for a trim and to just clean up the sides. maria checked me in. marlene did a terrible job with the trim. she cut way too much off all around, used the clippers and buzzed the sides so short my scalp shows. now my hair is oddly shaped, sticks out in the wrong places and is cut at different lengths. she doesn't know how to cut hair. she said she cut it the way "she" thinks looks good, not how i wanted it. never ever will i send anyone else to this salon. i asked her to contact the manager (heidi?) so i may speak with her and she refused. marlene should not be cutting hair. there was so much more wrong with marlene and what she was saying that the other employee who checked me in was there shaking her head too and agreeing with me.

don't go here! they do not know how to cut hair! i'd give them no stars if i could! we went there for a simple fade and they got all pissy when we told them we didn't like it. they gave my bf the worst haircut ever. i mean you're not supposed to see a like in the hair!

i want to give a shout out to marlita at the rancho marketplace great clips. she is by far the best stylist that has ever cut my hair and trimmed my beard. marlita is a true professional stylist. i highly recommend her.

no rating!  a big "0"!  i went there this weekend to have a trim!  i have a picture of how i want my hair trim!  jennifer was the one who chopped my shoulder length hair!  it was so short that i could've do a pony tail especially when i workout at the gym!  i was in tears when i got home!  will never go to this place again!  jennifer should be fired!!!! !

i really wish i could give them a good review. they are affordable, friendly and clean. but they didn't just do an average job on my son's hair, they butchered it. it was worse than i could do, and i am a terrible hair cutter. the fella who cut my son's hair was incredibly nice and tried his best... but it was so bad i had to go to another barber for cleanup. we will not be returning.

i finally got the app to check in online as some customers got in ahead of me and suggested i do that. it really didn't help. it was the equivalent of walking in. it is also difficult to get any kind of discount (they had coupons and saturday specials the first few months they opened at burbank rancho) and even offered a discount when checking in using the app. all gone now. i found a val pack coupon online and they gave me a "pass" to use it. i waited a long time

i checked in online saturday afternoon and only had a short wait when i arrived at the location. marlita did an exceptional job on my hair. i'm in the midst of growing out a pixie cut and she talked through some options with me that would let me keep sone length while giving me a cute cut that looks great. she was knowledgeable about the different options and how the whole cut would come together; she asked a lot of questions to get an idea of what i wanted before she started cutting and checked in throughout the cut to make sure it was shaping up as i had in mind. i was only visiting the area and don't know when i'll be back but i'd gladly go to her again.

i recently moved to los angeles, and had been looking for a good place to get my hair cut. normally i go to a barbershop back home that does a good job, but when i am strapped for cash i go to great clips. i don't expect great work from them, but for $16 plus tip i expect to at least get some kind of good cut... this did not happen. the barber (leaving his name out of this, because he is a good guy, but bad barber) used the clippers on the top of my head first, and then proceeded to just move it about my head. at this point, it was better to just let him finish, but there was nothing he did that i couldn't have done better. it's safe to say that i got butchered, and i will never be going to another chain barbershop again.

beyond upset with my hair cut. they butchered it :'''(   my hair looks like repunzels hair after that guy chops it all off :/  and why is the front longer then the back??  that's what i get for being cheap.  only when here cuz i had a coupon.  oh oh and on top of that, i was telling the lady how i wanted my hair and she was telling me no and i should do blah blah because blah blah!! nope nope never again.  i have to go get it fixed but i'm scared :( traumatized for life.

i have been here three times. the first time one of my best haircuts in awhile from the very talented black woman who works there. the second time an older (asian?) man who was very rough and nicked me several times. tonight i went there and had the same asian man. i was hesitant to ask for someone else but i decided to try him again. ouch. not only he was rough, but now i have several huge cuts on my neck that hurt and look awful. i'm 42, never have i been cut so bad.. this guy needs to go back to school. ouch. beware.

i walked in an hour before closing time (they close at 9pm). i was hurried over by an asian fella (recto, i believe his name is) who seemed nice. turns out, i picked the wrong fella and time to have my hair cut and show up because he ruined the little bit of hair i have. my advice to anyone else is skip this fella, he doesn't know what he's doing when it comes to working with clippers.
my wife and i just had our hair cut here for the first time and couldn't be more happy. i suggest doing the online check in because we were put next in line upon arrival.

all i have to say is... marlita, marlita... marlita!! i have been to many many salons and barbers around burbank, including floyd's.. and no one listens or can get anything right!  until... marlita. i just stopped in on a whim the day they opened. she not only listens, but she talks you through the entire cut to make absolutely sure that you are getting what you want. great personality and very professional. everyone at this location seems very nice, but marlita is the one to go to. now, not only do i have a new stylist... but so does my brother, my nephew, my niece and my mom. so yes, she is a pro at cutting and styling both men and women at a price that for sure would be a whole lot more elsewhere!

to cut very long hair, salons in the area are priced at $55 to $105. usually, i'd get a groupon and wait a week to get an appointment for cheaper, with someone who isn't great at communicating (or enthusiastic for groupon customers.)so, i decided to try the newly constructed great clips in burbank, and i ended up with a salon-quality haircut for $16! the best part was the wait time--about 5 minutes on a saturday afternoon. catrina is the very friendly and talented stylist who took genuine care in delivering exactly what i'd imagined. i would go here before everyone else discovers this gem! you can always check in online or use their app to reserve a spot ahead of other walk-ins.
no good. beginner level cutting. not worth the $8.99 price. lack customer service skills, unprofessional and unpleasant attitude, and most importantly sad haircut.

i got a coupon for $9.99 haircut so i decided to try them out. i only needed a trim this time. i like that they have an online check in option which also shows the wait time, there was parking, and it wasn't crowded when i showed up. they saw me right away, i'm happy with my trim, and they honored my coupon. the inside was clean and they had colorful partitions between the salon seats. they are also offers for veterans on veterans day which is nice. i was served by jennifer who was great.

go to marlita...she's laid back and listens...she communicates what she's working with before she does it.  i got a coupon and booked online and i was in and out...i dislike haircuts but this was painless

first time going to this location and horrible customer service!!! my family and i walked in and no one acknowledged us and didn't check us in for good 10-15 mins. then the lady (jennifer) who took us had no exp of dealing with customers, she was rude, i was giving her description of what type of haircut and she literally walked away while i was still talking. i was dumbfounded that she actually walked away to the back while i was standing there talking. when she got back and i confronted her about how rude it was what she did, jennifer replied " well i ashtray got what type of haircut you need", really!!!! reverse the roles how the hell would you feel if i have you that type of customer service. my family and i are never coming back to this place just for the fact of what type of treatment we got as customers. sad part is the haircut was great but i believe in service especially when i was respectful and move and did not deserve this from her. maybe she is nice to only certain type of ppl and myself and my family didn't fit the criteria. horrible customer service....

when i walked in a man named oscar began to cut my hair. well lets just say it was bad. and then proceeded to talk bad about my mom who was telling him what he did wrong. i am 15 he should not be saying stuff like that to me. but then a girl named jenifer fixed it and was very nice to us which made the experience a lot better!  after that as we were walking out oscar apologized which made the experience a little better.

we told the stylist to cut our child's hair a certain way and he just butchered it!  it was like he wasn't listening to what we wanted...he had a set way in his mind the way it should look like and just went with it.  however, i reached out to the owner, who invited me back to have the haircut redone.  the second time around was much better...but i should not have to return to a place to have a mistake re-done!  they should get it right the first time...that is just plain common sense and professionalism.

i'm not a fan of these timed haircut chop shops! i have  spontaneously & mistakingly been to 3 great clips in the area in the past 16 mos, if i see there is no wait.    ** 1st) they never use a neck strip between you & the apron they have used on dozens of customers w/warts, moles, blisters, boils,scabs, etc.. they are spreading highly contagious crap! ( if you don't believe me, feel the back of your neck or your significant other or son!! guys, where do you think those bumps came from??!!??!!  this is unsanitary and illegal, please report them to the cal state board of cosmetology or barbering immediately, they need retrained asap!!  ** 2nd) just as soon as they get started cutting your hair the telephone rings or someone comes in to be waited on & sure as you are the one in the middle of the haircut, they will stop and wait on whomever and whatever & then try to up-sell them some hair product while you wait, & then as they finally come back to you and apologize they forget what they were doing and one sideburn goes to your chin & the other is trimmed above the ear and same in the back of your head where you can not see when they spin you around to check your haircut in their hurry to get the next victim!  do not tip if you are not satisfied, it's the whole reason why we do or don't leave gratuities!  it's not an entitlement !  ***did they do a good job? ***were they personable? ***did they give your service undivided attention? ***are you happy w/the end result? *** did you double check the service and what you asked for, or did they rush you to get next client in the chair?  *** if they rushed you, they need more stylists*** you are doing no one a favor by tipping therm generously & having to go elsewhere to start your haircut over again! *** there are many wonderful barbershops & stylists in socal area !!    especially along magnolia or burbank blvd !!    ** another reason i'm a tough critique on the chain type shops, is i went to cosmetology school & was a sales person for a top shelf hair product & if you have seen what i have seen as far as unsanitary, believe me, you would be hopping  out of that chair if they don't use a neck strip!**  other reason is i have had to go to doctor to get boils removed from bak of my neck due to their laziness ! not much fun injections and scalpels cutting these ugly things out,  & the root is usually deeper than what they cut out!  neck strips are very cheap to buy & only take 5-10 seconds to put around your neck under the apron!   god be with you!

i walked in a had a standard shampoo and blow out. the staff was very professional and friendly. the salon was very clean.  i had no appointment but i was taken care of right away. i love how it turned out and i believe i have found my new salon!

i took my grandson for a haircut and he loved it, although forgot the name of the person who cut. i have curly hair and need a straight blow dry every week and took a chance at this salon, since they do more quick haircuts.christina did a wonderful wash and blow dry asking questions what i would like, and was pleased with the results.i went back and marisol did the blow dry using a shine product,  she was quick and hair was silky feel.  note:  if you wash your hair at home you save $$ since the store will charge for a shampoo.

sport clips, the place to get an affordable haircut in la canada ($22), has a new competitor. great clips is a chain of hair salons specializing in affordable haircuts ($15). when they first opened, the cuts were $7.99 (opening special). that lasted a few weeks. now the cuts are $9.99, though i'm not sure how long that promotional price will last.the location is convenient - right next to gelson's. there's plenty of parking. the location isn't busy yet. you can check in and see what the waiting times are by going to the great clips website or downloading the great clips app. that's definitely a nice feature. i think the chain is good about sending out occasional coupons. it's pretty no frills but it gets the job done. they also sell haircare products. sport clips customers all seem to be men and boys.  great clips feels more unisex.

came in with a $9.99 coupon for a haircut, usually $17.00. katsama was my stylist and she did a great job, just a #1 buzz on the sides and back of my head, easy peazy. great conversation. definitely would come back when my usual stylist in glendale is $21.00 plus tip.
really disappointed with my daughter's haircut today. uneven and not a nice cut at all. will not go back.

i went there due to the convenient location and grand opening special ($8.99).  esmeralda did such a terrible job... here are the lowlights:it took almost an hour to do what normally takes about 15-20 minutes (i just ask for 2 on the sides, finger-length up top, far from rocket science.)i told her at least five times that it was too long up top, but the message was never quite received as intended.  when she asked what i meant and where, she lifted up a spot on the left side and asked, "here?"  i said, "yes, and everywhere else up top."  so she just trimmed the left side slightly, and that's how i ended up with a quasi-bowl cut that was longer on the right side than the left.when she showed me the back, i was disturbed, to say the least.  i said, "ummmm... it looks like wolverine back there."  her response, "what?  oh yeah, i see what you mean.  it's naturally curly back there."  first time i'd heard that.  and it's not curly if you actually, you know, cut it.she also wouldn't cut a portion of my hair because of a "cowlick".  that was a new first as well.at the end she goes, "would you like some product?  it should help."i laughed/cried about it to some other people who had gone to this location, and they had similar horror stories.  for a store that was only two weeks old at the time (i had to wait some time to post this until the yelp page was up), that's pretty impressive.i went elsewhere to get it fixed the next morning, and they simply could not believe i had gotten a haircut the previous day.  the back was still a bit of a mess afterwards, such was the damage done.  time was the only thing that could help that at that point.i also texted a buddy that if he got esmeralda, flee immediately.  he did not heed my warning and had to go get it fixed as well.sad, because the location is quite convenient.  oh well.
great barbershop! reasonable prices and friendly barbers--i'm so pleased with my third cut from them. wafa and mckindly were terrific. go there for your next clip.

i saw the previous review and was surprised...i was in and out in no time.  it may be that i came in the morning on a weekday.  the manager was very friendly and sat me down right away.  now i am a 53 year old man with thinning hair so i don't imagine i would have the problems as the last reviewer, but she was able to provide exactly what i asked for.  i have since gone back.  i appreciate that they keep there cutting instruments clean with disinfectant.  the previous salon i went to also did a good job, but in about a week the back of my neck would break out.  i finally caught on that it was in relation to the timing of my haircut and the last time i went i spent particular attention to if they cleaned their instruments...they did not, therefore i am making this place (great clips) my new spot!
this is our favorite spot to get our sons hair cut at! they are so good with him! thanks for an awesome experience

cliped my hair at this location. it was good experience barber lady was gentle and polite. she did what i need in my hair cut and she asked me how is it in each stage, which was impressive. would go their for my hair cuts from now, i guess.

friendly enough staff, usually has 93.1 jack fm playing rather loudly on the radio. i like that they save your haircut preferences so it doesn't really matter who cuts your hair. some stylists are more chatty than others.
it's my second time coming here... i love the check online part.. it saves me time and best part i love the prices. staff is very friendly
i come here once or twice a month and i am taken care of. i have never left unhappy. no one cuts my hair like they do...i love great clips

great clips is a good place to go and cut your hair. dolly cut my hair she had cut it the way i wanted i recommend you guys to ask for dolly to cut your hair but not only dolly ,cynthia, adriana, susy and the other girls who work there! they are all very good

i've been bringing my son here since they opened. he's always happy with his results. my wife and other son have started going here too. i cut my own hair or else i'd likely get haircuts here too. great job!

this place is great because they keep your measurements from each time so you don't have to constantly re-explain yourself. additionally they are very affordable and work at a nice pace. finally they are pretty understanding of those who don't want to talk a whole bunch; but they have nice hair tips if you want them.

i like to come see kao because he is pretty laid back and is pretty cool to chat with when he's cutting my hair. he understands how i want my hair cut.**update- i found out that kao doesn't work here anymore and decided to make a life decision so that was the last time i visited this one but they are nice here but just go to a different great clips and get my hair cut by someone who knows kao small world haha *****update even more- i continue to visit great clips even though now both of those gentlemen are gone. the experience is great and i love the online checkin. download the app and you can check in before you go and you have your spot in line held. it's convenient enough at the moment. not a great deal check in online but it is catching on!

kinda bummed just left and the sign in store said get $5 off haircut if you leave a review or check in whatever i did and only got $2 off that's sucks and realized she didn't ask to do my eyebrows damn it now gotta go home and do myself and i tipped $7 on a $13 haircut. i'm done gonna just find a new place
needed a quick hair cut before vacation. came here and was pleased with the service. shop is clean. it does get busy so using their online check-in is the way to go. overall good experience.
this has been my go to place for a haircut for the past 2 years. i never really know what i want for my cut but i always leave looking much better than when i arrive. thanks cynthia for my last cut!
i always come to this location and they do a good job every time. the place is clean and everyone is friendly. online check-in will help save time, so i recommend that. prices are fair as well.
this has been my go to place for haircuts! great cut every time.  my son used to hate getting haircuts until he came here.
it was so professional and they were so understanding to what i wanted to do with my hair. i got a wash and a haircut & i was pleased with everything (: amazing service!

told them once how we like it and they've gotten it right ever since. they let you check in online and tell you their wait times which is convenient. the coupons they send in the mail is also helpful.
great place to get haircut professional and knowledgeable also like the idea of the online check in!
convenient location in dtf, took me in with no wait and no appointment, got a quick cut and am very happy. clean shop inside and everyone in her greeted me with smile. adrianna is awesome
my go to place for a quick cut or trim. always friendly and helpful staff. very clean. love the ability to check in online.
we always bring our two younger boys here for cuts and they always look great. my daughter loves to get her layers done here as well and they always listen to what she wants.

like any other great clips, this place gives a good value for money. however, among all the other great clips around this area, i prefer this one particularly because i get my haircut from a hairstylist named hatem. he can cut your hair to the exact specifications that you want. he is very efficient with the old school scissor and comb method which is rare to find these days. in addition, ever since i've been visiting this great clips i've been getting a good number of coupons every now and then which makes me stick to this great clips.
awful. i couldn't get my daughter off the chair fast enough.  she even got poked in the eye!

really???? for a 14 bucks of hair cut i have to tolerate this kind of service in essex st, lodi, nj 07644.i checked online with no wait time and reached there in time, then the lady there told  me that i will be the next person to be attended. i was a regular customer to this branch and never seen this kind of attitude before. after that the lady keep on attending one after one customer who came after me and didn't even bother to ask  me if i have an appointment or not.seems like they don't want to do business anymore and somehow i have a feeling that they really don't care of their customer. really ??? for a haircut business you think you are the only one?this was my last visit and will never go to any of the branch. bye bye... keep your service and attitude to yourself and will not bother you any more.buyer please be aware of this place before you go.

whats the point of checking in online if it says 0 minutes wait---and when you get there to wait for 30 min so the people can give their relatives and friends haircuts first.  seriously, what is the point of your online check in app?

if i could give this negative five stars i would. let me start by saying i have been coming here for three years for my son and parents. i also am not the kind of reviewer who would give any place 1 star - i generally take to yelp for giving 4 /5 stars. i was here for a quick trim and the person there ( i think his name was hatem or hateem or something ) kept making comments about my hair that were making me uncomfortable. since he was the only stylist available i went to his booth. 10 minutes into the trim i realized he was rubbing his "junk" against my knee! i was so creeped out i ran out of there. i will be taking it up with their headquarters and telling everyone i know! do not go here and do not take your children young or old! creepy cheap guy!

my husband got the worst haircut ever from this location and the hair dresser had no remorse about her pathetic work. please make sure to ask prior your haircut if they are using scissors or clipper machine. if the person use machine, you might end up getting the worst haircut of your life. they don't even adjust or trim side burns.

so i just love when i can write a positive review about a business.for many years, i've paid a lot of money for hair cuts that ranged from 'good" to "ok" but never completely satisfied.  i've seen ppl come out of this salon with really good looking cuts &  smiles on their faces.last thursday i really wanted to uplift my spirits because i've been ill for about a year, so i decided to get my hair done but didn't know where to go since i've been disappointed , but then i remembered seeing good looking cuts & the happy faces & i decided to give this place a try and im so glad i did!!!crissy greeted me & asked what i would like done with my hair. she did such a fabulous on my hair, my customers complimented my hair, my female customers asked where i got it cut & by whom, even strangers in the supermarket stopped me to compliment my hair. not only is she talented & loves what she does, but she makes you feel like a friend.i'm sure everyone there is wonderful, but i've only dealt with crissy. i highly recommend this salon & they run specials which helps the wallet. thank you crissy for making look & feel great
i was recommended by a friend to get my hair cut with janine. she was very friendly and gave me an amazing hair cut. the staff are friendly too.

i needed a basic cut. i had never heard of this place. i stopped in on saturday, the wait was an hour, but i didn't have time.  the guy couldn't have been nicer to me.  i went back tonight at 8:10 and the 2 women there were accommodating, funny, friendly, and i got a great hair cut.  and had a few laughs in the process.  very great vibe, great music and seems like a family place also. i will absolutely be back.
good haircut every time. doesn't matter what seat you're in. everyone's really good. you can tell they like their jobs. that's who you want cutting your hair.
this is the go to place for my family. nielsa has been cutting my son, wife and my hair for years. we love going there and catching up and always getting the haircut we want. highly recommend!!
great haircut by mario! highly recommend going here, my friend had a great stylist as well! nessa i think. definitely will be back!

i go here all the time. they do an awesome job. the girl that cuts my hair is nielsa. if you want her to cut your hair you're probably going to have to wait on line. people always ask for her personally. the wait is worth it though

i needed a quick trim and didn't want to pay salon prices. came here, was served promptly, and the stylist cut my hair exactly as i instructed. all for $13. i guess my only gripe would be you certainly don't get salon treatment/service here. but again $13 for a quick and decent trim, so i'm not complaining.

no complaints here! great haircut for a great price!  my whole family gets their hair cut there.  we mostly go to jennifer, so i can't really comment on the other hair dressers.  jennifer does a phenomenal job!  make sure you check in on their site before hand to cut your wait time a bit.  i didn't have to wait at all last time i went!

stopped in yesterday for a great cut. kevin knew exactly what would look right and he worked his magic flawlessly and efficiently. a positive vibe from all employees means a concerned business owner. bravo and keep up the good work!

worst hair cut experience i've ever had. i came because the place was recommended  to me by a friend because she really likes a specific hairdresser. when i arrived, she wasn't there but i figured anyone would be okay because they had such positive reviews here. i don't know the name of the person who got me because she wasn't wearing a name tag and she didn't introduce herself. she had straight blonde shoulder length hair (think, 'i want to talk to the manager white bitch' hair). she didn't smile at me or make me feel welcome at all when i was sitting down. while cutting my hair, she kept insulting my hair, saying it's too dry, the ends are too brittle, etc, but didn't really offer any tips besides just 'use leave in conditioner.' i get that upselling can be annoying, but after insulting my hair that many times, you'd think she'd be a halfway competent  employee and at least offer a suggestion. i have long hair and i asked for layers and granted while i did say 'keep the length,' she took it as i'll take a centimeter off the bottom, and she construed 'layers' i'll give you one layer in addition to the bottom of your hair. so yes, i technically got 'layers,' as in my hair has only two layers and barely different than when i came in. i am beyond disappointed and humiliated by this place and i urge any other girl with long hair to stay away. it's just not worth it. go to a real salon, even if they charge more because any paying customer should not be treated like she treated me.

we had a coupon for $6.99 haircut and my husband usually goes to super cuts so i said why not try something else? he liked it. clean place, no wait time. we were taken care of right away. would definitely go there myself for a trim or a cut. a star for cleanliness, another for good service, 3rd for no wait time and 4th for the coupon !

just got back after getting an amazing haircut from a great stylist named kevin. i couldn't recommend him enough, makes getting a great haircut easy by explaining different aspects about it so you know what your asking for all while giving off good vibes and making you feel at home in the chair.

silly to pay salon prices when this is around the corner. i've always had my cut done by gina and she's great!check in online before you go to ensure you're seen quickly. and don't forget to ask for gina!

this is the best place around to get your haircut. the staff is the best and does a great job. they are very friendly and make sure your cut comes out perfect. thanks for the consistenly great haircuts!

giving 3 stars because they are severely understaffed and you always  wait 30 minutes or more even when using online checkin. good haircuts but waiting and waiting is ridiculous. hire more stylists and i will change my rating. one of the stylists is quite abrupt and has little patience especially with children.

clean place; very friendly....but i was told 30min wait and it's been well over an hour. needless to say; i'm not very happy. luckily i get a buzz cut at a level 1 1/2 so can't mess that up....hopefully.

you get what you pay for. not bad for children's haircuts $11.00. definitely check in online to avoid the wait.  they need to hire someone to keep this place clean. their is hair all over the salon. its pretty gross.

pretty decent place for a haircut. location is pretty convenient in a strip mall shopping center by 440 in bayonne. it's slightly quicker in terms of traffic as coming from jc wouldn't have to deal with the tonnelle circle traffic so its not a bad choice if you're in jc. price is pretty standard ($14 for men's haircut) and so is the service. i think the lady that cut my hair was bit more inexperienced but she was quite friendly so overall the experience is pretty decent. the building is quite clean as expected and i didn't have to wait at all on a weeknight so those are quite pleasant indeed :-)
worst hair stylist.  please look at the picture i uploaded of my husband who just returned from a lousy haircut. a pair of scissors in the hands of a 13-year old can ensure a better haircut.
need to start taking my 12 year old to a better place. there's a new hack every time we walk in. they hardly listen to any change from your last profile. beyond rude.
