this is nothing against the employee who were very friendly and courteous with my short interaction with them. my complaint here is about the the poor business model implementation. getting people to sign up for an app provides the business tremendous amounts of insight and information that is of huge monetary value, significantly more than the few bucks for a haircut. in turn i would expect the business to offer a little more in return than a piss poor estimated wait time -- in my circumstance, being told to wait another 30mins having shown up a few minutes shy of the estimated wait time. i understand the concept of variance but 30 minutes? it really defeats the purpose of checking in. the short: the user information provided to the business is worth more than the elementary linear model they are using to "predict" weight times.. it is 2018 for christ's sake!

i have been going to this great clips for almost 10 years. they had some of the best hairdressers.  that has all changed. there's new manager and she has replaced almost everybody who has been there a long time. it's sad because now the haircut quality has dropped off immensely. i've had to return to have my hair cut correctly because the girl left it uneven. my children have been getting their haircut there and my son's hair looks horrible. it's uneven and not layered correctly.it's time for me to find a new salon. i recommend finding someplace else to get your haircut.

been coming to this salon for 5 years and loved it until this week.my great stylist left a few months back (martina) and ive had 2 haircuts there since.  the first one was "not martina" but the last one i had there 3 days ago was the worst haircut of my life.  i'm 60 so i've had a couple of doozies, but this is really bad.  i should have been clued in when the stylist asked another stylist if she was 'doing it right" half way through.  i entered with long, graduated,  layered curly hair and asked for a trim all over and maybe a shorter layer on top. i showed her the picture i have used in various cities over 10 years. i also specifically stated "no more than a quarter inch off the ends".  i trust that these people know what they are doing and haven't been disapointed in the past 20 years, anywhere..............................................i now have a 1980's mullett that is 2 inches shorter in length than when i entered, has erratic layers and looks nothing like my hairstyle of the last 5 years (which i loved). i formerly looked like what i am, an aging hippie. i left however looking like a 1980s 12 year old boy.i wont be going there again.  i am seriously pissed at a store that lets seriously inexperienced stylists practice on experienced customers.  i will be wearing scarves till next winter.

i love the check in feature on the app! it saves a lot of time instead of just sitting there. bridgette did great washing my hair, taking her time to detangle my hair with the conditioner in it! my trim was great value at a cheap price. well worth it.

a stylist named victoria  cut my hair. it was the best haircut i've ever had in my entire life! she was very knowledgeable and very friendly and i was in and out so fast. i was on my lunch break and i was really worried. i will definitely be coming back and recommend all my friends and family!!

we are traveling in a motorhome, so my wife is always leery of using a hair salon. okay, let's just say that my wife is picky about her hair and who styles it!!!  my wife was in desperate need to have her hair trimmed so she called great clips and was informed that there was no line and she was invited to come right over. the staff were very welcoming as we arrived, took pertinent information and immediately assigned a stylist. it was a friendly environment. my wife's stylist set about to wash and cut her hair. as i observed this process, a casual conversation between my wife and the stylist occurred and made my wife feel more comfortable and relaxed. my thanks to all of the staff of great clips for their talent, friendliness and professionalism displayed and exhibited during this walk-in appointment.

i always use the phone app to check in - so convenient! i get there and it's usually just as the app indicates for time waiting. always rotating, i think everyone there has cut my hair. inconsistent. i wouldn't think they could mess up my hair since i keep it short - but they did. and with my bad luck, they screwed it up when i needed it to look nice for a big event. this place is conveniently located but i won't be coming back.

the staff is really nice. after going a few times they start to remember who you are. i always ask for the same stylist, leslie. she really knows what to do with my hair. thank you leslie, you're the best!!bottom line, if you're looking for a good cut at  good price, this is the joint.

i haven't gotten my hair cut from a professional in a long time...i'm talking years and for the reason of them always cutting way too much of my hair off. i went here the other day and was so scared i'd walk out with a bob. like always. at this great clips that was not the case! amanda showed me how much she would be cutting off before cutting it off! she cut 3", layered it, and framed my face no problem! i finally found a place i could go to instead of me having to do it myself. so glad i took the chance here! i highly recommend this place if you were like me, never happy with my haircuts. :)

this is my second time at this location because it's the closest place to my house but it's strictly for cutting children's hair, and it just doesn't matter who checks in first or if you do it online or whatever they just take the next person they see and they give everybody a very similar haircut which is all i think they really know how to do... if you care about your hair of your money or just the flat out principle means something don't come to this location.
do not go here! they messed up my haircut that was so simple to pull off. the lady spent 10 minutes on my haircut and the place was not even packed. i would hate to have the same thing happen to you.

i have a short haircut that needs constant trims, and i was so happy to find this place. the ranges for cuts goes from $8 to $14, which is cheaper than any of the salons i went to before. now if i want to do more, i'd certainly stick with the salons, since great clips has steep prices on styling which is the opposite of the hair cut prices. strange. but i keep continuing to come back and get my hair cut here at least once a month, and i like the results. :)

why even bother checking in online?  it went from 5 mins to 15 min wait so i checked in and headed over. 10 minutes later when i got there, they told me it was going to be another 20 minutes and i was at the bottom of the list.checked in another day because it said 1 minute wait. i checked in and headed over. was there about a minute later and it was packed. i was fourth on the list, and when i checked again it still shows a one minute wait time and there are six people on the list. when will i learn?
actually great clips,   the name on the building says it all.    can't touch their prices if you just want a cut.

i'm very disappointed with the service at this place. they always have a long wait time and it seems that they only 2-3 employees. i waited there for almost 2hrs for a trim! i would recommend making am appointment but good luck being seen at your apt time. the best part of the visit was the girl who cut my hair was very sweet.
fast service, the woman who did my hair was great and it was the cheapest hair cut i've ever gotten. i was told that my hair cut looked better than when i was paying $200+

good people, great service. been going there for a while now, and always going to andrea. she's super cool and funny. although busy on weekends, strip mall parking is aplenty, and if you happen to have a long wait, you can just hit fry's next door to do some grocery shopping while you wait. target and many other stores close by in this convenient location.

i have been going here for a while now and can't say anything bad about it.  the staff are always friendly and knowledgeable.  there aren't too many times when i have to wait very long to get my hair cut.  i have seen many stylists here and haven't had any bad experiences.  very affordable as far as i am concerned.

i love getting my hair cut here. the stylist susan is my favorite hair cutter of all time. she is from chicago and is a vegetarian and is a single mom. she takes care of her son and is quite spoken but when you talk to her she is very sweet. the manager chris is very nice too. she's cut my hair and explains the way of the business. angie is one of the asst manager and has done an amazing job on my hair as well. all these idiots complain about great clips but they're a great company. while not a barber shop but they do give that home feel

this review is based on my overall experience with this location. i average about two good haircuts for every bad one here.  the bad ones usually come from the same person whose name will remain anonymous but it starts with the letter r. when this person cuts my hair they finish in about 5 minutes and ask if everything is okay. if i were to point out trouble areas they get visibly upset and then quietly fix the issue. also, this person tends to swear and get visibly upset at times. next time i request someone else if this person is there.other stylists have been good and very friendly. i don't want to let one person drag this entire location down but it would be in the owner's best interest to part ways with this employee.this is a good location with minimum wait if you check in using the phone app. i look forward to giving this location a better review in the future

worst haircut/"stylist" (being generous with that term) ever.  i've typically had good luck here, other than the wait. checked online first, since there was no wait listed went ahead and went in since i'm less than 5 minutes away. should have known this wasn't going to go well since the woman who checked me in wasn't speaking, she was mumbling and didn't act like she wanted to be there. when i sat down she spoke to me like she had no clue how to cut hair and that i was supposed to tell her what to do.  i very clearly told her the length i wanted to keep etc. let's just say i won't be back.  she actually had the nerve to look shocked when i didn't tip at checkout.

worst haircut everdo you want to look like a primordial cosmic worm after your haircut? this is the place to go. especially during their "haircut sale". i went today, and was a horrible experience. there was a huge line because of the "sale". so the lady who did my hair was clearly desperate. if you have like a owl timer , you can set it to 4 mins 23 seconds, and you will be definitely done. i showed her a pic of what i liked to have usually. she glimpsed at it as if "yeah, whatever you want, i am gonna give you what i think fits you". most of the "looooonnng" time spent during haircut she tries to sell other products like shampoo and hair conditioners to you instead of focusing on the haircut. do you have scissors/shears at home? look at it before you go to this store. that will be the last time you will ever see a pair of shears. here you are like those kids in pink floyd's brick in the wall video. it doesn't matter if you are a guy or a girl or a kid or an adult, all of you get the same haircut. 6 on top, 1 on bottom, and fades in between. she ran through my hair like she was mowing a lawn. "chug chug chug chug...oh, i need to change the song, chug chug chug chug...oh, what did you say you wanted, chug chug chug chug...sorry, am done. i'll note what you wanted so that we can do it next time when we actually have time. out you go so that we can get done with the 20 million people waiting after you due to the sale."oh, then what is special/extra here? ofcourse, price is special..you pay thrice the money and 1/3rd the quality of other places..her name was angela something if that helps you avoiding her.i mean, i believe in evolution. like humans came from monkeys/apes and stuff. but i never thought i will be reminded of that due to a haircut. girls around me looked like they were getting a good cut when they walked out. but guys, one after the other, were walking out looking down.with that dismal shock in their faces, which said: omfg, what the f did i walk into...or on their phone updating their pic on instagram with hashtag smh.bottom line: if you have clippers at home, try it. you probably might do a better job than paying double ass price for a half ass haircut.
a big "thank you" to susan for giving my teenager: "the best haircut of his life!"
pros:no irreversible styling damagespeedycheapcons:non uniform side burnsincomplete trimlonger than indicated wait timestylists focused on meeting a target time per customer

decent haircuts at a good price.cost:save a few dollars and get the prepaid "great card" for $9.99 haircuts!service: i like the online check-in, which you can do from the web site or with the great clips app. check-in ahead of time, and reduce your wait time to virtually zero.atmosphere:it's a salon in a strip mall, and they're all the same, what's to say?overall:it's convenient, well-priced, and i get decent haircuts. i keep going back.

horrible service, checked in online and ended up waiting for over an hour and a half. people not even on the list going before me. it was the worst experience ever! i just moved in the area and been using great clips for years and will never return here. please also check the reviews on fb this place sucks!!!! waited 90 minutes to just end up leaving.

sadly, i have to rate this great clips quite low.  i would have rated them a 1 star, but the manager did issue a refund for my daughter's hair cut and apologized for the situation.while i was shopping at michaels, my kiddo went with her dad to get a hair cut.  i have been so swamped, i did not have time to take her to my salon.  her dad was given specific instructions on how to get her hair cut and to make sure her bangs were not cut and he relayed those instructions to the stylist.  i received a phone call from him telling me the stylist did not know what he meant by "face framing layers."  i advised him that he needed to get a different stylist if she did not know what that meant.he agreed and then hung up.  apparently he argued with her for awhile wherein she said she didn't think it would look good on my daughter.  he told her he still wanted it that way, but if she could not do it, then she could wait.  he said to her that since my daughter was preoccupied on the ipad anyway... that she could just sit in a chair and wait for him while his hair was cut.  well, apparently the stylist went ahead and cut my kiddo's hair anyway, including cutting her bangs straight across her forehead.  well, not completely straight, as some hairs were cut very unevenly.  we have been growing out her bangs and training them for several months.  additionally, she cut some layers so short in my daughter's hair that they are above her eyebrows.  her dad went back in to talk to the stylist.  the stylist made a few more snips to correct the unevenness in her bangs.  however, they should have never been cut in the first place.i knew instinctively that i should not have allowed my kid to get her hair cut here, but this was the second time she'd been.  the first time was to correct it after she cut off a hunk of hair herself when she was in school.  the stylist did a good job then.  should my kid have been in that chair when her dad told the stylist to forget about it?  no.  a place like this has so much turn over that every stylist could have an effect on the reviews.  i understand that.  however, it was such a bad experience, we are not willing to chance it again.  it is right before the holidays... and i really think my kid's hair looks like a monkey cut it.  oh well.  hair grows back.  you get what you pay for so... buyer beware.

awesome place for what minimal hair needs i require. a simple 5 min trim for 8 buck (sale price today) would have cost 50 at a salon (i called around to 3 other salons for a no frills trim...apparently that doesn't exist at a salon). this was exactly what i wanted; walk in, trim, walk out! the staff was friendly, the place was clean. overall good experience and didn't break the bank!

mediocre at best. the grumpy man who failed to greet me when i came in ended up being the one to cut my hair. he didn't say much other than the usual, "what shampoo and conditioner do you use?"  i have long hair and i asked for a trim and to define the layers. he spent 10 minutes cutting my hair and didn't verify if everything was the same length like most stylists do. he spent most of his time spraying me in the eye with his water bottle. let's say, i won't be back.
need a quick trim, very fast paced and you can check in online

i tend to be too lazy or forgetful to get my hair cut often and when i do, i don't do much special (just a boring trim of my crazy long hair).  i usually go to great clips or something similar and the experience is always pretty good. the staff is friendly and does a fine job. i could do with less up selling of hair products. i'm sure they are incentivized to sell products but i could do without it.

ive been to great clips twice. first time it was just me and second time with my family. both times angela cut my hair. she is great, and i highly recommend asking for angela when getting your hair cut. overall everyone is very friendly and good atmosphere. i am used to getting $40 hair cuts, but after getting my hair cut by angela, i will never go anywhere else. unless of course she moves. angela is very professional, and she gave me great advice on what to use on my hair and how to style my hair. she recommended redken anti-snap product for me, and i purchased it. i love it, my hair is very healthy and stylish all thanks to angela...

pretty much get what you pay for. i paid 8 bucks and it looks like it too. i keep my hair pretty short and because of this the mistakes stand out. unfortunately i was too far from the mirror while there and didn't notice the differences in lengths and levels till i got home. but then again, maybe my head was tilted during the haircut.  i wish i had been more attentive and the stylist been more on top of her game. i tipped way too much.

went here, because i forgot to make an early appointment for a haircut at my usual place. been here 2 times before, for the same reason & they did a decent job.this time they ruined my hair. it looks like i have a birds nest balancing on my head.i was there on saturday morning & the stylist was friendly & nice. i had showered already & my hair was wet. i showed her a picture of what i wanted done & also explained what i needed. she went on cutting & as they charge another fee for a blow dry, i didn't get it done & i had to shower again anyway as they don't even bother to brush off the hair that's all over you after your haircut. maybe that's too much work for them.after i washed & blow dried my hair, it looked like it hadn't been cut at all. pieces hanging out of everyplace. they said they layered it, if they did, it was the worst layers ever.i went back in the evening, & a lady who said she was the manager, said she can fix it & went on snipping at my hair. she just took a handful of hair off the top & went snip, snip, snip. i asked her to thin my hair at the bottom, so that it has some fullness & the ends turn out. she said she will do it, but never did it. i was uncomfortable telling her to do something so many times. i am no hair stylist, but i knew, something was not right, the way she went on cutting.back again i had to come home & shower again. my 3rd shower for the day. dried my hair, only to find, the top of my head, my hair was not even 3 inches long. i couldn't even get it on the brush to dry. the other layer is cut so short, that there is a wave right in the middle of my head, looking like my hair is split in 2 with a birds nest at the top. when i wake up in the morning, i look like "tina turner," lol. all my hair is sticking out the top. let me say i have very thick hair & short hair only gives it more static & spikes it making it look like the smurfs.i called them & the lady says, we will refund the money. lol. i said i didn't want the money, i want my hair. what can money do? buy hair? this is hair we are talking about, which (if i am lucky) will take 3 weeks to grow at least to a decent length. this is not a dress that doesn't fit & the refund can buy me another dress.i went back again on monday, as the manager hilary said there was a good person who can fix it. that was shane. he took one look & said, oh yes, it's way too short & there's not much he could do. i totally agree. what can he do to clean up another persons mess? he did try, but finally gave up.i am now left with this horrible looking haircut & wear a cap most of the time. i had to go buy gel & mousse & products i didn't own before, just to keep the bounce down on the top of my head. if not i look like a hot air balloon about to take off. lol.i guess, you get what you pay for. just horrible. the worst is, that they don't even care. it's like something that happens every day & they have got so used to living with it. but then again, why would they care. it's my hair, not theirs & there is nothing anyone can do to fix it now. it's ruined & i have a function to be at this sunday, which i might not go to. a bad hair day, gives you a bad mood, a bad couple of hair days, drives you nuts. that's for sure.
shane is amazing! i'm pretty picky since i have fine hair and it shows every cut mark. i like a lot of texture, but no razor! he was able to accomplish all this and i love my hair! thanks!

horrible horrible horrible horrible i want my money back rebeca destroyed my hair i look horrible i paid to get my hair styled she couldn't even do that. my advice don't go here they will destroy your hair.
i love this place!!!! the ladies here really know what they're doing. 100% satisfied. i'm new to the area and am happy that i've already found my go-to place.

apparently i love to get my hair cut while out of town. and coming from a guy who barely gets his hair cut (and truthfully, barely has any hair to cut) that means that most of the haircuts of the last 5 years of my life have happened at random out of town spots.well, folks, add mesa to the mix. that's where i got my hair cut today, and that's the latest locale where i lopped my locks. men and women of mesa, take note: you can get your hair cut here, too. you don't have to a be an out of town vagabond. they're here every day chopping away, and you can walk in for a trim. actually, as i discovered today, they're really pushing this whole "check in online" thing and have a specific app you can also download. i haven't looked at it, but if it sets a reminder for your haircut then i'm totally into it. i only seem to remember at the most inopportune and rushed times (ie. "oh crud, i'm going to be on tv tomorrow morning and i look like ringo.")as for the cutters--they weren't the most personable peeps on the block, but when it came down to it they all seemed to know what they were doing. my cutress was a nice enough lady and cut pretty quickly. i didn't get the courtesy ear trim (sexy, i know) but i also didn't ask for it. i did, however, get the courtesy eyebrow trim. so that was a bonus i only seem to get at 1 out of 10 haircutteries.

if i could give then zero i would. cut 13 style 18, not bad right? wrong. the cut, i told her i wanted more layers an volume, i told her i didnt like my last cut. she processed to follow the exact cut of my hair, so now i have the same cut that i didn't really want. fine ..the style, 30 minutes with a blow dryer and a round brush my hair is flat, with weird bumps at the top? i could have gotten the same results letting a three year old blow out my hair for 15 minutes.i told her that i didnt think i should have to pay for the "style" as it wasnt what i asked for. i asked for curls and volume. she says she can curl it?? really like i should believe that? do i give her another 30 minutes of my saturday? i pulled my hair into a ponytail,  paid the 36 bucks and left. moral of the story?dont come to this place if you want a style.

under new managenent. used to be a decent place, now they're running some sort of wig scam. i'm calling corporate.my family was treated poorly today. my sister and daughter both got bad cuts. they gave a free cut to my sister under the guise that they donate the hair. very sketchy about who they donate to. didnt ask if the hair was treated or dyed. i believe they're making wigs or tracks out of the hair and reselling it. not sure this new management is on the up and up. they panicked at the notion that we might keep the hair instead of donating.i miss old management. at least they were honest and up front. at least they gave each person the cut they asked for. at least they weren't running some shady side hustle.

the best part about this place is the manager. she seems to be working there all the time, besides giving great haircuts she's a genuinely nice person. they have some good stylists but you must keep on them as to the style you want otherwise they will deviate and that's not cool.

i visited this place for the first time about 20-30 minutes ago.  i am highly disappointed and will never return here again.  here's why:1: i asked the lady to take off less than half an inch of hair instead she whipped out a #4 and zipped the machine through on one side leaving half an inch on!!! 2:  within seconds i had to stop her once i realized what she had done but it was too late. 3: she admitted her mistake and i remained calm and polite asking her to just even it out.  she tried but it didn't look even to me.  4:  the most disturbing part was how she ended it.  didn't even say bye or thank you when i told her that my hair didn't look even to me.  she went ahead and "rang me up" and as i was walking toward the counter she just went back to her station.  she said bye reluctantly i kept saying wait, i haven't paid ma'am...she wouldn't say a word and kept repeating "bye, bye".   she made a mistake, admitted it but was very rude at the end.  i insisted that i must pay, had my visa out but she wouldn't even look me in the eye.  i keep insisting and finally, i realized that i had $12 cash which i left on the counter and walked out! this is bad for business and i hope the owner/manager gets my message that i left $12 on the counter because the lady attempted to turn this around on me indirectly making it appear like i wanted a free haircut!  i was genuinely unhappy because of her mistake!  the haircut is $13 but i will go back to give them $1 next time i'm passing by.  i do not need a free haircut, thanks but no thanks.

we've been getting our hair cut here for a while. some great and some not so much depending on the stylist. checked in online with a 15 minute wait. been here over 20 minutes so the check in is useless.

waited for my turn fair and square, after 30 minutes a lady walks in with 2 daughters and because the mom checked in via her phone app, the stylists had to take all 3 of them ahead of me. that just isn't fair. i got up and left. i can see taking 1 of the 3 ahead of me, but all 3 is bologna. this is a poorly designed marketing gimmick created by the great clips corporation.  go back to first come, first served. i like the stylists at this location, but the corporate policy isn't well thought out.
this place has many good  stylists who take their time to give you a good haircut.i have been here over 15x

understanding that great clips has a quota to meet for how many haircuts they need per week/month, i was still willing to give them a shot. the lady cutting my hair took notes on what i wanted. i told her that i have two cowlicks in the front, and two in the back- incredibly difficult to deal with if they are cut too short. as the hair cutting begins, everything seems normal. but then i notice that she isn't using water to dampen my hair, like every stylist i've ever used does. she was dry-chopping the top of my hair, cutting off about an inch. it felt very sloppy and was looking very weird. next thing i noticed, she grabs a handful of hair on my back cowlick and cuts it all the way off. i was stunned, but at this point didn't care; i wear a hat most days anyways. the thing that upset me most was when she said, "so i cut off your cowlick because i don't like them. they stick straight up if u cut them short, so you have to cut them all the way down. and when they start sticking up, thats when you know you need to come back and get another haircut anyways." needless to say, i'll never be coming back here.
seriously disappointed with my hair cut.  i wanted a pixie with layers on the back,  the girl gave me a buzz cut! i told her i wanted to keep the length of my bangs and the girl started cutting them.

i came here because cost cutters was closed and i left a bit disappointed.   my cut was fine,  i just went in for a trim but since i was going out after i asked the stylist if she could just blow dry my hair. (not style, blow dry)she blow dried it, barely put a spritz of hairspray in and we were done. a haircut costs $12...needless to say, i was a bit shocked when i was charged $31.00.i looked at the board and noticed for a "regular style" was $18.  1. i  don't understand how a style costs more than a cut, 2. i was shocked i was charged their full price of a style when all i asked for (and got done) was a simple blow dry.  when i asked for a blow dry, she should have made it known it would cost me an additional $18.i was pretty upset when i walked out and because of that, i won't be back.  i have never paid near that for a blow dry.  $5, maybe. $18?! i don't think so!

jenna cut my hair.  i'm always nervous about letting anyone touch it since it's been screwed up before.  she was very patient with me and cut a little at a time and checked in with me then continued after i was okay with it.  some beauticians like to chop the hell out of it and ask questions after.  she was awesome!

just another place to get a hair cut. i've never got my hair cut here, but my bf has. he was going somewhere else for his haircuts but it was quite a drive to go there every other week. so he's settling with great clips. which he is satisfied with how they cut his hair. he's a pretty picky person when it comes to someone cutting his hair, and surprisingly he likes the barber/hair stylist salon styler person that did his hair and will return for future haircuts. great clips is a pretty decent place for haircuts and the pricing isn't that bad. overall its worth going to.

great customer service with kids. as an exhairstylist myself i know that kids are the hardest to deal with. they have little toys and  stuff for them to play with in the back if mom or dad need a cut while the kiddos wait. love the staff! tip them well. hairstylist live off tips.
sarah cut my 3yr old boy's hair, she has great customer service, friendly and interactive with my kids and did a great job clipping his hair.  she went quickly without messing up!

always have a good experience every time i get my hair cut here. they also send out coupons, making their service even more affordable. i love the online checkin option, allows me to know when to show up- i don't think i have ever waited more than 2 mins. i definitely recommend them !

i would give no stars if i could. my husband and i took my 2 year old who was in desperate need of a haircut. we asked number of times if they were familiar with cutting a child's hair, to which we were told "i have kids of my own, i know how to cut children's hair". rudely we were asked if we wanted our son on the chair or to hold him. he was naturally terrified of the razor and when he just wouldn't stop crying we had to ask her to stop. she didn't even make an attempt to even win him over or try talking to him. he had hair everywhere, in his mouth and his ears, we asked politely to use the sink to rinse this out, as he started coughing to which she said "let me ask my boss, there might be a charge"! are you freaking kidding me? they charged us full price for a half done job and we had to wait for permission to rinse our son off. horrible horrible service. don't go!

if i could give this place 0 stars, i would. even though i checked in online, i had a long wait because the stylist was too busy doing anything but dealing with me. that should have been my first clue. when she finally deigned to call on me, she asked if i wanted to donate. i agreed, on the condition that the end result be a specific length, she agreed, and confirmed how long it should be. she then hacked off the ponytail way too high and then blithely cut off 3 more inches than agreed upon. this was a trim only and should not have been that complicated!! anyone who needs to cut off 3" to "even things out" is incompetent and should not be working as a stylist. when i saw how much she had taken off, i was shocked. no tip for her. i know how long my hair needs to be to be manageable, and this is way too short. it's more in my face and all over the place than when it was down to my waist!!!never go here. if you do decide to have that lapse in judgement, don't donate. suck it up and pay the cost, because i swear they must get bonuses per inch if they are willing to ignore the customer to the degree that this "stylist" did. i almost wish i had paid so i could have the satisfaction of demanding my money back.
i get my haircut every two weeks...they make me feel like its a small town barbershop..quick and great service..always have some sort of a promotion going on..would recomend

i come here often because it is so close to home and they usually fit me in with no wait. i've never had a bad experience though also never had an amazing one. alana did such a fantastic job i had to write a review. she was friendly and easy to talk to, she listened very well to what i wanted and did a great job cutting my hair. she has a fantastic attitude and clearly works hard too, as i don't think she was feeling well but she made it in to work anyways and was cheerful and pleasant. thank you alana!

great place to get a horrible hair cut and sweat your butt off while getting it done!!! why can't people follow simple instructions??? i'd rather shave my head than get another hair cut from this place!!!!!

i decided to have my husband cut off nearly 12 inches. misguided, yes, but wasn't bad. it did need to be cleaned up though. jessica basically saved me from myself. she patiently explained how hair is cut a certain way or another, to make it fall how you want, and do what you want it to do....i honestly didn't know there was more to it than just chopping it off wherever you pleased! loved my hair.the next day i wasn't sure (each side curls differently, it's parted on the side, and one side is thicker, so it really is hard to tell). jessica got me right in. on a saturday morning! no questions, no problems. she did some minor adjustments and i learned a bit more. if my uneven hair was all my imagination, she was gracious enough to not say so. i'll definitely be back :-)

you get what you pay for. my haircut was uneven, the service was "okay." the lady did a good job with my bangs. i felt like the hairdresser started becoming friendly when i was about to pay. i was seen as a walk in, didn't have to wait at all. place was clean. will come back but probably just for a bang trim.

do not take your children here! i had a terrible experience this morning when i attempted to have my toddler son get his hair cut at this location. i checked in online; we were up next when i arrived and a woman named marta was immediately rude to us as soon as we walked in the door. my son had not made a sound, but she looked at him (certainly did not greet him) and aggressively said, "if he cries or gets upset i will not cut his hair." i was very caught off guard because i have never had a stylist be so unfriendly towards a child trying to get a haircut, especially when he was not even upset. i told her that he usually sits on my lap and we just try to make it work the best we can - recognizing that he is a toddler and can sometimes be unpredictable - and she again said she would refuse to cut his hair if he was even the slightest bit upset. i said that with that attitude, it was probably for the best that she did not cut my son's hair, and she seemed to non-verbally agree (definitely did not apologize or try to dissuade us from leaving or even attempt a haircut), and i walked out. i am very disappointed with this stylist's awful attitude toward children. great clips markets itself as a family-friendly establishment and should not employ stylists who refuse service to children for literally no reason other than their age. we will not return to great clips, especially when there are so many alternatives that will treat children like people, as they deserve.

went to this great clips yesterday 6/11/17 and got my normal haircut. the stylist kavitha was trimming the back of my neck and cut it multiple times and never said a word. the. she put powder on her cloth and went over it hiding the redness. once i got home my girlfriend pointed out it was extremely red with little cuts. if you go here do not get your hair by kavitha!

it's the first time i've been there and the girl with the tattoos hasn't cut my hair some guy did it and have to say not happy with it pretty much left it the same length even though i told him what i wanted.

we bring the littles here -- they do a solid job, they're patient with all the anxieties kids have (or at least mine do), the online check-in is terrific (especially on mobile devices) and it's not too hard to find a sale or promotion. doesn't cost a lot. doesn't stress me out and more importantly -- doesn't stress them out.tip of the cap to the management.
great haircut from becky today! she was very polite and professional!  she asked specific questions to make sure she knew exactly what i wanted.
love karla, but when she's not there, they are all pretty good at hearing your needs and producing a perfect cut & style.  i won't go anywhere else.  oh, and of course you can't beat the price.

it's called great clips, but it sure seems more like "mediocre clips."i went in last night with my dad last night, and was greeted like normal and i figured it was going to be a pleasant experience like every other great clips i'd been to. when it was my turn to get a haircut, i sat in the chair, and showed christine the picture of what i wanted. it was pretty straight forward; layers, face frame and a bang trim which is what i've been getting for ages, so i really just needed everything trimmed up. you know something's wrong when your hairdresser says "oops."  long story short, my hair was four inches shorter, when i was told it would only be one inch, tops. my bangs are about a half inch too short (if you have bangs you know a little is actually a lot), the layers were blunt, and the length of my hair was literally lopsided. i had to go to another salon today to save my hair. when i got to the salon, the hairdresser said "wow, well at least she left something for us to work with." when she saw the..... 'creation' on my head. long story short, i will never, ever, ever go to this great clips again. it was, for lack of a better word, one of the worst experiences i've ever had getting a haircut.

two bad haircuts in a row. i am done with great clips. bad haircut in september, took three months to grow it back out. went in with a picture of exactly want i wanted. ignored. cut it back above my ears again. i asked why and was told it looked better. i wanted what i wanted, not what somebody else wanted. don't go to great clips unless you are happy with the one haircut they know how to do. me? i am done!

i had been getting my hair cut at an expensive salon for years. i've been growing it out for the last year and finally decided to get a trim to clean up the ends. i bit the bullet and went to great clips, and i got the haircut i wanted for the cost of a tip at the previous place. karla was great; she listened to what i wanted and made good conversation.tips: - check in online or on the great clips app. it'll let you know what the wait times are at locations near you and hold your place in line. - normally they just spray down your hair with a water bottle, but you can get a full shampoo and conditioner for just $3 more. - be clear and say exactly what you want. bring a picture or say "i want one inch off" and show her where that is on your hair. - the only reason why i gave 4 stars instead of 5 is that they don't blow dry your hair at the end. that means you have to go home and blow dry it yourself. it's also hard to judge whether you got the cut you wanted when your hair is still wet.

i know, five stars for great clips? but it was six o'clock on a wednesday, they were pretty busy but i was in a chair in ten minutes. i was way past due for a cut, there was a lot of work to do but i was out in 15 minutes. the cut i received rivals $60 cuts elsewhere, just with a fairly strong sense of urgency. i had a coupon for $7.99 - don't judge, i make up for it in the tip. it's  a franchise, the stylist did the work, why should someone else get the money? all things considered, five stars is about right.
really friendly staff! they really care about you. just a wonderful place to get your haircut while enjoying a pleasant atmosphere.

i have been to this location twice - the first was right before a speaking event where i was going to be onstage in front of 850 people! the second was before attending the same event. both times i came here and was absolutely thrilled with how my hair turned out! it's very rare to leave a great clips, loving your hair without styling it or "fixing" it once you get home. this place definitely lives up to its reputation as being salon quality for a cheap price! thank you kelly and michael! both of you gave me fantastic hair!

first time my almost four-year old son didn't cry during a haircut. michael entertained while nicole cut his thick locks. very impressed with the extra time they took on us. michael even entertained my son while my hair was trimmed. very happy customers.

wow. i usually go to salons, and that's where i take the kids. but this time, we went in a big group, 5 (walk-in) cuts in total, ages 17,13,13,13, and 8. total price 66.00 plus tip. holy good haircuts, batman! i was really blown away by the level of skill that this place had to offer. aren't these cheap places kinda crappy? my perspective has changed. we walked in and walked out in about an hour. craziness.i will have to come back and add names of the stylists. for now, there's pink hair and piercings girl- super smiley, very friendly, and she did a great job on the 2 13 year old girls. then, there was the other lady. wish i knew her name.. i think it started with an h. she was also very nice, and very good. the 17 year old loved her hair. she's been raving about it for 2 days now. she also cut the 13 year old boy's hair. it was exactly what his dad wanted him to get. it looked perfect! and then, my boy. a man cut his hair. he was not very friendly. i felt like i was an imposition. but he gets 5 stars anyways, because i honestly have never seen such a great cut on my son. his dad wanted him to cut off his long hair and i was really disappointed. his hair is blonde, so when it's short, it looks almost see-through. this guy did an amazzzzzing job and i could not be happier. all in all, i'm highly satisfied! definitely the new family spot.

on a work trip i was hurried, harried and hairy. karla squeezed me in, sized up my hair and delivered a great haircut in 20 minutes while carrying an interesting conversation (unlike the head grabbers i've had who want you to play freeze and stop talking while they grunt and grimace). such a great experience thinking about scheduling work trips just to get my hair cut here!

i went in to get a different kind of haircut.  i know great clips doesn't do a lot of different styles, but those hair stylist went to school to learn all different types of styles.  they are looking to do more.  i got dominique.  she had a fun bubbly personality.  i really liked her.  we laughed a lot.  she was so excited to do something different.  she gets 5 stars.the location was super busy but i didn't wait at all.my hair came out somewhat of what i wanted.  short on one side, a little to short than what we discussed, but i'm not picky and i know my hair grows fast.  the other side i wanted to keep my long bangs.  my bangs could have been styled a little more over my ear.  i had to take some hair off when i got home cause it just didn't look right.  after i trimmed it more on the side with my long hair, it looked perfect.  it was a weird style and i wasn't expecting it to be perfect, but i had a wonderful fun experience.

i have been a regular at this location for the past 3 years and would give it 5 stars.  however, i had one bad haircut last december that i am still trying to outgrow.  i asked for layers in the bottom inch of my hair and ended up getting layers 4 inches higher - does not look good on someone with thick natural wavy hair.  lucky for me, i have had several excellent stylists cut my hair since then and i have about 2 more visits to go before my hair is back to normal and the layers are where they should be.  my only request is that they change the opening hours to 8 or 8:30 am - i live and work nearby and prefer to go in the morning when there is less of a wait.

always a great experience when i go to this great clips. alejandra( alex) does an exceptional job at keeping my hair under control. i've been going weekly to her for a long time and plan on doing so. the rest of the staff here is great and will always go above and beyond to make you feel satisfied. will definitely be going back.

i  walked in wed. morning and mitchell  took care of me immediately. i showed him a picture and he carefully started cutting my hair to exactly what i wanted. i asked him to shampoo it at the end and its just perfect. short,  textured and easy to wear.   too bad i live in sedona and will have to drive 2 hours for another cut.  next time im in phoenix for trader joes i will make an appointment with him.
this location likes to close 30 minutes early even when you check-in. checked in and showed up to find the store all locked up. classic great clips service.

went in today, because according to superstition in my culture, if you cut your hair during full moon, your hair will grow back faster...so after waiting 6 months, i finally went for it. yes today is harvest moon, the best moon of the year, i think. walked in, two people ahead of me, i got checked in right away. wait time was 5 minutes because they were fully staffed. awesome. i get called, kristin i think was the name of the stylist. she wasn't too chatty, which i thought was great..she was totally chill, and i love my layered cut. thanks again great clips, see you in a year!

i've been here twice now, and it seems like a good place to get a haircut.  the online check-in makes it very convenient, and you can get in quickly.  dulce cut my hair and i got the best haircut i've had in a long time.  she was quick and efficient and an absolute pro.  i'll be back soon!

this is the only place that i go to. the online check in works great. my wait time has always been minimal.  i have always had great experiences and i think ever is very talented. i always feel welcome and love when they remember my name and how i like my cut. i always feel great after leaving. i have never been disappointed.

i've been going here for many years. but, now i am looking for another place to cut my hair.  why?  long ass waits- i checked in via their mobile app, which says, 56 mins.  i arrive 60 mins later and i am still waiting over 45 minutes to hit the chair.  this has happened 3 times in one month and the other two times i left before getting my haircut.  this location is always under staffed....seeking new barber.

i was desperate for a cut and my usual spot is too far and i the wait would make me way late for my ride to palm springs. i called gc just after 9am and there was zero wait time. i lucked out because as soon as i got there the online check ins were adding in the queue. eddie took care of me. super nice, great cut and perfect timing. i even had time to get home to trim and dye my beard. i'll definitely be back. i really look sharp.
great service and the online check in is very convenient to avoid waiting, a. figueroa is attentive and this is the second time he cuts my hair as i want
just got one of the worst haircuts of my life from a girl named alex. had to go home and use my own clippers to cut away her terrible job! terrible! beware

right now they have the $7.99 haircut special which always is great for back to school. i've been coming here for at least two years with different family members. online check-in gets you in quicker. but everyone is very nice and courteous. brianna and edward have given us great haircuts.

i had a great experience yesterday. i used the online check in system from my desk and headed straight over. it said i would have a 17 minute wait when i checked in, and once i got there i sat maybe 5 minutes.  my stylist was asked a lot of questions and he did a great job on my hair (hadn't been cut in almost a year...such is the life of a twin mom), and did a great blow out (took time, but it was so worth it) after with product so i could get back to work. i was gone from work a grand total of 61 minutes with travel.everyone commented on how great it looked when i got back (first time it wasn't pulled back in a clip for 4 months).will definitely go again.

i've been coming here for the last year, as family members had been going for years before that. i've had my hair cut by numerous people here and they do a decent job. the quality ranges from good to excellent. if you go on line to make an appointment the wait isn't as long but there's still a wait. that's okay, as if i went to a place like this and there was no wait at all, i'd wonder why they don't have any customers. the cost is reasonable, they work with both genders well and so i'll continue being a customer. only suggestion is that i'd like to be able to make an appointment on line before they open, the site doesn't work until then.

giving them 3 stars because i have had some great experiences here in the past. brianna, if you need a perm or even just a cut, is great and i wish i could continue to go back and see her, but, alas, i will never return after this last experience.i have had my hair permed twice at this location (both times by brianna, who i now trust with my hair...which is harder than trusting someone with your life) and 7 months since my last perm, the curls are mostly fallen out (it happens) and take a load of styling gel to look even semi-good most days. add on 4 inches of new growth and it was time to get a new perm. i had to have it done soon, preferably this weekend, because of a family trip next week so i called to make an appointment. brianna, i was told, was not going to be available until wednesday afternoon. i had some anxiety about having a stranger do my perm, but it had to be done. so i booked it. now let me make it clear. i had explained to the woman who booked my appointment  (with liz i believe was her name) that i had had my hair permed there 7 months ago, i needed a full perm because the curl was mostly gone, etc. i get there this morning and i'm told by the stylist that i have "plenty of curl left" (i'm not sure how to attach a picture, but trust me...that's not the case.) even though i let her know that this was my hair fresh from the shower and that had temporarily refreshed the curl. it would be gone once it dried. she then pulled on some strands of hair, towards the end of my hair, and claimed there was too much breakage. oh right, big surprise. i have at least an inch of split ends after 7 months, i'm lazy about getting trims and i needed one, but above that inch or so my hair is plenty strong. she requested a consult from management, who was very condescending towards me and barely listened to me at all. continuously talking over me and making claims about perms that are outdated and did not apply to my situation in any case.  if they didn't know have someone on staff for that day who was competent at performing perms, then they shouldn't have given me an appointment. now i have to make a new appointment at a private salon (where the price is, oddly enough, the same as at great clips) that will force me to take a vacation day at work before my trip. if they had simply told me they couldn't do the perm with their current staff i would have booked elsewhere in the first place and not wasted my morning.

just had my haircut from briana. it was horrible.  she did the haircut in 15 min. the fade and side burns were uneven. she did not texture the top and or use thinning shears like i asked her too. i will never go back.

two stylists on friday evening. i've been waiting an hour while chatty kathy has managed to do 1 1/2 haircuts. the other stylist just had four friends walk in and he skipped one of them alllll the way to the head of the line. cute. too late for me to go anywhere else, so i'm going to keep waiting. smile nicely and let my tip reflect my aggravation.

phoenix, az: just come here to see heber hernandez, if you can get him.  my hair is impossible to cut well and he knocked it out like it was nothing.  the guy should be charging $50 for picking up the shears.

i am visiting from northern california and want to say how terrific ms. alex is. she gave me a wonderful cut, listened to all my idiosyncrasies about my hair, and was so cheerful and sweet the whole time. love my haircut! thanks alex.

late review... was here about 6 months ago. service was horrible i had my hair cut by cathy and she was unbelievably rough while washing. felt like she was hand washing a tough to remove stain from clothes and i left with a horrible neck ache. i would suggest talking less and being for caring for your customers. don't need to take a visit to the chiropractor after a hair. will not return to this location.

went in close to closing time, was greeted almost immediately by one stylist and was given an accurate wait time. during my wait i was quickly hesitant to be taken by the woman that greeted me, no conversation and quick to cut before communicating with her customer. luckily i was taken by the other stylist, helen. she was upbeat and open to conversation, she worked well with my parameters because i'm growing out an awkward cut but wanted to clean it up. she walked me through her thoughts since i came in unprepared, kindly explained why her suggestions made more sense then what i was originally thinking & i'm glad i agreed! thanks again helen!

by far the worst great clips i've ever been to. i only go to these places for a quick fade or something simple since the service at some locations is mostly sub par to say the least. the woman that cut my hair had a terrible attitude from the start. every time i would move, scratch my face, check my phone, she would pull her hands from my head really fast and wait until i was done, like seriously? i'm hardly moving and you make it blatantly obvious and may be inconveniencing your job? psshh woman get off your high horse, you ain't hot and you have a terrible personality.i came in today. she was there. i signed in online and was next on the list. another patron came in and i was skipped for whatever reason. i didn't ask and just walked out. i'll be picking a different location next time.

red flag: since great clips started allowing customers to sign in remotely via a smart phone, most of my friends have stopped going there. as a chronologically gifted group (seniors), most still have flip phones and when they arrive to sign in there are already too many people ahead of them (those with smart phones that have signed in via smartphone). also, walk-ins are at a disadvantage for the same reason. the cost of a senior hair cut has risen from $11 to $12.the cost of a hair cut does not include a shampoo (like fantastic sam's). my most recent visit resulted in an ok haircut, but a very rude hair stylist.

always skeptical when it comes to trying out new places to get my haircut, but boy this great clips was perfect. the staff was extremely friendly, clean store, and almost no wait. my stylist, helen, was awesome. she was very attentive to all the little details and super personable/hilarious. will be back in 3-4 weeks!

after quite a few good experiences i went there again. this time it was very dissapointing, hairstylist helen was frustated, rude and is always in a hurry to finish the haircut. complete haircut took hardly less than 5 min, i hope she will treat the customers with respect from next time. ***never getting a haircut from helen again***

will never return - the lady was rude to me the whole time and i was just trying to be nice. i asked her about her day and she gave me an attitude the whole time. she rushed my hair, the back was uneven on one side and they pushed me out the door and then i went home and fixed my hair. honestly, spit on the window when you walk by and let everyone know how awful the service is.

after a previous good experience i came back here, and i'm highly disappointed. i mentioned several times to helen that i wanted to keep the length on the top of my head, and she proceeded to chop more than half of it off. when i told her i was disappointed with how much she took off, she defended what she did instead of even trying to apologize. i doubt i will be back, and i sure as hell won't let her cut my hair, again, if i am.
like all great clips, checking in online saves a lot of time. stylists are friendly and helpful. helen in particular does a great job. thank you!

cameron is amazing! i had a pretty bad experience the night before with a different stylist and didn't see how bad it was until the morning. i went back (on the verge of tears) and cameron fixed it so you couldn't even tell how much of a wreck it was when i came in. he was professional, personable, and very understanding. cameron is clearly very experienced and knows what he is doing--i am so grateful to have had him cut my hair!the reason i have to give this location 4 stars instead of 5 is because of my experience the night before with jeryll. i don't know how he got his cosmetology license, because it seems like he has never cut hair before. i didn't want anything fancy, i just needed 1 inch off of my layers and a bang trim. when i left, there were no layers on one side because it was so choppy, and on the other side the front half of my hair was just below ear length and the back half was a couple inches below shoulder length. my bangs were uneven and were not the same length. i couldn't believe that anyone could cut hair so poorly with their cosmetology license. despite this, i won't judge the location based on one stylist. everyone else was professional and welcoming. as long as you get the right person, you will have a great experience. ask for cameron! he's very talented, and i plan on returning to see him in the future.

i took my daughter in for her first big girl haircut this afternoon. we called ahead and asked for the person most best suited for dealing with a rambunctious three-year-old and was quickly told rosie was the best. that recommendation could not have been more spot-on. she was fantastic and understanding what i wanted and was so sweet to my daughter. her hair came out fantastic and we will definitely return.
i have been a long time customer of this location and they have always treated us like family.  i shave my own head now, but still come here to have my boys  hair cut.  quick, quality and low cost.

i just love cindy. she gives me a great haircut short and easy to style. i used to go to expensive salons thinking i would get better and style and service because i was paying a premium, but my experience at this great clips location is by far the best i have gotten and cindy is so personable amd friendly i look forward to my next visit
i had a decent hair cut, but very poor customer service. i was insulted the entire time about my hair care. will not be returning.

came here because reygan works here.  she gives great, honest advise when you really don't  know how your hair will look best.   she considers how much time you are really willing to spend on your hair each morning.  really pleased with my haircut.
not every experience was like mine i'm sure. i've had plenty of good haircuts here but after the last, i'll be finding a new spot.

i've been here several times, being a former asu kid and never quite moving out of tempe.  they have great deals - those $7.99 sales (i feel like i've achieved crazy coupon lady status whenever i chance upon these), and the convenience of checking in on their website so that you can minimize your wait in-store.i had long-ish (about mid-back) layered hair and just yesterday cut it into a long bob and i love it.  the lady (alicia, i think) was a perfectionist and gave me wonderful advice on how to style my hair.  for instance, how i could hide the fact that my bangs were framing my face - something typical for layers, but not quite advisable for bobs, and how to get rid of those ugly duck tail edges, since it's at that awkward length where your hair follows the curve of your neck.taking off a star because my boyfriend's hair wasn't quite as stellar as mine, having his hair trimmed by somebody who literally graduated from cosmetology school a week ago.  there were several long strands that were missed and cause i am a little ocd, it took a tremendous amount of restraint on my part from plucking off those strands before we reached home and i could find a pair scissors.
my favorite spot. the service is always good. the staff is super friendly and i have not had a bad cut yet. being able to check in online through their app is perfect!  quick in and out.

for a quick, inexpensive haircut, great clips is my choice location. their mobile app is excellent for finding one nearby (yelp is good too!), and getting checked in ahead of time. i've been able to walk right in and get seated without waiting around for my name to be called. it feels like you're cheating the system, but all is fair in love and haircuttery. the price for a haircut here is cheaper than many others and competes with supercuts. all said and done, i can leave with my ears lowered for under $17 bucks including tax and tip. the stylists at this location are really friendly and make for an enjoyable experience. to get your money's worth (and avoid those stray itchy hairs all over your neck), ask them to rinse your hair and add a little product before you leave. it's easy and makes you look presentable if you're going back to work or a social affair. though you're not going to get all the same attention to detail of an upscale barber, sometimes all your head needs is some routine maintenance.

i love this place! i'm never disappointed with anyone i have cutting my hair. it's just as good as going to a salon (believe me or don't, but i've never had a bad experience here like other great clips.) but today i had rosie, and she was so sweet! you could tell it was hectic in there because of the $7.99 deal, but she was still calm and polite. also, rosie was very caring for my hair, did a great job, and was so kind and helpful! definitely coming back to see her again soon.

i would give zero if i could. their check-in online system means nothing, twice i've been here, checked in and they just take whoever they want in whatever order. bring it to their attention and they offer no apology.  i won't be back.
love coming here !  staff is friendly and asia is amazing. would recommend this location to everyone.

just walked in literally 6pm on the dot. she turned me away and said, "we close at 6." wow. well, if your going to turn into a pumpkin, you should have locked the doors.  wouldn't want you to go above and beyond by any means. last time i ever go here! unbelievable.

after fighting my 5 year old son's request to cut his adorable long locks for quite some time, i had a weak moment on a saturday afternoon in march... i had both of my kids with me after a trip to the target in this shopping center, and i made a pit stop at this great clips location to see what kind of wait there was to get in.  to my surprise, i learned that there was not a wait and that regina could get my son in right away.  i was hesitant already to trust a stranger with my child's first haircut (outside of the trims he'd gotten from a family member previously).  i swear - i had butterflies in my stomach as my daughter and i watched... i was also nervous about how my son would do sitting in a big chair, sitting still for the cut and the shave, etc... but he did great!we requested a mohawk and i showed regina some images of what i had in mind.  she told me we should go the fauxhawk route instead and suggested the ideal length so that when we didn't style it, it would still look decent... she did her thing and my son has gotten a ton of compliments ever since!i was upsold on some gel for the fauxhawk, so we walked out the door 20 minutes or so later with a clean cut and very excited kid plus a firm hold gel for $21.85 + tip.  as we drove home, my daughter requested a mohawk also... "no honey," i said.  i think it will be a long time if ever before i let that happen!i had low expectations of great clips, but they definitely delivered and i'd return for a fauxhawk clean up in a heartbeat!

when you find your person, it is horrible when they leave or you move away. i moved to phoenix and had a lot of anxiety about finding a new place to get my hair cut for a cheap price. i came here because it's down the street from my place and great clips has good pricing for cuts. i'm happy to say on my first go, i found my new person. louisa is amazing. she is very good about listening to what you want and checking with you continuously to make sure it's what you were asking for. she is great and i'm glad i found her. 5 stars for louisa!! as for the actual store, it feels a little chaotic in there and the bathroom was a little dirty. i guess aim for slower times and if it's really don't use the bathroom.

had to redo  worst haircut ever ,had to do it three  time,they can't cut hair,and the first time i went the woman added 2 dollars to her tip -5  they practical y shaved my head even it  out thanks******* s

i tried great clips on a whim since i was shopping in the complex where it's located. my first haircut was a nice change for me, but it was just a blunt cut without much style. the stylist was adequate.but a few months later i had a coupon and decided to try another stylist there. i was introduced to robin, an extremely experienced stylist. she literally transformed my hair! she cut it short and sassy, but with a lot of design and style. i loved it! so easy to maintain the new style too.robin is a very fashionable, beautiful blonde so hard to miss! i now only go to her. i'm from san francisco where a cut and style run from $89-120 no joke. i've been to some of the top salons in phoenix and scottsdale (when i've been able to afford it) and my tab for cut, color, style has been at least $100. robin's skills and the results i get to enjoy are as good as the top salon stylists i've been to. everyone compliments me. i can do different things with the hairstyle. if the long bangs start to get hard to style she will do a bang cut for a reduced fee. i always tip $10 and should really show even more respect for her skills with a higher tip.if you want to look like you just stepped out of the most chic salon with an incredible cut, go see robin! what a find.

i go to the great clips at 44th st and e thomas rd in phoenix az.  when holly cuts my hair, it's always the highest quality. holly listens to what is requested and is very professional.  the last 2 times she was not available so i took my chances with the stylist available.  big mistake.  last month my haircut was uneven, but i accepted that and tried to trim it up myself at home. today was a different matter altogether.  while the stylist was very courteous and friendly, he clearly did not listen to me and left me looking like a shaved freak.  i asked for a trim and told him how i wanted my hair to "layer and feather".  i specifically told him that i did not want a short/shaved/spiked haircut.  i told him that i used to wear my hair short over 10 years ago, and how i certainly do not want that now.  i am mortified with the freakishly short "ostrich" haircut i have.  i told him i wanted my hear to feather.  a crew cut cannot feather.  when i asked him to not leave a "tail" on my neck, he completely shaved the back of my head over an inch above my hair line.   i specifically went in to get a professional trim prior to a very important job interview.  i am a professional person in a professional position and i am also a senior citizen.  this haircut is not only offensive, it makes me look like i am mocking administration.  i look completely unacceptable because of great clip's circus haircut.  this is the most embarrassing appearance i have ever had, at a time when i need to look highly professional.   i even cancelled a plane ticket as i just cannot be seen by my family looking this freakish, unprofessional, and offensive.
quality haircuts at a bargain price. if you're nervous, ask for gladys or nicholas. both of them are great at their jobs and take the time to produce the results that you ask for.

they stole money from me. so check this out. i went to get a haircut, i liked it. it was a great haircut. i pay, i tip, i sign. apparently i didn't tip enough. the guy rounded what was a total of $16 to $18. sure it's only $2 but that guy straight up stole from me. who does that?? that is so unprofessional! never going back there again. that's just terrible. congrats guys, you hired a thief.

first time visiting a hair salon in years. i used the app to check in early. robin cut my hair. she is very professional and friendly. she asked me what i wanted and i got it. i will definitely recommend her to my other friends and will be returning in the future. if you get lost trying to find it, it is kind of hidden near fry's.

nope. my small son has autism, and doesn't like hair on his clothing (sensory). we normally love great clips for being so flexible, when we attend the facility off cactus road we have experience excellent and kind service. however, at this arcadia shop, an elderly blonde mutton-dressed-as-lamb gave us static for removing his shirt. holy crap, a five-year old's nipples might show before we put the cape on? we whipped his shirt back on an left, to the apologies of the rest of the staff. someone should fire that one for being so insensitive to handicapped children.

anabel gives a great shampoo.  it was exactly the temperature i requested, and she made my head feel fantastic!  she also gave me a great cut in relatively short amount of time ( a serious bonus for me) and when i asked her if she minded if i didn't talk, she was impeccably polite.imho, she should be working for a place that pays better than great clips, but i am grateful that she was there at great clips!

i have been here a few times and have never had an issue , went yesterday for a quick hair cut and she completely butchered my hair!! i asked for a short hair cut which i showed her a picture of what i kind of wanted....instead she just cut the back of the head in the middle super short and left the rest long! nothing like the picture i showed her! i went to another location today to get it fixed( even tho i didn't want to step foot into another great clips) and the guy was super nice about fixing my hair for free.. he said it looked as if it was in a pony tail and she just cut my pony tail off! which is exactly what it looked like, he fixed my hair the best he could but sadly even tho he fixed it the back of my hair is super short and my hair line is a triangle so it's a large triangle ! i know hair grows back but it is so upsetting that this happened!

i want to specify i am leaving this review for this location, not the chain as a whole.i'm really bummed to have to leave such a negative review, but i'm hoping this is read from someone who is in a position to do something about it and can take it as constructive criticism. ok, onto the rating...a little recap of my experience...i checked into this great clips using my online app. i don't normally visit this location, but i was in the neighborhood visiting my parents and was hoping to squeeze it into my work lunch hour. i saw my check-in time as a 17 min wait and figured that was okay because by the time i drove there i'd be able to get in pretty quickly thereafter....wrong. i arrived and was not greeted at the door, so i was never counted as being, "checked in." the wait list appeared on a monitor and showed i was 3rd in line. ok i thought--there's several people working hopefully this shouldn't take too much longer if i'm 3rd...even though by this point according to the app i should have been up. i let it slide because really, what can i do about it? the problem i have here is that i, like many people who use the app, rely on these estimated wait times because we are trying to fit it into our work schedules, lives, all of us are busy....but for a company that prides itself on getting people in and out conveniently for this not to be accurate--there's a problem. now like i said above, this review really isn't supposed to be about the company, but rather the location. up until this point, most of my check-in's have been fairly accurate with other locations, so i don't know who's to blame here.... so i sat and waited, one person called off the list (awesome, only 2 in front of me) another one called who was not there (ok...i should be next!) but then the person under me on that list was called! what?! so i stood up and informed the gal working at the front that i was an online check-in and that i hadn't been accounted for yet because no one had greeted me, but that i was there and ready. she had me write my name and phone number down. why? i have no clue because i was an online check-in that shouldn't matter...but whatever. so i did anyway, and yet the man behind me was still called, despite the fact i was in front of him. ok....i thought, starting to feel annoyed...it's fine--surely i'm next. i sat and watched the clock, knowing that if i wasn't called within 10 minutes, i'd probably not have enough time to get my hair cut and get back to work on time. so i waited, and waited...almost 10 minutes passed and a girl was called who wasn't even on the wait list. i then waited some more and then, the final icing on the cake, some mans name from the bottom of the list made it on top of mine. are you kidding me?! so now, i was over 20 minutes waiting (on top of the already aforementioned 17 minutes) and now not even next...i walked out, disappointed and frustrated having used up all my lunch time and haircut-less. there are several things disturbing about this: 1) the lack of acknowledgment when i walked in the door resulting in me not being "checked in" even though i was and had been waiting and someone moving ahead me on the list but also 2) then several other people were moved in front of me on top of my 3) already long wait time that exceeded what the app had predicted. i don't know if this is a management issue, the app, or a heinous concoction of the both...but i sure hope they pull it together.

i believe her name is shannon or sharon not quite sure but if you can avoid her do so by all means she extremely rude. i should of known that by the way she checked me in typically you walk in they check you in asap i come in and wait at the counter for 2 minutes or so after she greets me waiting for her to check me in once checked in she tells me it'll be a moment or two so take a seat. after she cleans her area i'm called up next during the haircut she ask me what i do after telling her i work for a financial firm i can see her roll her eyes in the mirror. after a few minutes into the haircut i request she doesn't shave my beard jokingly i say for insulation purposes she follows up by asking if i want the hair in my ear shaved or should she leave it for insulation purposes. i also requested to not trim the hair on top of just the back and sides, did she listen? of course not. the absolute worse haircut i've had at this establishment.

neat! i got my hair washed here almost two weeks ago. yes, it's come to that. i have people wash it for me. (it's eeeeassier when you're on walking sticks.) i figured, "hey, six bucks. why not?"i walked in (ha), my taxi driver left .... and *then* i learned, on a chilly fall day, that blow drying my hair would run $45. (my hair goes past my shoulders.) i didn't want it styled. just dry. as in "not sopping wet". i figured i would have to pay another ten bucks or so. but not a full blow out price. i also was not in need (or have any interest) in getting a hair cut here.asking to self blow dry (an option back home in new york) was also a no. i was told to hold a blow dryer in a salon requires a license.ooook.all was not lost however. the nice ladies here later realized my predicament and worked me a favor. they let me sit under the big old air dryer. the kind you use when you're getting highlights. that was pretty sweet!i have to say my hair wash was one of the most luxurious washes i've had in ages. so much so i purchased the shampoo/conditioner.i didn't catch the name of the super duper woman who washed my hair. but she's a doll. pixie hair cut. blond. nicest woman ever!

extremely unfriendly. i came in for a very simple buzz cut and asked one question to go over a certain area of my head and she gave me a hard time. this place is only good for getting in fast. i won't be coming back to this location.

these girls that work there are so bitchy. they were so mean to my son. so unwelcoming! i will never ever bring my family there again! i thought they can manage a trim, a fade. it's not some high fashion salon! it's a cheap hair cut place! these girls need to go back to cosmotology!
my stylist was very knowledgeable. yay, 13$/haircut!  she even knew about my natural curls & told me how that would work w/haircuts i wanted. thanks!

with all the negative reviews on yelp about this location, i have to admit i went in expecting to not even be acknowledged even though the on line check in stated no waiting time @ 2p on a wednesday. but to my surprise, a friendly face did greet me as soon as i walked in. she chopped my hair exactly how i wanted it. my chunky over grown home slashed bangs were no longer a mess and soon my one length hair was styled beautifully with layers. i am 6" lighter and loving it. i would definitely come back without hesitation.
