 she couldn't give me any idea what so ever.  she said, "so you want it to hit her neck?"  i said, "no, not if it won't look right.  what will curly hair  look like?"  she just looked at my daughter's hair and didn't say anything but sort of shrug her shoulders.  since the woman had long hair with some curl in it, i told her to just trim and keep it long with layers.  usually they can do someone else's hair like their own. the layers are horrible!  it's like she tried to give it a feathery look that just doesn't work with curls.  instead of the beautiful individual curls we started with, she now has one continuous wave at the back of her head.my son's hair didn't turn out any better from the other woman who cut his hair.  my husband stood by and explained to keep it a little long on top.  she took the order and spent the rest of the time talking to another associate.  she cut it short like a military cut (which i did not want).  and my poor son has crooked cuts all over his head!i gave it two days to see if their hair would settle to something nicer, since fresh cuts sometimes (but rarely) be deceiving, but i can still see the jagged cuts in my son's hair and my daughter's hair is even less cooperative even though i'm using products that usually tame it.  the only reason i haven't gone in to complain is because i would have to bring the kids to show what's wrong and i don't want the kids to hear me say something negative about their cuts.sorry i don't have staff names, but it was not the cindy mentioned in the other review.
thanks shannon! love my hair ! u did an excellent job! hadnt had my hair cut in a long time and u nailed it!!!much thanks!!!lucy

went here for my son's haircut on a referral from family in the area. wait was 45+ minutes when we signed in but that was my fault for waiting to come in until the evening. the place is clean, including the restroom. decent amount of products in stock. "imma" cut my son's hair and did a pretty good job. she made sure to put his haircut description into their system so the next time we go in, the stylist will already know what he prefers. likes: i liked that as you sign in a monitor faces the customers so you can see how many people are ahead of you. i liked that as people came in they are greeted. i liked that customers are apparently able to sign in online/on an app. dislikes: none as of yet.

i will not come back to this location.  stylist inmaculada was incredibly rude and abrasive, undermining my parenting, telling them to sit in the barber chairs next to me when i told them to stay in the waiting area at the front of the store, offered them candy after i told them they could not have candy, and then when i asked her to stop and let my do my job as a parent, she tried to argue with me.

awesome, awesome experience this morning! i figured it would be a bit of a wait, considering it's a saturday morning and the change of seasons. there was a stylist at every chair, and a customer in every chair- but they are so efficient that i didn't wait more than 5 minutes. once in the chair, i felt very comfortable, my stylist asked me what i wanted and told me exactly how she was going to do that for me. i cut off about four inches from the back and evened it all out for a really cute bob. i am very very happy with my result, and i will be back. :-)

it might not look like much on the outside, but it's pretty awesome. the inside is nice and the people are even nicer. i went to sarah and she was really nice and did a great job. i will definitely be returning here to see her again.

i enjoy going to this location. they have been cutting me and my kids hair for about 4 years now. there is a lot of business going through the doors and i don't mind the wait for a good haircut. they staff it appropriately for the traffic.

i love this laid back place. i'm not high maintenance so it's perfect. they don't make fun of my box dye job; just give me the exact cut i want and i'm always pleased. very nice and friendly stylists, too.
staff is always friendly and they always know how you ordered your last haircut
i had been going there for a while and had the hair cut i liked in the system,so i went in and they cut my almost bald when i had a medium style haircut in the book
myself and my boys never go anywhere else.  the girls are always friendly and consistent.  love em!

my family and i have been coming to this place for the past 7 years. they are extremely consistent and always have a great attitude. they always welcome you with a resounding, "welcome to greatclips!!". we plan on using their services for many years to come.

you like to gamble? are you into fits of anxiety? this place is like putting your quarter into the gumball machine and hoping for the red piece... sometimes you get it... some times you get the yellow one. isn't it obvious? every time you come here, there's different stylists working? forest gump could have written this review... "you never know what you're gonna get..."  i only go here when i'm feeling suicidal... anyone up for a little "haircut roulette?"
no wait great service very fast and efficient, did my brothers hair cut just how he wanted
the place started to go downhill. rude manager,  no longer offering discounts to veterans at this location and my last two haircuts ended with cuts in my head. alon location nearby is way better

wow i cant believe the damage this place did to my pet boyfriend. he dropped in at about 10 am-11am for a haircut to get ready for new years celebrations and he walked out beat up and looking like he has some kind of rash or allergic reaction. the lady that cut his hair used dull clippers. it felt like he was being shaved with a disposable razor. it even broke skin in some places. please see pictures and avoid! 1 star for not messing up the actual haircut.

i had a great experience here at this great clips. the two ladies were really nice and the blonde lady did a good job on what i wanted. she looked at the picture twice to make sure and it came out beautifully. unlike the last time i went somewhere else i showed the same picture and she didn't do what i wanted.

came here with my boyfriend to get his hair cut. he wanted a basic clean up and fade. nothing too drastic or difficult. the stylist on the (i cannot remember her name but she is above average height) was rude from the get go. when she finished his hair he had long pieces sticking up on the top on both sides, uneven shave on the bottom and an almost bald spot in the back. we went back the next day to ask if she could could fix it (maybe she didn't see it because of the lighting or something) and she said no that's just how his hair is because of a "cowlick" and ignored the other two problems. that's a common excuse from stylists who haven't had enough training or just haven't perfected how to do a fade. i asked as politely as i could, which is hard because situations like these are already super awkward, if someone else could try to fix it and she was obviously so offended. i can't pay for a service when i know that he doesn't have a cowlick and he's had his hair cut the same style perfectly at several other places. a polite gentleman fixed it for us while the other stylist made faces, shook her head, and made remarks under her breath. i thanked both of them again before we left but she wouldn't look up from her other client and acknowledge me... we tipped both of them. i also want to add that we have run into her outside of the salon and she made the ugliest faces and once again made remarks under her breath like we are in highschool. really? we tried to be as polite as possible. it's not my fault you didn't know how to do it and you should learn how to handle critism if you're going to do a job like that. it felt like she's expecting judgement and rudeness from everyone so she beats you to it and treats you poorly. i don't recommend this location only because of her. everyone else there is polite and professional.

we'll never go back!!!  i ask for something to be done different, next thing i know my 4 year old says ouch.  she was being too rough if you don't like your job quit, don't take it out on my kid wow!!!
place is just ok, they don't actually work as per customer satisfaction, but anyways it was not really bad.

we used to come for a decent haircut at a decent price. we now come here more for the convenience of the location. the stylist today kept asking for assistance from the other employees. it felt almost as if i was getting a hair cut at a beauty college rather than at a place of business with licensed stylists. i wasn't happy with the outcome, but i didn't want this person to cut any more cause i was worried that it'd come out worse. this isn't the first time. also, a number of the stylist smelled like cigarettes. not a good smell when your hand is in my face cutting my hair. sorry to say, i feel that the quality of work done at this location has really gone done.
worst haircut of my life. "stylist" was harsh, music was loud and inappropriate for family setting. no receipt given. felt unwelcome, will never go back

very few good stylists at this location. i have been going for years and cannot recommend any by name except for xtina so don't have high hopes for quality work here. good haircut happens about 1/5 visits and i have left before because of stylists that i know don't communicate well and with less than a professional attitude. lottery every time but the damn location is so confident...an checking in "online" or with the app is not much better....you still sit in like with the others that check in and sometimes even walk ins depending on your time.

i think the experience at any salon depends on the hair stylist. if you found someone that did a good job, keep using that person. just few tips:1) come here around 8 pm on week day, there is usually no line. i think out of the 10 times i'm here, the longest wait was 10 mins. 8/10 times, i check in and i go straight to the chair. 2) weekends or long weekends, this place is packed.

went to get my hair curled and had a picture to show the stylist what i wanted. absolutely horrible job, put too much product in and made my hair greasy and she comb the curls out which made it frizz. i had to leave and was very disappointed in the job, i shouldn't have paid. i was on a time limit, which the stylist knew. i left to go wash my hair and style it myself, which came out better than the job i received. never going back again. i'll stick to the blow dry bars, better pricing and they do a way better job!

they do a good job here, i am pretty simple with my hair, just a shampoo and cut at the ends. i enjoy the shampoo, they do a little massage to your scalp that feels nice. sometimes they try to push their products for sale, which i don't like.
i don't like hair cutters who nick the skin around the scalp when my kids get a haircut. probably will not be returning for a long, long, long time.

i agree with most of the other reviewers, this place is a lottery. $13 for adult cut, not too bad a price, and they run specials every once in awhile. i've been to this location twice: the first time there was a young girl that went by the name sami (maybe samy) and she was amazing. i wanted a drastic change to my long curly hair, and she worked meticulously on it; gave me layers and cut it shorter than i've ever had it. i absolutely loved it. i came back about 4.5 months later to get it trimmed, and i was told she no longer works there, so i just let another stylist cut it. she did fine, but she was against cutting as short as sami did. so i know i'll have to go back soon to maintain the length. i really wish i could find out if this hairstylist still works in san antonio!!!in conclusion, if you just want a quick, simple hair cut, this is the place to go.also, both times i went on a week day, once at 12, and the other at 1, and there wasn't a line.
i got to say impressed with work and customer service from jelenna, she cut my daughters hair and did an amazing job!!!

so, many great businesses i've left reviews for have thanked me or offered to fix their error.  not one attempt from this franchise. i'm 3 weeks since my bad cut and hair is growing towards my ears and i'm starting to think about getting another cut..... but my bangs are still to short and pissing me off, so i'll wait a bit longer to get my next cut.
i've gone there now 4-5 times, close to home, different stylist every time, and results are the same love it

i went here for years with my son and stopped going because i started to get a subpar haircut/experience. i'll admit, jennifer is awesome, but always busy, because she does a great job in which others always request her. but last week i needed to get a haircut on a saturday and decided to give them another shot since it was the weekend and i was desperate.  once again another subpar haircut and  subpar experience. i hate feeling like cattle and being rushed out in world record time. i'll be going elsewhere instead.
great service and availability of highly qualified hair cutting stylists.i appreciate the attitude and quality.online booking app/web is a great option

i usually go to get my hair trimmed and never had any issues so i took my husband to get his hair cut since we were both running errands and we can get what we need done together. he was hesitant he wasn't confident that the stylist would know how to cut i said i've never had an issue and there was lots of men getting their hair cut today. i was helped first and finished first. then waiting for him i saw his face and his horrible haircut. i was in shock how the hair stylist thought this was a good job to still want to charge him and we were so embarrassed to even dispute it while everyone was in close range. so i felt so horrible i paid... i even tipped again i was too embarrassed to go off on this stylist. i would never come back or have him come back. we had to go to another place where an experienced barber can fix his hair he only charges 14. if you want a jagged choppy haircut this is the place for you.

if you go here, do not let karina cut your hair. she sucks!!! my husband & kids come here a lot & most of the time, the cut comes out okay because we give them simple instruction: 0.5 around & 4 at the top. i don't know how you can mess that up, but karina did! my son is taking his graduation pic this week looking almost bald. we'll still go back here, but we'll never have karina cut my boys' hair again!
great place to get a hair cut. jennifer does great work and listens to the styles you'd like. this is the one out in eastlake.
i came to great clips and they have amazing service i was really happy with my hair cut it was so beautiful. great clips made my day!!

great place for haircut for me easy to use the app and get a quick appointmentalways fast and easy for mei see some of the women had reviews and issue with their hair, so not sure about that.i would recommend for men as it is in the shopping area and i can go to target and lowes will i amin the shopping area.
very uneven hair cut for myself and my wife. will not be going back again, i wasn't happy the first time either. cheap hair cut but you get what you pay for.
last minute find before heading back to guam. was welcomed by sally. wonderful personality and made the hair cut entertaining. thanks. hair cut on point.

if you're looking for a haircut without an appointment,... seek another place. this establishment only focuses on online appointments. wanted to try this place since it has a lot of good reviews but,... completely had a horrible experience. waited for more than an hour to get a haircut!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! wtf! to make matter worst,.. they kept a screen with names who's next but does not follow it. was second and yet was passed (girl picked the 5th person without online appointment) fuck this place.
i take my 7 year old son here for his haircuts, definitely recommend jennifer! she's super nice, always double checks with me before and during the cut. his hair looks perfect every time.
been going to this place for about 3 years. sally has been cutting my hair majority of the time when i came in. i get along with her, she's nice, and caring.

this place has such a great vibe. the women who cut the hair are extremely nice, except for one, but other than that, great service! i recommend sally! she's probably the best out of them all, so ask for her!
katrina did an amazing job on my sons first haircut. she was patient yet quick. my 1 year old was not scared at all! thanks for the great cut!!!

definitely a decent place to get a haircut if you are in the eastlake area.  i have come several times and have had good experiences so far.  the prices are reasonable, the stylists are helpful and the place is clean.  i highly recommend checking in online during peak hours otherwise you will be waiting for awhile.

the worst haircut in 12 yrs. i asked the stylist to take 1 1/2" off my girls long hair w/a tiny bit of layers. clean up what she has. she showed me her definition of 1 1/2". i agreed. during the cut, 3 stylists went to my daughter & measured her hair where cuts were made. one or two made addt'l cuts. in between, the original stylist made more cuts. after the final "helper" left, i asked her to tell me honestly how much had been cut, while more is being cut from my daughters hair. she said, "1 1/2 inches." i said my anxiety was due to the 3 "helpers". she says, "oh we just checked her cuts. don't worry. it's a great cut." i will not be back. (trying to post a pic.)

i've always had good experiences here. employee turnover means you can have a regular hair stylist but within 6 months they are gone. but everyone here is good...they keep notes in the computer of your hair styling needs. clipper length, style on top, etc... parking in this lot can be kind of crazy especially at busy periods.

i've been going to great clips for quite awhile. i started off at the balboa store, and have been getting my cut from frankie. my wife and mother also see frankie. all three of us are extremely happy with the effort that she always gives. frankie pays attention to detail and remembers how all three of us like our cuts. she always gives suggestions, and we've never once had a complaint since frankie became our stylist. so, if you are looking for not only a great haircut, but a stylist that will make your time in her chair, fun, then go to the pacific beach location. if you have a cell phone (seriously, who doesn't?) get the great clips app, and check in online, and have a much shorter wait.

i am also part of frankie's "fans". frankie relocated here to this location. this great clips location does not offer the discount card for multiple haircuts. that is why i am giving a 4 for the salon but believe me a 5 for frankie.

first time coming here.  i brought my five year old son.  i love the location as it's close to home and conveniently located near a frozen yogurt place for a nice treat afterwards.michelle was his hair stylist and was so good with him.  right before us she cut the hair of an 18 month old baby.i showed a pinterest picture of the hairstyle i was going for and she did amazing.  i have had already a few moms ask where did he get his hair cut.so i'm here to say michelle is awesome with kids and an expert stylist.cost: $15tip: $5cheaper than little locks in la jolla.they could make it a bit more kid friendly.  we appreciated the lego blocks and lollipop  very much!!

i hate to complain about a $17 haircut but as soon as we got to the car and i saw the uneven lines and long patches everywhere i went straight to cvs to purchase clippers. i couldn't let him go to school in the morning like this. i wish i had taken more pics but it was pretty bad
told me i had to check in online. this place is only good if you don't mind average. they had an attitude and it seemed i was a bother as opposed to being a customer.

i came in today and there were two people getting a haircut. one person was in front of me and i was told a 10-15 min wait. 50 mins later one of the 2 hair stylists leaves and there is still one person in front of me. waisted my hour off for lunch to end up not getting a haircut. never coming back.

deebeh is the best!  this great clips has deebeh! the other stylists are probably good, and they cut hair fast with a great value.  i have been going to this great clips for almost four years because i had a not-so-stellar haircut (by someone who has now left this location) and deebeh fixed it no questions asked, with a polite apology and a smile!since then, deebeh has cut my hair approximately 50 times, and each time she is pleasent, friendly, professional, and does a fantastic job.  she is great!so, while i keep going to this great clips because they are cheap, and get the job done, i definitely recommend deebeh because she is awesome, and does great work!

shout out to veronica for giving me the best haircut of my life. i'm hard to please when it comes to getting my haircut but veronica nailed it the first time she ever cut it. i explained how i was unhappy with past haircuts and she asked me a bunch of questions and found out what i was looking for. she is a true professional and i'll definitely be coming back
been coming here for 4+ years. never really have to wait, all the employees are friendly but don't talk your ear off. shelly is great!
irma is the best hairdresser on the planet. no question. she is incredibly professional, detailed oriented and one of the nicest people to deal with. i refuse to let anyone else cut my hair!
irma did an amazing job. i'm new to la jolla and was in search for a new stylist after 10 years. she's competent, caring, and detailed oriented. highly recommend irma!

i have been going here for a year now. checked in online which said to arrive by 5pm i arrived 15 miutes before and was rudely told they are closed. i asked abiut my online checkin and she rudely stated again that they had a busy day and she was not cutting anymore hair today. she was right she will not be cutting my hair. i feel sorry for victoria who actually does a great job. that is the reason for the 2 stars. victoria 5 stars.
they messed up my cowlick. worst haircut i've gotten in years, and i've been getting it cut the same way for ~5 years. won't be coming back

unfortunately this location made their own policy for veterans day and chose not to honor the promotion as great clips is know for.  i reported them to great clips hq and they said the franchise owner is in the wrong!  chose another location for veterans!

i took my daughter in for a bang trim, she was so obedient and sweet - did everything the woman said. i stayed on the sidelines and didn't interfere and was very unaware of the horrible haircut that was being done. her bangs were crooked and choppy and she absolutely hacked the sides of her hair leaving her with a "mullet" style haircut: super short bangs in the front, choppy hair at her ears and long straggly hair in the back. when she presented my daughter to me and said they were done i couldn't help but laughing out loud. instead of apologizing and offering to fix the things i was pointing out to her she justified her work!! absolutely unprofessional. she then charged me for my visit. i took her to the great clips in the utc and the women there fixed her hair cut for me. they were polite and apologetic and "did their best" to fix the hack job done in pacific beach. we will never go back to irma at the pb great clips.

do not work for this franchisee. im currently going through the necessary legal hoops to ensure that they are exposed for unprofessionalism at levels that have exceeded civil and legal standards that i promise will not benefit u. i was treated (in my opinion) discrimination do to my living situation ,gender and sexual orientation. i was held accountable by policies that were never given to me. training that is only given if u ask other employees that can access all your pr info do to shared passwords. pay is allocated by clocking in and out but if your time clock is not to the owners liking she will gladly alter or change it. this will not be shared with you. if you dont keep record of your time you may find your hours are not accurate. this is my personal experiences that i hope will help yours not be as unfortunate. proceed with caution. supercuts is much better and will allow u to grow ur skills.

terrible, terrible customer service!  used the online check in for my son (19 months).   we did some errands because the wait was 63 minutes.  i still waited an additional 30 minutes beyond this.  as it was about his turn,  we had to do a diaper change.   i told them i would be back in 2 min, which i was.   they proceeded to let someone else go in front of us.  i've been going there for almost a year but this will absolutely be our last time.   the hairdresser was super rude and inconsiderate towards me and my child.

my experience at great clips was, as the name suggests, great. i checked in online, arrived at the shop and was seated immediately, the haircut was fast but with great attention to detail and my instructions (i brought pictures to show what i was looking for) and i left with my hair cut just the way i wanted it. and all this friendly and great service at a very affordable price (even for a student) !(the only downside was that i could not blow dry my hair over a round brush, which would have been charged extra.)

i've been coming here for awhile now and never have to wait very long in order to get my haircut without an appointment. yesterday i went and had sam cut my hair for the first time. he was really nice and explained hair products to me and had a friendly discussion as well. he also took extra steps for a smoother blend and reccomended the best ways to get discounts on the product they offer.  i will be back soon!

first time i came here a year ago they butchered me. i am reasonable and i know things happen and at the time i just let it go. so a year has passed and i figured i would give it a second chance.  this time i left with a bloody nick behind me ear and a botched fade. when the girl cutting my hair started to cry about what she did she mentioned how hard things are for her and that they only pay her $9 an hour. i felt bad for her and left after tipping her $5 to cut me.  at $9 an hour i guess they dont care about having qualified styists. live and learn i guess. probably better and safer to find another place to go for a haircut..
i have come here every week for the past year and and i have never been disappointed.  if you need a good fade and netflix recommendations, ask for sabrina.

i walked in and got very nicely greeted. i waited  a short time, the only woman that was not smiling and looked like she just really hated her job lucia asked if i was ready. i was nervous cause of her attitude. i tried to lighten her mood to see if see would smile but it didn't work. she goes on to ask what i would like done? so i tell her i want a good amount cut in the back and layered in the front. she said she can't because i would have gaps and does not feel comfortable layering  my hair. instead of asking someone else to cut my hair she just asked someone elses opinion. that lady said whatever u feel comfortable with to lucia instead of asking to take over or if i am comfortable! this haircut wasn't brain surgery it was a simple basic woman's haircut. for them not to try to make me happy was unreal! i'm not sure how she even had a license to cut hair. this place i would not recommend ever! lucia was not friendly and the lack of haircut skills was unreal

i've been going to great clips about the last six months. as we are traveling the country in our rv it's nice that they can keep records of your visit with notes on how you like you hair to be cut. well, at least that's the way it's supposed to work......the fellow that was trying to check customers in shouldn't be doing this job. he's nice enough but his english language skills aren't the greatest. nor ar his typing skills. he never did get my info straight. one of the stylists tried but even she was unsuccessful. i'm not sure why. i've checked in from northern washington to portland, oregon to yuma city, california and never had an issue. strange. but, back to my hair stylist. i'd read a review where a mother complained about this gal being rough when she cut her daughter's hair. rough is an understatement! i've never had my hair jerked like that before. now for me it didn't hurt bad, but i can well imagine what that felt like to a five year old. i know it was the same gal although i don't recall her name. it was something like vima maybe. she sounded eastern european to me, not that that matters. but she needs to have a few lessons and tug a little easier on folks hair. i'm glad we're traveling. next time we're in the area i'll go to another great clips. just not this location.

worse place ever! she messed up my hair bad. waste of 20 dollars seriously. i was ready to cut most of my long hair off but she didnt listen! she did what she wanted with my hair. after i got home i looked at my hair and it looks like a 5 year old grabbed scissors and just chopped my hair. i think her name was sabrina. dont let sabrina get close to your hair!
i recently visited this salon,  my experience was excellent. thank you girls for the great service and haircut for all my boys.

i went in last week and had the worst salon experience i have ever had. deziree yanked and pulled on my head while dry brushing my curly hair, and by the end of the first ten minutes i was almost in tears. i should have left at that point but i really wanted to have not wasted the ten minutes she just spent torturing me. she soaked the top half of my shirt during the wash, and never asked a single question about what i wanted. i finally offered that i'd like to take dead ends off and that i'd like layers. she added no layers in my hair, but she kept asking me "doesn't that feel better?" not once did she ask if i liked it. i basically have a blunt cut and with curly hair that means i have triangle head. i left the salon a frizzy mess because she didn't use a single styling product, and she thought that scrubbing my head dry with a terrycloth towel was a good idea. my scalp was so sensitive from her tugging on my hair i couldn't put it up for three days. she made me feel horrible about my hair, that it was a burden that had to be dealt with. i left feeling humiliated and degraded, and once in the car i had a complete breakdown. as someone who struggles with anxiety and depression i have a hard time going to do things like getting my hair cut. i just wanted to go in and get a fresh cut, maybe a new style, just to get a little morale boost. instead i got deziree. i tried to email corporate about the incident before coming here and they sent me and email that basically said "sorry, it's a franchise! but we'll pass on your comments to the owner and they'll call you soon." that was last week. no one ever called. the carelessness goes all the way to the top, apparently. i've never had an issue with gc before this, but i will literally never step foot into another gc again.

i brought my daughter into this location as a walk-in, and they tended to her immediately. she had a delightful experience, and wanted to come back into today. sabrina was amazing, and very customer service oriented, while personable with my 5year old daughter. i will be bringing her back to this location here soon. thank you, sabrina!
adorable haircut by a great stylist who really listens. thank you for my daughters new summer time look!
such nice people who do nice work. the stylists are speedy, nice, easy going. i've been getting my hair cut here for years and my 5 year old son has a nice time too.

this is my second time coming to this location and i loved it both times! the shampoo used for my hair smells amazing and i was shown deals on other hair products. this is probably where i'm coming to get my hair cut from now on.

deziree was absolutely horrid. my niece left in tears because the lady was very rough, abusive and mean. basically threatened her that she would have to shave her head because her hair is "so damaged". do not let her touch your head or your child's head. she never once asked if we wanted to pay more to have her wash the hair to make it easier. just belittled and berated and complained that the hair was so bad. and didn't even attempt to do the hair cut she was asked to do. absolutely horrible.
terrible. i would give them 0 stars but forced to give them 1. can't post this review unless i make it longer. it this long enough?

my husband's hair is so hard to cut correctly! deziree not only did a fantastic job, she was very fast. you can get a "frequent flyer" card for a free haircut. you can also check in on your phone so you don't have to wait. very friendly and professional people work here and it's very clean.

so... this is long overdue and i am officially  boycotting this shop now. i shouldve just stuck to my go to but this haircut was pretty last minute so i chose this train wreck of a business. the 1st time i went there in quite a bit of time i was met by a girl who was very nice. i have to admit. but...she cut my hair and literally bragged the entire time she was cutting it about how good she was. now..... being confident it one thing. be completely cocky is another. she may have felt she did an "amazing" job but i had to come home and touch it up myself. not only that getting a haircut is a pretty personal and an up close event. not cool to be cutting someones hair and wreaking of cigarettes the whole time. so that was my 1st visit in awhile. today was my second visit in quite awhile and will be my last. deziree cut my hair. for the most part she did ok. i had to again, come home and touch it up as there were chunks of hair uncut and much longer than the area surrounding it. a previous yelper put she was quite rough. yeah, for some reason the clippers kept catching my damn skull and driving the guard into my head. not a comfortable feeling. you would think after the 2nd time you would switch up what youre doing. oh no. happened like 8-9 more times. there are many places in santee to get a haircut, this is not one of them. i choose not to indulge who i go to normally and shouldve just gone to because this is not review to promote them. this is a review to tell you all... great clips sucks and will not get my business anymore. sorry..  but today was the last straw.

horrible experience!  the stylist, vian, trimmed my daughter's hair and was extremely rough and just pulled and pulled on my daughter's hair like she was some kind of animal.  we will never be back!  no wonder it was so empty in there (i guess that should have been my first clue).

the ladies here are super nice and the candy cup at the register is always well stocked. i love that you can check the wait times online and check in online so you can be seen first when you arrive. the days and times your favorite stylist are in always change so if you can, call ahead to check if they're in but you're in good hands no matter who you go to.

terrible! i took my son in to get a haircut because i had a coupon and i figured his cut is so easy you can't mess it up. well i was wrong... these ladies seriously have no idea what they are doing. i asked for a 1 faded up and blended and just to trim up the top. there is no fade and she did not blend it at all. it seriously looks like she put a bowl on his head and cut around it. i should have just went where i usually take him because now i have to take him and get it fixed anyways..

typically have a great experience at this location, but not this time. stylist in chair to the right in front (opposite receptionist booth) was beyond rude. my teenage daughter gave very clear directions as to how she wanted her hair cut. stylist said to her, "i'm not going that short, i'm leaving it at x length." she might have made three snips with the scissors and declared her done. we were in and out in under ten minutes.  i paid 20 dollars for my daughter to walk out looking exactly as she did when we walked in. due to the attitude, i said nothing, paid for the careless service, and decided the best i could do is to warn others. we won't be using this particular location in the future based solely off this one stylist poor attitude and lack of service. it's a shame because up until now, i've always left pleased. save yourself the drive and cut the hair yourself. you certainly couldn't do worse. update: i knew better, but i had really hoped that last time was just a fluke. it wasn't. i took my son in for a very simple haircut including pics of exactly what he wanted. he is 12 and more than old enough to explain what he wants. he showed her the pictures, explained to her how much he wanted cut, and she called me back four times because "she wasn't clear". i showed her the pictures again. explained this was exactly what he wanted. pictures covered all sides of the cut. it was a simple, short on the sides and a bit longer on the top. we aren't talking about some radical cut. in the end, it was close to what he had asked for, but even after he emphatically told her she had cut enough off the length, she continued to take some off. i understand needing to even put things, but this wasn't the case.  he doesn't hate it, but it is much shorter than he requested and once again that falls squarely on the stylist not listening to the client.
walked in 30mins before close and they still took me in. amazing service. her name was sonia that cut my hair. she was very nice. i would come here again to get a trim :)

this place has always been crap. i stopped going 4 years ago but had a coupon and took my self and son in for cuts. the hairstylist who cut my hair was so nice and i felt i could trust her. yeah, conversation was diversion tactic so you don't pay attention to a crappy haircut! so uneven and missed most of the split ends on the "trim" i asked for. my sons hairstylist asked about a million times how it should be cut. i gave her straight forward and simple instructions; short on sides and a little longer on top so he could spike it up if he wanted to. i told her we don't know the numbers, please stop asking. she said, "well, the computer says...." and i reminded her at least a dozen times that we hadn't been in since my son was 4 and that styles have changed - so we do not go by what the computer notes say. she chopped his hair so uneven, we have to just let it grow out or shave it off. i have never gotten good haircuts here. serves me right for being cheap and trying it on a coupon. the prices are terribly high for the crap you get.

this place always has no wait, is sanitary, has a friendly staff, and they take their time with the hair cuts to make sure it is done right! they do an overall fantastic job! i've been coming to this location for 6 months and i will continue to do so! they also have discounts for military and returning customers! highly recommended!

they are offering 3$ off if you write a yelp review... trying to up their rating i guess.place was clean, no wait, no issues with the online check in. the staff was friendly as well.haircut was crap as always. uneven cut, sideburns were way high and uneven as well. again, spent twice as much to get a worse haircut. there are so many other places in la mesa that do better for less.... only reason i went today was because my normal place was closed today.... poor planning on my part so i'll walk around with my badge of shame until it grows back.
terrible period!!! watch out for tomasa - tommy, she'll tear up your looks. i would rate this place a big fat 0!

very frustrating to call ahead to this place to see if the person who cuts your hair is going to be there and when you show up they're not, again. same person was supposed to order product for me and text us when it came in, haven't heard from her.

this place is pretty hit and miss. i had a new girl cut my hair today. it was a pretty bad experience , one of the worst hair cuts i have ever had. i also asked her to wash my hair after the hair cut to get off all the hair she was just cutting and dropping on top of my head.  she squirted my head with cold water for about 10 seconds and said ok all your set! sending me out the door with tons of hair all over my head and face.

just got my hair done here. was really satisfied with the outcome. very good and fast service. i asked for a fade and my fade ended up nicer than i thought. i definently reccomend this place. very good service and price!

i came here to cut off my hair and donate it to locks of love. while they don't donate the hair themselves anymore, they were still happy to cut it for me to take home and send. my hair dresser was caroline. i had some old color on my layers underneath and they let me know that, because of that, it might not be donatable. but they weren't finished. they talked with me and we figured out a solution. after that part was done, she continued to cut my hair to the pixie cut i wanted. she was very personable and nice. she made sure multiple times that i liked the way she was cutting my hair. she was really caring about me as a person rather than just a head of hair to cut. i'm definitely going back to caroline for all my next haircuts!

when we walked in, there was one stylist giving a haircut to the only customer present. we were not acknowledged. as we were sitting, i did notice a computer screen showing the waitlist which was empty. after a few minutes, a couple of people came in and sat poking at their phones. then a couple more. one of the new arrivals was acknowledged by the stylist who asked if he had checked in online. it was then that i noticed 4 names now appearing on the waitlist. another customer entered at this time and she added him to the waitlist. then she asked us if we had checked in online. i said no. she then put us last on the list. the screen said our wait time would be approximately an hour. then she called the first name on the precious list. we had already been waiting 20 minutes. there had been no one on the waitlist when we arrived, and no one waiting. we were invisible customers who needed a good lesson in their system of checking in online. we left. won't be back.

this is my favorite place to get hair. the staff are great and i never have any problems. my favorite is the manager heather. shes super fun to talk to while i get my cut, and always makes my hair look better than what i thought it would look like.

i had gone back to this haircut shop as to where a chubby gal named "stephonie" did my last haircut, well she talked so much about her kids i felt she never paid attention to my hair. i asked for a layered haircut but she thinned it out and now it is uneven, a total mess. i wanted "mousse" to be put in my hair afterwards but she scrunched it with "men's gel".this was a total "no win" situation for me and my family of five will not go back there again. she was not pleasant @ all when it came time to pay. she tried to ring me up for a blow dry but i reminded her it was the client before me who had a blow dry. not only a rotten haircut but then to get gypped.

shame on you! my stylist lucia is back at the santee great clips location. when i called that lady i spoke with, whom i believe is the manager, lied and said she didn't know where she went. in the future, my other family members may have used your location. my whole family is in this area. but since it has never been comfortable(owner walking through barking) and you can feel the stress at this location and now you flat out lied, we will not be back!

tammie, or tommie, is the manager and the worst hairdresser they have. when you get a horrible haircut, how can you complain and get satisfaction. she doesn't listen to what you want and argues with you about anything you question about the haircut. mine was uneven and crooked on the hairline. she only wants to work fast and get you in and out. don't make the mistake of wasting your money here.

april 27th, probably the worst service i have ever gotten. i got seated and she asked what i wanted and i asked if i could start with a number 3 on the sides first and shorten it to a 2 if it was too long but she said no. i was confused on why she said no. she did it anyway and gave me a taper down to a 1 1/2 but i didn't even ask for it to be tapered to a 1 1/2. i then asked if she could make that taper to a 1 but she flipped out and was complaining that i was changing my mind too much. i kindly asked if the other lady in the room could do it for me but the lady cutting my hair got even more mad that i said that. she ended up doing it for me anyway. after the haircut, she started mumbling to herself and complaining under her breath. if i could get a refund, i would. long story short, don't get your haircut here lol

finally!  a person who listens to what i want!  i recommend jasmine.  i recently moved here, and have gone through several  peeps who had their idea of what i wanted, instead of what i wanted.  i will return.i will say, if the staff there misleads me again as to when my new friend is working, i will stop going there.  when i called in, i was told that she would be there.  turns out when i got there, it was her day off.  i don't reward people who lure me in just to get bucks...  if it happens again, i will move on.
fast and easy to set up an appointment with the iphone app. nice staff with reasonable prices for a regular men's cut and shampoo.

they only get two stars because they were polite, however my low fade skin was more like a high "fade" and they had to switch me to a different chair because the first lady couldn't to a skin fade.  i'll stick to the base barber shop after this. not recommended for military cuts...
jasmine was a great hair stylist. i've been to this location a few times never once had a bad e ample. will be going back and recommend this location. thanks jasmine

despite the bad reviews for for this, i decided to give it a try because i thought maybe people were being biased! but i regretted it immediately! i specifically told her i wanted a trim and chopped off 6 inches of my hair... not sure if there was a language barrier or if she was mentally impaired! and the worst part was i told her i wanted "layered" hair because my hair is thin and fine and now my hair is all choppy! like who gave this woman her license? i can't believe i paid a fortune in hopes to have a professional cut my hair but i end up looking like a drag queen.

my boyfriend gets his haircut by lucia and usually loves it, so i decided to give this place a try.  jasmine cut my hair, maybe spent 10 min on it and it's choppy, uneven all over and one side in the front is noticibly longer.  probably one of the worst haircuts i've had.  when she asked if i wanted layers i said no and thank goodness.  i'll be heading somewhere else today to have it fixed.

its all about jasmine! love my hair after coming here as a walk in . found myself asking jasmine to be my stylist as soon as i saw her- her hair style was en trende and her smile and manners were welcoming despite how busy she was. she listened to what i requested and followed through in an amazing amount of time. i'll be back for her. best deal in town!
melanie gave me an awesome style and cut today. highly recommend her for any future style or cuts. she has a great personality and is very attentive to detail. will definitely be coming back!

went in for the first time because i received a coupon so i figured i'd try them for my son's haircut. he is a year and a half and my friend who is a hair stylist has cut his hair before. because of her busy schedule and the convenient location of this place we went in. seems that the older lady with dark hair and glasses has been there for a while because i read some of the bad reviews today and they seem to be about her. she is grumpy and rude. i walked in first then my husband with our son. my husband accidentally left the door open and the first thing the grump said was 'the door.' that was her way of asking us to close the door behind us. she should just stay in the back. she is probably not the best person to have at the front desk when customers come in and check-in. we were however greeted by the lady who was working to the right closest to the door. she seemed to be the only nice happy person there.  another older lady hair stylist became available and took us. i sat down with my son on my lap. now, this is not my son's first haircut so i know how it should be. the hairstylist seemed annoyed from the beginning. she didnt try to talk to my son or try to slowly start cutting his hair. instead, she just turned on her trimmer, grabbed the top of his head all crazy and went at it. he's a baby so of course he's gonna get scared. she didnt say one word the whole time.  but, the happy lady in the front who had a customer was talking to my son instead. my son's haircut is ok, there's a little patch in the back of his head though. i think i'll stick to my friend cutting his hair or try one of the haircut places designed for kids.if we do ever decide to return for whatever reason, i will definitely go to the lady closest to the door who seemed nice and happy.

last night was the first time and will be the last time that i bring my son to this place. despite the bad reviews, i still wanted to give it a try, because of the location and their opening hours to 9 pm. just as another review mentioned, people there are not very happy. the  person who cut his hair looked very miserable. the result of her work is awful. the worst hair cut ever had for my son. i had to make apology to my son multiple times, as i took him there. and this place is not cheap either. unless you know someone there is good, it doesn't worth the risk.
went there for my first time recently. location is great. i highly recommend melanie. she is friendly and cares.

the check in app is useless as it showed me 26 mins wait and when i arrived after 30 mins it's still showed 16 mins. also a very overpriced place for the quality of hair cut. you are better off going to a $7 haircut place than coming here.

on occasion, i come here for my kids to get their haircuts, but it's pretty much because it's the closest place and they're open until 9pm.  they are overpriced unless you have a $9.99 coupon, or one of those promo discount cards you can buy from local high school students for fundraising...with those you get $2 off, so it's still $14 for a basic cut and no shampoo.  the stylists sometimes make you second guess your style requests.  i don't appreciate that especially when i show them a photo of what i want for my boys.  it's like they don't want to put any effort into the style for kids.  nobody seems happy to be working there either.  that's the vibe i get anyway.  2 stars for convenience.

i have been here in last 4 years at least 15 times. and every time i come i experience the customer service less better than the previous time! i got in today and no one said "welcome to great clips". however all the white people that came in after me get to hear that !!many a times i have been asked questions like - where am i from ? where do i work ? am i an engineer ? lot of engineers from india. 4s ranch lot of indians. and rather than focusing on my hair cut i have to involve myself into such unwanted conversations! sweetie .. i am just looking for a decent hair cut !! if you choose to hold scissors and i choose to hold books in my hand .. there is nothing much i can do about it ! we need a re-org / new leadership for sure!
michael - really nice haircut and attention to detail.  i'll go back again when in san diego.

second time here and they were great again! evelyn helped me out today and she was super helpful (and friendly)! we consulted for 10 minutes and it took about 20 minutes to cut. she kept asking me what i thought about this and that, making sure i was happy with what she was doing. 5 stars to evelyn :)
lauren and everyone else that works here are solid gold. can't find a nicer place to get a hair cut.
great clips always makes us look pretty! shohreh is awesome- my husband looks like a new man when comes out with his new haircut.

definitely stay away. i made the mistake of coming here, but i hope you take your $20 elsewhere. a lady cut my hair and i gave her pictures for reference but she simply could not understand the style i was hoping for. and the style i wanted was what i already had, just a shorter trimmed version. her manager can see this so he comes out (really nice white guy) and pulls her aside to explain how to perform this experiment (for her it truly was, an experiment) on my head but she completely misses the mark, and then tells me towards the end that she needs to go get her glasses because she could never see the picture clearly. this is the part of the experiment where the scientist realizes that he did not in fact find a cure to cancer for humans, instead for snails. he was looking at snails the whole time. he simply forgot to wear his glasses. good for the snails though. i was left dumbfounded and so i curtly mention on her return that maybe glasses before the cut next time (if ever i am truly feeling clinically insane to decide to come back) would be better. in a dismissive tone i hear "oh it's okay honey, you have everything to gain nothing to lose as your hair will grow back!" this is like going to the bakery, eating rotten bread, and being told "but food poisoning only lasts a couple of days!" it's cool though, i guess she's right, it'll grow back, can't argue there no i can't, but i'll need to be able to explain why i resemble a hairless cat.notable mentions: - bald spot on the back of my head. looks botched. but it will grow back, right?! perhaps a new motto for you greatclips. "we're not sorry it will grow back" - the lady seemed insufferable. she is angry at the world. not to downplay her own problems, however, they can be fair and real, just simply not appropriate for the workplace. i'm scared of her around sharp objects, to say the least. - she asked if i was doing "okay" at least 15 times. a "yes" each time was politely replied but i was most certainly lying by the 7th one. excessive. - she asked me to read out the expiry on my coupon as, of course, she could not see it,  because yes her glasses were off again. a wild experience. customer service and the service itself is embarrassing, please don't make the mistake of coming here.

what am i doing here ?? spur of the moment...thanks to fellow elite yelper, kenna h. for recommending this place !!! oh wait it's been years since i've been here. location/setting:-located at a shopping center near bbb and ralphs-plenty of parking-small hair salon (don't expect high-end decor)-there is a check-in monitor/screen that tells you where you are on the waiting list. nice feature. they call your name when it's your turn.customer service:-the young lady who greeted me seemed liked the unhappiest person on earth. geez. a smile wouldn't hurt.-my hairdresser was quite pleasant though. i think her name was evelyn..a nice older filipina lady.-i usually am iffy about these places..i mean you get what you pay for, but i just wanted a trim and she did a pretty good job. through dying and flat ironing, i was having hair dilemmas. i had major dry split ends so i wanted a mini hair makeover. she was very attentive and wanted to make sure that i knew exactly what she was going to do. i wanted to keep my hair medium length. she took off a good 3 inches and cleaned up my layers from before. i must say it made a huge difference. my dead ends are gone ! yay !-i also had her shampoo my hair. great mini massage too. the whole process took less than 30 minutes.additional info:-for $20 not too shabby. i wish i had a coupon. i hear they have $5 off coupons all the time so keep an eye out for those.-if you check-in online (or use great clips app.), you won't have to wait too long, but since this was a random spur of the moment thing, i had to wait for 15-20 minutes on a saturday. not too bad considering there were a few people ahead of me already seated in the waiting area.- convenient ! you're in and out quick so it's great if you're in a rush.- reasonable hours - open 7 days/weekverdict:i got lucky this time around. i'm sure it's a hit or miss depending on who you get. if you aren't too picky with haircuts (keep it simple) and in a rush then i'm sure they can do a decent job. don't expect high end salon treatment. they want you in and out.
shohreh is the bomb! she does fantastic cuts! can always count on her. she's my girl!

shohreh is awesome!!!! she is a pro & gives a meticulous haircut!! the wait for her is always worth it. she listens & does exactly what you request. so lucky to have found her!! have been going  to her for the past 6 years. people stop me all the time & ask me where i get my haircut. her expertise is reflected in the professional haircuts she gives. she is also a beautiful & wonderful person!!! thank you shohreh!!!
my wife just got her haircut (she thinks the person's name was kendra) and said the hairstylist was very nice and did a great job communicating everything she was doing.

i've been going to rich for years now, although he is in various locations and i have to track him down when i need a cut.  i have total strangers stop me frequently when i am out and about admiring my cut and asking where i get it done.  i always recommend great clips for the price and results.
i've gone there several times. was ok in the past but lately has gone downhill. if you want a bad haircut chances are you will get one there...

had such a wonderful experience here. i had the luck of having rich cut my hair and i am beyond happy with not only the cut he did but the amazing person that he is. great salon, awesome service and incredible haircut! i came from an hour away and will continue to do so as long as rich is around!

due to numerous bad haircut experiences, i had pretty much given up on going to any more great clips locations. but i'm glad i gave it one more try. richard, the general manager at this location, also cuts hair. i've used him a couple of times and he gets it right. so now i just call ahead and will only go when he's working. since they don't take appointments, i just let him know when i'll be there and then check in online. no more crooked or too short haircuts for me. the parking lot here gets crowded.they accept competitor's coupons, as long as they're not expired. as long as richard is working here, i'll continue to come here. thanks for the great and affordable haircut!

sarah has been cutting my hair for several months now. when i relocated to del sur it took quite a few tries to find someone who would pay attention to the way i want my hair cut. sarah is very attentive and consistently cuts my hair as i request.

warning...there is an incompetent hairdresser on the loose at this salon and her name is christina.  she lost control of her razor and failed to point this out to my son and never showed him the back of his head. shame on you christina! at least be an adult and inform your clients' of your mistakes.  it wasn't until he drove home when we noticed the two bald spots. not only is she incompetent with  the razor but also shares inappropriate information with clients. my son said when another male customer walked into the salon she said, "phew, glad i didn't get him, he is too picky".  i'm guessing he too once suffered under the sheers of christina.consider yourself warned.
if i could put a 0* i would. i've never seen my husband's hair like this. it's completely uneven all around his head. maybe they should clip dog hair?  anyways, not going back for sure!

my fiancé came and got a haircut here yesterday. the person who cut his hair was ngoc. she did not do a good job w his hair. we came home and i saw that his hair was uneven! she completely missed the right side of his head. i didn't go in w him the first time and i didn't see it initially since i wasn't there. we came back in to get it fixed and she didn't even remember cutting his hair. then, she was unhappy to fix it!i showed her where it was uneven and she said "no, it's straight. you see?" as she continues to cut his hair. if it's even like you claimed...then why are you still cutting? then once she was done "fixing" it, she started cleaning her clippers as he sat there in the chair. we were not even sure if he was done because she didn't say anything except looked angry and left him hanging. we will not be back. terrible service. avoid ngoc at all cost. she will mess up your hair!

another spur of the moment hair adventure !!!i never noticed this place existed. it's been here for a few years and i've been going to studio barre classes next door. doh ! like other great clips locations, it's a hit or miss on who you get if you don't have a regular hairstylist. i decided to take that risk again since i had a good experience at another location.location:-easy to find; off the 56 freeway-plenty of parking-small and clean saloncustomer service:-friendly, fast, and efficienti didn't have an appointment booked nor did i check-in online. i was expecting a wait, but surprisingly i was called in right away. it was also thursday afternoon so it wasn't busy at all. the lady at the front greeted me and took my information. apparently, they didn't have my record in the system even though i've been to another great clips. they are all connected.my hairstylist was renee (i think) and she was super down to earth and cool as can be !! she had a very hip hairdo that i personally couldn't get away with, but she rocked it ! i was considering going drastic myself, but instead opted for a few inches off instead. haha i know..boring !!!i am super low maintenance when it comes to my hair. recently, i've stopped dying and flat ironing my hair since it was drying out and causing me to get major split ends. i'm finally nurturing my hair back into good health. renee was open to hearing about my concerns and trimmed off more of my split ends and added more layers to my hair. in my opinion, medium-length hair seems to suit me best rather than long hair. i got a nice shampoo/conditioner and massage as well. throughout the whole process, renee was very professional with hair recommendations and i easily trusted her judgement. it was super quick and i was in and out in less than 30 minutes. great for those who are in a rush. don't get me wrong though. she was meticulous and knew what she was doing. i was very pleased.total came to $20 plus tip. not too shabby ! i have yet to find those great clips coupons everyone is talking about.if ever i want a simple cut, i will never go to a high-end salon for that anymore. great clips does a decent job for a fraction of the price.

i take my boys here exclusively for their hair cuts. there's a reason. they get the job done right. you can check-in online using their app. and it shortens the wait because you can come in when you think they'll call you. the app will tell you there's a 30 minute wait, for example, and you can adjust your arrival time accordingly. they almost always get you in, if you checked-in online, at the time they estimated for your wait.also, they take competitor's coupons, but no coupons printed off the internet.  so be aware and look through those free mailers that come to your house. i almost always use a coupon and always tip well because frankly, they deserve it!

yikes, hubby came home piiiiiiiiiissssssed. i have never seen him so upset over a haircut before. as my last review stated, christina was the only good person he had here (pq/rb never gave him good haircuts) but she left a long time ago. so he went back today, i guess to give them another chance, plus he had a coupon.he had the middle aged asian lady worker who barely spoke english, and didn't listen to anything he said of how he wanted his haircut. he has super easy hair to cut, by the way.she took way too much off and he told her that she didn't listen to anything i said. no apology, no nothing (probably cuz she couldn't understand him lol)...he came in the house and i told him "honey, wear a hat for the next couple of weeks" lol....this should've been comped. i saw the haircut. no way he should've paid for that garbage. and i can't believe he still tipped her. my hubby is way too nice. personally, i would've complained to the manager. he is still pissed lol i better give him some cookies to calm him down.he said he will never go back there ever again...but he said it in more colorful language. all right yelpers, you've been warned.

took my 2 year old there today for a hair cut. he was being a normal child who doesn't like hair cuts! crying a lot but i was holding him. the hairdresser said "is it nap time?" "you are being crazy" to my son. she was very rude to him and i. didn't deserve to get paid at all for her words. if you cant handle cutting children's hair then don't!!

i *always* know there *must* be a gimmick when you see a haircut being flashed around for only $8.99. there must be a 'read fine print' somewhere. or maybe there should be that fine print somewhere on all their $8.99 haircut banners. we were in this shopping plaza the other day and the bf wanted a quick hair cut. he's been to sports clip which he likes. i think he said their haircuts start at $20.it was pretty busy at this great clips location that early afternoon. we went in and i inquired about the $8.99 price. the young receptionist, who was nice, asked us to fill out an info card which i politely declined as we were only there asking about the price and there's no need for them to get our personal info. she still didn't know the details about the $8.99 so she asked one of the stylist. the young girl then said yes, $8.99 for a haircut. i asked if that included a shampoo perhaps? and she had to ask another stylist who whispered to her 'no, it's haircut only'. i think a shampoo is an additional $4-6 dollars or so. alright. no biggie. there's the fine print for me. fine. she quoted a 15 min wait so we put our name in (and yes filled out info card) and went next door to peet's to grab a coffee. 10 min later we came back and was told another 10-15 min. jeez. when it was bf's turn to get haircut, it didn't take long (maybe 12-15 min). he said he was happy with the haircut and the girl was pleasant & friendly. we found it pretty cute they handed him a hand(pre)written thank you card with a discount card also included. nice touch. bf said that he'd give the place 4 stars for the cut but agreed 3 stars for initial confusion (of price) and longer wait than what was quoted. i didn't realize this place takes online reservations (?) so maybe that's the way to go when you visit this location.

zachary is "the best" for my husband who is 87.  he's patient and goes the extra mile by not rushing, making sure my husband's ideas are possible, and even trims his eyebrows and ears without asking.  he's so kind, as well as accomplished in what my husband wants, that we've followed him around to various locations for a few years now.

i'll never go back there again! the barber cut off more than i asked. this happened twice and it was by the same person. i wasn't happy with the haircut back in june.  i went there 2 days ago hoping to get somebody else, but she was the only one available at that time. i decided to give her another chance. to avoid any misunderstanding i repeated my request to cut half an inch off the top part of my hair. i emphasized repeatedly "no more than half an inch!" but, what did she do? she cut off way too much again! you fool me once, shame on you. fool me twice,...never that place again!!!

amara is very outgoing and comforting! i came in clueless about my hair but she gave me so much helpful information! ask for her when you come in here! the place is very welcoming and clean! will definetly return!

i went in yesterday - feb 2 around 4:30 ish to get a simple trim done . i was greeted by christina who asked me to fill out a info card since it was my first time there . i only went here bc it's around the corner from my house and my dad recommended it. i was seated within 15 from me walking in and melania took care of me - she was amazing and listened to what i wanted. i'm giving it a 2 star due to christina making a racist comment to melania. melania is from columbia and like any other immigrant has an accent when speaking english . as melania spoke christina decide to say " what are you saying ? speak english " - mind you everyone understood what melania said. i turned around and did give christina a dirty look and said that was unnecessary. then christina decided to say that melania reminded her of a child learning to speak for the first time- that's when i was ready to go. i don't tolerate any type of racism or down playing someone's intelligence . first of all-i'm an immigrant and i took it very personal due to my own experiences. secondly, this is your job - act professional. thirdly, christina if this is what you teach your kids at home be ready for a rude awakening.

okay, so i got my hair cut each month here for about two years. why am i rating them two stars (and never going back ever again)? they have about 2-3 good staff members and the rest are a major inconvenience. rookies to people who can barely speak english, you name it. just go somewhere else.

ive been coming to great clips for a long time now and just had the manager cut my kids hair. zachary was so amazing with all my kids. we will definitely be back and i highly recommend this great clips and zachary.

i reviewed this place 22 days ago but it's not showing up. i popped in today since i was next door getting coffee and the air conditioning is still broken. it felt like a swet shop in there. how dare they make the staff work in those conditions. the girl told me it was 88degrees inside.
i started going here for convenient location but have since come to realize their service is great too.   i highly recommend.
milena was very nice and efficient in giving my haircut on a sunday morning (they save my settings too)!

i never notice this place before, but i was in dire need of a haircut and dropped in without an appointment.  they took me in right away and put me in the hands of kirsten (sp?), a young lady from texas.  she did exactly what i asked for, and actually improved on it just a little.  best haircut i have had in 10 years.  i will definitely be back.  this is my new favorite place for haircuts,

my three kids have been going to zach at torrey highlands for about 3 hair cuts and he has always done an excellent job!  we like him so much that we followed him from another great clips that is closer to us.  he is kid friendly, precise, efficient, and we love their hair when it is done.  we check in with the app and hardly have to wait.  today my 2nd son was already getting his hair cut by the time my daughter  and i walked in.
great service today from natsumi.  her technique was exceptional with exacting skill and attention to detail.   she is our good to stylist at great clips!

this review is in regards to a visit to this location on october 5, 2017.  i checked in as usual through the app and arrived at the salon around 12:15pm.at this time there were two women working, one with longer green-black hair and tattoos and another slightly older with shorter grayish hair.  the older woman finished cutting her clients hair, had him pay, and then immediately said "ok sir, i'm ready. you can come on back."i followed her back and just as i expected from the immediate turn around the floor was just covered in hair from at least 1 haircut but it looked like more.  there was also a neck ribbon or two lying among all the hair.  i stood back a few feet to give her the opportunity to clean up, as i assumed she may have just forgot and wanted to give her the benefit of the doubt.  after about 10-15 seconds she looks at me (which she stands in piles of hair) and says "are you coming?".  at this point i said "i can't do this." and walked out, absolutely disgusted.  after a minute i decided it would be best to go back in to provide feedback as a courtesy.  all she said was "are you ready?" the floor was still covered in hair with zero attempt to clean up.  when i stated my concern she said "you never gave me a chance to clean up." which is a brazen lie.  that is exactly why i stood back in the first place.i am not a germaphobe or someone with a compulsive aversion to unclean situations, but i was dumbfounded (not to mention this is a california health code violation).  my grandmother owned a small salon in rural ohio for almost 40 years and my mother owned another for many years.  i have grown up in them and pride myself on always appreciating the hard work stylists put in.  this experience has also primed me as to what i should expect from a salon and this is not it.i have been going to great clips for nearly 10 years in 2 different states and this is far and away the worst experience i have ever had with this (or any other) salon.  i can say with certainty i will never again venture to this location.

first time going to this place.i would go back any day they give really good haircuts! the people here are very friendly and do there job very well.crystal does amazing work she is a very good hair stylist....

when you get home and have to fix your own hair, you know it's a bad haircut.  i don't know if the "stylist" was having a bad day but she didn't seem to care about my hair for one second.  i asked for a few touch ups and she balked at my suggestions stating that my hair will look bad.  well, my hair did look bad.  as i was driving home, i reached to the back of my head to find a huge clump of hair that she clearly missed.  on top of that, she missed a few other spots that i could easily identify with just a mirror and a comb at my house.  i would highly advise to look anywhere else.  the only reason it isn't 1 star is the tv in the waiting area is a nice touch.

crystal is amazing!!! i seriously only let her touch my hair. i could go anywhere to get my hair cut but why would i when she is the best! i couldn't be happier that i don't have to spend an arm and leg at some fancy salon, yet get even better results than when i have. crystal just happens to manage great clips, but i would follow her anywhere. she knows exactly what and how i want my hair, as i'm extremely particular. i am forever being complimented on her work. thank you crystal for being a part of making me feel beautiful! i'll be seeing you soon!

if i could leave 0 stars i would. i have been trying to grow my hair out for over a year to have an asymetrical angled bob. today was going to be the day..... psych!i usually see a nice black lady but she gave me to a fat white lady with glasses. which i didnt mind. i figured since i am fat too she would give me the cut i wanted and make me look good for my interview i haad later that day. we discussed what i wanted. i was very clear, stacked in back, angled to my jaw on the right and angled and just take off the dry end on the left. she said she would have to take off maybe an inch on the left... shorter than i wanted but fine. i waited forntgis haircut for a year. my hair grows super slow.first i had to ask for a shampoo, she was just going to spray my unwashed hair down.shampoo done, she has to use the restroom. fine, she took like 10 minutes in the restroom. whatever... nature calls you gotta answer.she then combs my hair and clips and reclips my hair. finally starts cutting. she cutsbthe back then on to the short side. she cuts that super blunt and not angled.she goes to the long side and tells me she can't do it. what?! what do you mean you can't do it?? she said it will have to be a lot shorter on the long side. i told her i didnt wantbit to look like my haed was cocked when it was cut. i wanted a visable difference. after she cut the long side shorter, it looked maybe a half inch longer than the short side. i was upset and told her just to even out the cut. i started crying. she didnt notice and just kept cutting and finally asked if i was crying, really you needed to ask? i looked up and saw she also cut blunt with no angle. i started crying harder. she asked what was wrong. i told her this was not the cut i wanted, it was not angled in front, and she started to argue with me. seriously telling me that i never told her that i wanted angeld sides.i got up and told her we were done. threw some money on her station and proceeded to take the cape off.the black lady offered to try and fix it nut i had no more time and my hair was entirely too short now, so i didn't want any more cutting.horrible experience! you never argue or patronize the person in the chair. i have been a hairdresser for 10 years and what she told me was incorrect. it could have been done, an experienced hairdresser knows how to do it. now i have another year of growing out to do.thanks.

my experience at this location was very good. i had frankie for my stylist, and she was great. she definitely made me feel like more than just an ordinary customer and genuinely interested in actually getting to know me as a person. i will definitely be back.

great customer service here!!! no wait when other shops had over an hour. stephanie did a wonderful job with my son as he gets ready to go into high school. he looks great and she gave the exact cut he wanted.tina did my hair and exceeded my expectations as she trimmed my ear hair and eyebrows. this was the first haircut shop in which i experienced this style of customer service. we'll definitely return to this location for our hair cuts. tina also gave us a discount. well done ladies!!!

frankie is a great stylist/haircutter for a few special reasons. she has a fabulous eye for what style would work for​ a person. she listens to me and allows​ me to offer my sometimes "not so good ideas" and follows my wishes. when i realize i didn't make the best choice she just gets me back on the right track. all of this with a smile and a caring attitude. i trust her with her choices for me and that means a great deal! like others, my appearance is very important to my sense of self-worth​. i get so many compliments about my haircut. so glad i found her. she is great to talk to as well (smile).

among the worst visits to a hair cut spot. lady just read some notes in her computer from my last visit 2yrs ago. did not ask me how i would like it cut... did not ask me if i was happy after the cut... which by the way took less than 15mins. no artistic effort - just chop chop!  the lady wore glasses and squinted a bunch - i'm not going back. 2 stars because at least the place was clean and plenty of parking.

i came here without an appointment. haircuts are $17, child and seniors are $15. the place is very clean and organized. the haircut station is on the left hand side and shampooing station is on the right hand side. they clean up the hair after every client and they greet you as soon as you walk in. today was kind of busy considering the long weekend and everyone is trying to look sharp for the bbq pool party tomorrow! :) i had britney today and she was very good and bubbly. i will be happy to return! my hair looks great and healthy again!
great location, and crystal is the best! she's always quick to respond and does an outstanding job every time.
