this will be the last time i attend this place. for starters, you know it's going to be bad when you hear one of the cosmetologist complaining about when she will get to leave work and the other two workers are basically telling her to stop complaining. it gets even worse when the one that's complaining ends up cutting your hair. i don't know how she managed to pass her license exam but man was she horrible and i wish i could remember her name so i could mention it here. i always ask for the usual same as last time style which the great clips system is good at keeping track of, but she couldn't for the life of her figure out how to fade let alone make it even. she hesitated to show me the back of my head until i asked and when i saw it i was extremely disappointed. it looked like the rocky mountains jagged! had it not been so busy i would have asked for her to stop and let someone else cut my hair. like i said this will be the last $20 i pay for a bad style cut. bye bye not so great clips.

9:04 am, saturday morning. i just called and they don't take appointments. the person said to walk in or check in on the great clips app. when i first logged into the app, the wait was 22 minutes. now 9:13 am, the wait is 13 minutes. so, if you wanted to get a hair cut at 10 am, you need to check in sometime before and hope you time your check in just right.

checked in online where the est wait time was 35 min. was greeted immediately and finished checking in upon arrival - actual wait time was less than 15 min. lina was my assigned stylist. she asked how i wanted my hair cut and i showed her some pics of how it's normally cut by my nephew. she cut it as requested and the result was spot on. i couldn't be any happier with the cut! thank you great clips and lina for the great service - you now have a new, repeat customer!

i've been coming here for my haircuts since it is close by my house. i've been coming here for two years and majority of the time get my haircut from lien. i am always satisfied with the haircuts i get from her. she always listens to what i want in a haircut. it is understandable that some haircuts i show her cannot be done due to the type of hair i have, but she definitely gets close to it as possible. i would definitely recommend her.

to be honest i've avoided coming here because for some reason i like to take chances on terrible vietnamese hair salons. since i was in the area, short on time, and in desperate need of a haircut, i decided to come in here. i was immediately greeted by a woman name karen. karen has got to be the most endearing hairstylist i've ever come across. she makes it a point to learn your name and say it at least 5 times throughout your haircut. she explains exactly what and why she's doing what she's doing. she actually reminded me to wash my hair after a haircut, i can't even be mad.as an athlete, my hair was pretty damaged due to all the chlorine and poor little pony tails it has endured! not to mention, my last haircut from some other salon left me with hair reminiscent of a 14 year old emo teeny bopper (thick on top, thin on bottom), needless to say, i hated it. karen fixed it right up erasing a weird rat tail like layer and rounding out the layers to the best of her ability. she wanted to cut a little more than what i was usually comfortable with, but she actually asked me & told me why! i like that she asked me first before she cut it because i know we all have horror stories where the stylist expressed a little too much creative freedom! long story short, my hair looks healthier and fuller without feeling heavy! glad i came in and can't wait to stop in for my next trim! :)

i've been going to this great clips or several years, never disappointed. the last couple cuts have been by theresa, she's fast and does a nice job. i'm not sure where the comments about rude staff come from, i've always been treated with the utmost courtesy.

terrible. rude staff, didn't listen to my instructions.  the great clips down the street by the toys r us is great but this one is a little closer so thought i'd give it a try. big mistake, i'm a guy and not terribly picky about my hair but even i think this is awful.  tried to correct the woman doing the cut and she blew me off. to top it off she rudely demanded a tip. i laughed and left, thank god my hair grows fast.

helena looks experienced but did a really shabby job with my haircut. she finished cutting my hair within 5 minutes and was more interested in getting to the next customer. the other hairstylist took more time and seemed to have done a better job. i'd not advise this location.
this is run by a by rude people who dont know how to cut hair. please never go there with kids. they are unfriendly to kids and just dont care about customers.

so bad! this is not my son's usual place to get his hair cut. i forced him to try this place because, 1) its great clips (pretty popular) 2) it was convenient at that very moment. after my son's hair cut, i noticed the lady didn't shave or clean the back of my son's neck to get rid of the access hair. his barber usually  does to compliment his new clean cut. i told the lady to please shave the "baby hair" and she sighed heavily as if i am asking her for a favor. she cleaned it but unwillingly. she charged me $17 (ridiculously expensive) i only pay $11 for his barber! i gave her a $1 - tip anyway because i'm nice like that but we are not going back unless i have the "free haircut" coupon which they give out sometimes at gsw games. but i will not come back to this location. i'll go to the sunnyvale location. they are more customer friendly and they pay attention to details.

i was not happy with this place for one reason; that reason was waiting and when two of their regulars came in, they went first. i understand if they have an appointment, that can be announced, but i wasn't told. i waited for about 20 minutes and their first regular walked in, was greeted and sat right away. i thought maybe this man has an appointment, but then a second regular came in and he was sat in righty away. another man that brought his child for a haircut was also interrupted to attend the two regulars. after leaving the place, i saw a sign that says "first come, first serve." never coming back again.

i had a great experience,   i went to another place to get a hair cut and they messed up my hair bad. i went here after and they did a great job fixing my hair and i actually received complements afterwards, amazing
they are not professional and very arrogant. they should learn how to cut hair and deal with costumer

can i give a minus star? so i specifically told the girl i was growing my hair out after years of crew cuts. i just needed a little trim and cleanup in the back. i had a party to go to that night....and i went here cuz my regular place is pretty spendy even for a trim. you get what you pay for right?lets just say i walked in expecting to pay a fair price for a trim. i left with a free crew cut and a bad attitude...

i usually spend about $90 getting my hair cut but recently i've been trying to save money where i can so i opted for a "cheap" haircut. i came in great clips a bit nervous, but my long hair was so fried and damaged it was time to chop it up. i told chau (i believe was his name) what i wanted and he delivered. only 15 minutes and $16 later, my hair looked great and feels so much better. it's shorter than i usually have it, but he did a great job preserving some length and adding volume with layers and he succeeded in getting rid of most of my fried ends. he couldn't get rid of all of it because then my hair would've been too short and he was very conscientious about preserving length like i wanted. definitely will be coming back here in a few months to get rid of rest of the damaged hair. thanks, great clips!
never too busy and always fast.  their app wait estimates are actually accurate.  if you want a decent haircut fast these guys are far better than supercuts.

been coming to this great clips for a few years now. each of the hair stylists working there have different levels of skills/repeatability/etc.  i come to get my hair cut every couple of months and it's a trouble free and quick experience.i only come here for one of the stylists, helena. she's friendly, experienced at cutting hair quickly and efficiently, and does a great job whenever i go. i did have one fairly negative experience a couple of years back when i stopped by for a hair cut when helena wasn't there and it was just horrible.  took forever and turned out pretty bad.if you come here for a hair cut, ask for helena. she does a great job and if you have a request, discuss with her to come to a common understanding of what you want done. she'll work with you. other notes:at times, it can get busy, and some of the stylists do get chatty. they don't have a dedicated person to handle the reception, so if all of the stylists are engaged with customers, it might take a few moments to get signed in. they have an app for checking in, so definitely use that if you are in a rush.while waiting for my daughter's hair to get cut, i've watched other children get their hair cut and there's definitely a lot of satisfied parent/child customers here.i've seen some customers come in asking for a hair treatment, were told politely that they didn't do that particular service on that day, and the customer leaves complaining bitterly about them not being professional. don't understand this, but if you ask for a service and are told it isn't available, then it isn't . arguing or complaining loudly just makes that person a bad customer, in my mind. :(anyways, i like coming here since i get my hair cut at a good price and it comes out the same way each time. happy customer.edit:i don't speak vietnamese, only english, and i get great customer service here.

great staff and boy do they know how to cut hair! from kids to adults they have it totally dialed in!wait was short and the place was clean and staff was informative and attentive! be back for sure as the quality of cut was just awesome.great location as well!

this is place consistently cuts my hair and they do it well. i regularly go here with my my kids and they are good with children. you can even use the app and schedule an appointment ahead of time, but i never do. they are open late so that helps me fit a haircut in with my busy schedule.

terrible service. at one point i had to come twice so that they fix the haircut, even then it wasn't fixed properly. the manager has zero customer service skills. even if you check in with the app, and arrive 10 mins before they close, they will start complaining, and say come tomorrow. even though the app clearly states that you just need to arrive before closing. this great clips has the worst customer service out of all great clips i've visited in multiple states.

i have tried many hair cuts places in the same price range as this great clips on kiely road and el camino real. i can say with confidence this is the worst place i've been to.i tried this place twice, the 2nd time i was really hoping the first time's bad experience was just an isolated incidence. hey, every one (place) deserves a second chance, right?  boy, was i wrong for giving this place the benefit of the doubt. the second time, i had a different hair dresser. at the end of her short session, i found that my hair is significantly shorter on one side than the other. in addition, it is shapeless and ticking out like cactus' arms. i felt ashamed even walking outside.i nicely asked the hair dresser if she could fix it a bit and nicely pointed out the issues with the mirror. she told me that if i want to fix it, that is the price of having a second hair cut done. so she flatly refused to fix anything.i know hair styles can be subjective sometimes, and i was definitely not expecting anything fancy from a budget place like this. but to brutalize someone's hair like this, and refusing to fix it is really unprofessional. if you don't mind getting an uneven hair cut, and just want to be in and out like a sausage factory, then maybe you can afford to take the risk at this place for $15. but if you want to look half way presentable at work, avoid this place like a plague.

i was in a hurry and on this end of town, so i ducked in. my haircut is simple enough that i wasn't concerned about it getting screwed up, really. it's that basic.they took me right in, the lady who cut my hair (40s, vietnamese, pleasant) was conversational without talking me ear off.efficient, inexpensive, and sweet. my basic haircut looked fine, and i was back on the road running my errands 15 minutes later. who could ask for anything more from a quickie haircut place?

frauds? 9.99 sale they say you can only get 5 max.. while great clips nationwide say you can get between 5-25 per person..these people are only looking to make money.,., wont even listen without interrupting.. u have t explain/talk to them like kids..their 9.99 fraud personal store policy pi$$ed me off..

this is my go-to place for haircuts. i'm a pretty shy guy, but all the hair cutters here are very nice, and allow me to try out my awkward social chit chat skills. i usually go here with my girlfriend and flirt with the hairdressers to make her jealous. she never gets jealous. for a long time i didn't know how to style my hair and it looked awful. then i went to this great clips after not having gone for 5 years or so. they had stored my haircut instructions from 5 years prior in their computer. using those ancient instructions to cut my hair gave me my identity back. thank you great clips. i am forever in your debt.

i came here to get my son a haircut. i don't know if it was the language barrier, as the hair stylist demonstrated a very thick accent in her expression and didn't paraphrase what i requested, but i did not end with what i asked for. i specifically ask for my son's hair to be "trimmed, very slightly, as he's trying to let the top hair grow for a style." i went to sit down and read a magazine and 10 minutes later i am called to see my son with his hair trimmed down to a "spike-with-gel" style, and there go two months of styling and letting his hair grow. i tipped the hairstylist and i have compassion on the person. we all need jobs, but she should try harder to understand what is being asked for in english, and deliver on it. definitely never coming back to this place. advice for future users: make sure the stylist understands what you asked for. ask them to paraphrase.

hami and genie are the best! they both pay excellent attention to detail and can give you any haircut you want. keep in mind great clips is a fast paced salon, but hami and genie will still give you a fabulous haircut and in a short amount of time! i definitely recommend checking in online to save yourself a spot in line because it is a very busy location. and most importantly... don't forget to tip!

very unprofessionalwhen i checked in online, it showed 0 min wait. when i reached the salon, there was only one person working and she was already busy. after 15 min wait, another person appeared from the back room to finally take me in.she was very unfriendly and did a terrible job with my haircut. my sideburns are of unequal length and not trimmed properly.i waned to check my hair properly before leaving but she pretty much hurried me out of the chair.
calling them rude and disrespectful wouldn't do justice to how the do things here. not sure if it was just the one lady at the desk or they are all like that.

place continues to go downhill. the stylist took barely a few minutes to finish my hair cut, and kept on trying to force me to leave my chair, make her payment and be done with it, even when it was clear that i was unhappy with the cut.
people are so polite and professional. also they are fast and listen to what you will say. i will recomend guys to come here and get their haircuts.

their online check-in is bogus. i checked-in online and my wait period was 40 mins at the time of check-in. i waited for 40 mins and then reached the saloon. but i was still made to wait for another 25 mins despite being already checked in. not a great start if you want to retain customers, great clips.

check in means nothing. when i first checked in, it says estimated time is 28 mins. got there before that and my time was then estimated to 47 minutes. checked in at 4:20...it is now 5:22, about to call our name...over an hour later!

waste of time to go there. couple of times faced this issue. i checked in online, but when i reach there before my appointment time, they asked me to wait for 30-45 minutes. i asked online system was showing 5 minutes wait time. the response was online system does not give accurate wait times, it just reserves spot. this place staff people do not value your time, so please avoid at least this place.
it is good that they are open till 8 pm on sunday but they do not answer their phone at all and voicemail is full! also the barber is eating while doing the haircut which is very disturbing.
phoung as always does a great job. i will come to him again. he is sincere, and great at his job and goes out of the way to understand what kind of haircut you need.
checked in on-line on a busy saturday, arrived and got in front of the line. had a nice trim with mary. i love the on-line check in and recommend doing so, especially on a weekend. got in and out.

came in for a taper. the asian lady cutting my hair didn't know what a taper is. i trimmed my beard at home and asked her to match my sideburn to my beard, and she could not blend them together. she did a terrible job. if you're a man looking for a fade, taper, line up, or beard to hair blend don't come here. they'll mess up your hair and leave you looking messed up for the next two weeks lol

person used past haircut notes and did not see that my visit this time was very early. relying on systems is good but then they need to learn how to use it instead of just looking at previous visit. common sense missing as they took off almost all hair on head and funny looking 'hard to define' haircut. regret going there

*** stay away from the stylist named marianne! ***i've been to this particular great clips a whole lot and it's been a generally positive experience. i now know that was only because i had gotten lucky with my stylists (phuong is my favorite -- knowledgeable and willing to work with you every time. the lady who moved here from seattle and just had a baby is fantastic too as is the man who is into gaming. all three of you make this gc great)today, however, i was not so lucky. i ended up with a mid-age lady named marianne. off the bat, she said she didn't know how to do a fade when she looked at the instructions the stylist put in last time. i looked at her flabbergasted for a moment, to which she responds "i guess i can blend a 2 on the sides into whatever you do on the top. trust me i can do a few things to make it look exactly the same." (spoiler - it doesn't look exactly the same as the high fade i requested...). unfortunately there were no other stylists available so i had to just go with it. finally, before beginning, she asks me what i want to do on the top. i say that i'd like to style it and asked her if she had any recommendations. she responds with "let me just take half an inch off the top and then we can talk about it then"she finishes doing both of the above and cleans up the edges all around, then hands me a mirror and says "how does the back look?". looks fine to me. "yeah, the back looks good, but --" she cuts me off by taking off the cover and asking to meet her at the register. let's recap:i asked for: 1) high fade, 2) style recommendation on topinstead i got: 1) a 2 on the sides/back 2) a 0.5" trim on top.at this point she's already trying to ring me up at the register. i'm wholly confused at what the heck just happened and ask her "wait what about the style recommendation on top?" and she claims she won't do anything because she thinks i don't need to, to which i reply "... but i had asked for it...". she gives me a scowl and said to come to talk to her about it at the register. so in my shock i foolishly get up and walk to the register. as i go up i also tell her about an area where my hair tends to grow fastest in an odd direction and i ask her to cut it for me. no luck since the cover is already off, i get just an ask for a payment option...and that's when she looks at the man sitting behind me that had just walked in as she finished my haircut and says "sir, i'm so sorry. i'll be with you in just a moment!" her shift in attitude towards me as soon as he walked in left me so confused. i wish i had said something then, but i instead just paid. there was nothing i could do here except be angry. for the first time in my life did not leave a tip.i so badly want to come back because every other stylist has been nothing but amazing. marianne, however, is making me question my perception of great clips.

i came here to get a standard men's haircut, 7 top 5 sides. any self respecting barber shop should be able to do that without any issue. by the time my haircut was done i already noticed some issues, but they were acceptable. at this point i would've given the cut a 3/5. then i got home and had the opportunity to take a closer look. the neck cut wasn't straight at all, and the angle of the tapers at the back were unequal. avoid this place at all costs.

i got my hair cut with a very kind korean lady by the name of "sonnie"the wait was prompt. even without her blow-drying my hair, i absolutely loved how she styled my hair. when i came home and blow-dried myself, i loved my hair even more! i almost regret not tipping her enough. highly recommended. definitely going back!

i have difficulties making stylists understand that i don't want short hair on the side. seems that most of them know one thing, and they stick with that.not the case, here - finally i got the right cut at this gc from nikki.very nice service, friendly, fast and efficient.will return.

both of my sons prefer this place. they do excellent work, plus there's an online mobile check-in app that tells us wait time. marianne is one of the stylists there that really knows what she's doing. but i also suspect everyone there is very experienced.

note that this is not a $40++ salon and thus please expect a different kind of service than your usual salon. this salon is good if you want to have a quick trim and not a new stylish hairstyle. if you want a new hairstyle, i suggest you go to a more expensive salon. this is a no fuss hair salon. i was in and out under 20 minutes i think.i tried this today the first time and i think this is one of the best hair salon of its kind. i got a quick trim of blunt cut. i usually don't have time to spare to pay a lot of attention to my hair, so i decided to get a no fuss hairstyle insteadwhen i came in, there was no queue, so i got called immediately. the older lady at the desk is friendly and is quick to serve me. i got my hair cut my a girl named chelsea. she is really friendly and talked to me the entire time. she even gave me advice on my hair. it was quick trim under 10 minutes. i think the haircut quality is decent enough.i used the $9.99 coupon here, and tip her separately. overall, i'm very satisfied with my trip here. would come back for a quick trim!

be wary of their kids prices. twice this week, i had the hair cutters charge adult prices for both my kids.  earlier this week, 2 ladies argued that my daughter looked 12 and tried to charge me adult prices, and today my 5 year old son was slipped the adult charge as well. both were cleared up when i called attention to it, but it's not an accident if it happened twice this week from different hair cutter.

daniel is the best! the quality of his work is by far the best i've ever experienced at any great clips location. he is passionate about his work and can recommend different styles based on what you like. he is patient and makes an effort to get to know you as a person. i have been coming back to this location for about 4 months now, and will continue to do so!

daniel is the best! i've been coming here for years and have mostly had average hair cuts and would occasionally try other places looking for the right person. then that all changed when daniel came along. under new management, this place is remarkably better than it ever was or any of the other local places i tried. daniel knows exactly what i want and how to make it look good even without me telling him. there's no one else i would go to here but i could not be happier.

always professional, very clean and there are many stylists that have been there a long time which is nice.  using the online check in application is super helpful to let you know the current wait time.
got a great haircut from daniel! super nice, super professional and super efficient! my wife loved the haircut, so thank you to daniel for that! #happywifehappylife

love this place! i first came here by accident and met daniel, now i keep coming back ever since! daniel helps me with style and suggestions about how to do/take care of my hair. his service was great and beyond. he seem passionate about haircut and very professional, he listened what i need and delivered exact the way i want. i would definitely recommend daniel and great clips here!
these guys can't figure out who is who, confusing everyone in the lobby. the customers have to tell the staff who's next. several people walked out pissed.

i normally don't get my hair cut at great clips but after a wonderful review from my mom (who loved her hair cut by daniel!), i had to give it a shot! daniel was very professional and friendly, and my husband wouldn't stop giving me compliments on it!

management does not know how to use the reservation system. told us that one employee called in sick. their reservation system is based on the number of employees there. and he said they had a walk in but it pushed everyone with a reservation our by 30 minuted. why have a reservation system if you don't know how to use it.
great service from stylist anna. we did a complete shave for my two year old son. she was so good with the baby and did a awesome job.

this place was busy when i first walked in but i was helped immediately. i came with a haircut in mind and showed daniel  a picture. with some suggestions from him, daniel cut my hair to perfection. he definitely knows what is current and what he is doing. i am one happy customer when i walked out. i would surely recommend him and i can't wait for my next haircut.

i used to drive half an hour to a salon for hair cuts, but about six months ago i found myself desperate for a cut and my salon was booked a month out. my husband and son had been going here for a while, so i figured i'd give it a try. this place is literally the best timesaver ever. you can drop in when it's convenient, sign in on your phone so you don't have to wait, and be in and out in twenty minutes. the women are lovely, and after multiple great haircuts i can't imagine going the salon route again. this last time i had a coupon for an $8 haircut. i tipped $5 on my $8 haircut because i felt like i was stealing.extra bonus in great clips' favor? boba tea two doors down!

i highly recommend great clips in mountain view. i've been going there for over 10 years now and they consistently do a great job for a great price. when you go ask for daniel. not only is he their excellent manager, but he also gives the best haircuts in town. thank you, daniel. you never let me down!
great hair cut. pretty cheap. only thing is i wished my hair cutter had parted my hair where i wanted before starting to cut. i realized after the fact.

i never knew of this place before donate blood to stanford blood center. on the day that i donate blood to stanford, i received a coupon for a free hair cut service provided by great clips. i was excited for the experience, since i needed a hair cut. when i first arrived to the store, the lady asked if i ever been to great clips and my answer was no. after my respond, she asked me to sit down then she served other customer who had actually been to the store and reserved a spot via online. i was like, that's find since i didn't made any reservation online, i don't mind waiting for a bit before getting a hair cut. 10 mins later, they called me up again and asked some of my basic information and asked me to take a sit and they will call me shortly after.after another 10 mins of wait, an elderly lady called my name and she asked me to come to her station then asked what kind of hair cut i wanted. i responded, i would want to have a clean cut and look sharp. she then responded, "what is a clean cut? and what hand of tweezers i use?" i responded, "i don't know what kind of tweezers you have and i do not know the length of tweezers either". she then spent so much time asking me about the tweezers and ignore the style that i asked her.overall, i had a bad hair cut. my bang was messed up (she literally used her scissor and cut a straight line.... i was like wtf???). how bad the hair cut is? i didn't go out for like 2 weeks and when ever i need to head out i feel like i need a hat to cover my head.... i feel the stylist (not sure if you can even call them stylist) need more professional training. but i guess i received a coupon and got a free hair cut, who can i blame?
had my hair cut twice now by daniel, and it has been great both times. he pays great attention to detail, and seems to enjoy what he's doing and has fun with his customers. definitely recommended.

this is to praise diane, on 11/27/16 my mother and i went in to have my mom's haircut, she is handicap, has a walker, balding, and has hardly any hair, and diane was so very sweet to my mother, she helped her to the chair, listened, and most importantly, made my mom feel special. my mom left with smiles ear to ear. the lady directly across from diane wasn't so friendly, when making the appointment i had asked if they would be able to dry my moms hair after the cut, and she said it would be $20 just to blow dry. now if you saw my moms hair, you would understand that the cut would only take a few minutes (we could have cut it ourselves, but i wanted my mom to feel special), and to tell me after looking at my moms hair that it would cost $20 to blow dry it, you would understand. once diane finished cutting my moms hair, she offered to blow dry it, taking 2 minutes longer. i told her no because the lady said it would be $20 more. diane said she wasn't styling it, just blow drying it, and that is complementary. as diane started blow drying it, the rude lady directly across the way from her started yelling at her in her language (we knew exactly what about). diane then yelled back at her, we couldn't understand what they had said, but it was apparent the rude lady was telling her not to blow dry it. i was pleased diane had the heart to stand her ground.if y'all want a caring hairdresser, go see diane. she is a sweetie and will take care of you!

i took the 9 year old i watch here to get his hair cut. when we walked in the man at the counter didn't even acknowledge our presence, then a woman came from the back room to help check him in. after she got our information she began to walk back to where she was when another male customer walked in and the rude man who works there automatically greeted him and politely told him he would be with him momentarily. i was so annoyed and next time i will not be brining the kids here again. such a terrible experience.

told me they were closed and made me turn off their open sign .   then laughed a bout it .  this was the second chance after one lady gave me  a off enter mohawk , after i asked for a medium fade...  bye bye .
lan is awesome. she knows exactly how to cut my hair. it's also great to chat w her. my experience is fantastic because of her professionalism. i would not go elsewhere.

i've gotten decent haircuts here before. not bad for the price.. but if only the lady who cut my hair today spoke enough english to understand that i didn't want the style she was giving me. every time i asked for it shorter she just went to explain to me that my hair is thick because somehow i didn't know that already. note: now that i'm home and i've actual had a chance to look at my hair.. it looks a lot worse than i thought. not coming here again.

my long-term stylist moved out of state almost a year ago and i've been searching ever since for my next long-term stylist, from fine salons to one person shops. a couple months ago i was desperate for a cut and popped into great clips after the gym with my fingers crossed. i was so happy to find gina! she listened to what i wanted and we took a couple of cuts to find our groove. i'm really happy with the cut, at a quarter of what i used to pay. looking forward to more great clips with gina!

my 5 star rating goes to pat the manager for my experience getting my hair done...great clips as well as super cuts get really bad reviews all the time. and i understand why! i've personally have had my hair destroyed before at different super cuts and great clips locations. and well i just don't have to money to afford a privately owned hair salon that charges $30-$100 for a hair cut. so i didn't give up hope. this time i contacted this location via yelp looking for a specific stylist with experience with curly hair (my hair is curly). the owner ray took the time to contact the manager and took interest in my concerns. once at the location pat the manager decided to work on my hair herself. she really took the time with my hair , understanding how it works and took everything i wanted into consideration. i can not speak for the rest of stylist but i did witness them doing lots of men hair cuts and they did pretty good. so for men, i think your safe with any stylist. as for the ladies who are scared to enter places like great clips, i understand your fears and anxieties very well and i can tell you that your safe in pat's hands. she's amazing and i will have her as go to hair stylist from now on.

when it comes to getting my hair cut, i am low maintenance.  i do not want a shampoo, cut, color, and the whole works.  i just need a simple trim to get rid of my split ends and to somewhat keep the overall length.  great clips totally fits the bill.  no appointments are needed and wait time is relatively short especially if you check in online.  if you do not check in online, the wait time can be a tad long especially if you come at a busy time such as saturday morning.i've had my hair cut and trimmed by several of the stylists at this location.  i've never had a bad experience.  i usually just get a few inches cut off the back with a few layers throughout my hair.  i am usually in and out in 30 minutes.  just how i like it!  plus it is really cheap for a haircut, just under $20!
very good people. the waiting time is short. i love my haircut and will definitely be coming again.

$17 for a men's hair cut. the lady didn't even put any after shave or polish on my head. bad attitude. what a waste of $17 bucks dude. i went because they open at 9am and i need to start my day. i was visiting from la.

this place is really amazing and very friendly to little kids. the haircut was done great in spite the 3 yo customer was wiggling and screaming. staff is very nice, patient and friendly, and helpful the best way it only could be. waiting time was less than 2 minutes on saturday noon. we had a great experience and get back here for sure.

my hair has many cowlicks so it is important that i find someone that can learn and cut my hair to minimize the impact of multiple cowlicks.  so when i find a hairstylist that shows they can meet the challenge, i stick with them.  and gina is the winner.  she has tamed the wildness of my cowlicks.  since i'm retired i can pick my time easily and she is usually ready or shortly thereafter.  one final touch is her ability to wash my hair without getting my collar wet!  easier said than done!  i highly recommend her!
received a great haircut from gina again and will be returning again in two weeks. gina did a great job on listening and helping me create a great hairstyle for myself.

i went for a haircut on sunday afternoon and my stylist was shahnaz. she appeared to be a bad mood and she  wiped off half of my eye brow by mistake. she was so unprofessional that she did not point out her mistake and left it for me to find out until i got home. i complained to the manager and the owner and they were very cooperative and apologetic. they assured me that shahnaz would undergo further training to prevent this from happening again. i have been going to this great clips from last 4 years and i really like the rest of the staff. i sincerely hope this will not happen again.

this is the 2nd time gina has cut my hair. i'm ecstatic about the results. i'm pretty high maintenance when it comes to getting my hair cut. i need to be able to communicate with the person who is working on my hair. she took her time and listened extremely well. i highly recommend gina as i will continue to use her as my "go to" person. she is definitively a keeper.

ever since i moved to the south bay 5 years ago, i've been coming to this great clips location.  the best time to get a haircut is after 1:00 pm; basically after the lunch rush.  in the evenings around 5 or 6 pm, it gets pretty busy.  for this reason, i recommend downloading the great clips app so that you can check in ahead of time to get priority service.  the staff is very friendly and professional!  i used to always get a basic taper/fade (like drake), but they encouraged me to try something new.  so, i grew out my hair for a year (like mark wahlberg) and they introduced me to hair products (i.e., pomade and forming cream) and to blow dry my hair before applying them to give it some volume.  my favorite hair stylists are pat and kim, who usually do my comb over (mid) fade (like justin timberlake).  remember to tip your hairstylists!

worst salon to get your hairs chopped off. i tried it not even once or twice but three times for my son. every time it was not haircut,but shaving the hairs with the razor. the ladies are not ready to listen to your requirements but keep on insisting that they are correct. their only intention is to finish the haircut in 5 minutes. kindly don't waste time and money.
its nice and much professional way serve.no waiting queue and got the haircut the way i want.
worst haircut i've ever had. extremely unprofessional.had to go to a different place to fix the "great clip".
quant is a true professional with a talent for connecting with people from all walks of lifekim is also excellent

had a really bad experience today.my stylist was shahnaz. she seemed in a bad mood, may be due to sunday rush!i told her very specifically at the start that i didn't want square neckline, i wanted a tapered neckline.. she said she understood and still went ahead and did a square, that too a high square!then she charged me 17 usd for a haircut.. i thought usual great clips haircut charges are 14 usd..

worst haircut i've had in a long time. may be the stylist didnt understand my hair style. may be my hair texture was too different for her. may be she was having a bad day.either ways, i had a terrible month until my hair grew back.cut on march-10, ticket#280422

fantastic location and never a long wait because you can check in online. for being a budget salon they hire excellent stylists, especially kim and john.i never feel rushed and i get helpful advice about hair care.my kid always asks for kim and she sits completely still for her.

worst customer service i've ever experienced! i was the only customer in the building, there were two stylists. i asked for a long bob cut, a very popular style, which neither stylist knew how to cut, so i had to search for pictures. i asked for textured ends, which jaqueline only did in the back of my hair, no where else. then length was rather longer than i wanted, and the cut only took about 8 minutes total, so i asked if she minded taking a bit more off. she threw her hands up, rolled her eyes, and said "see you need to say these things early on because now you're making me look bad and now i have to touch up your hair all over". i apologized and told her- i'm sorry this is a new hairstyle for me and i thought i would ask because there were no other customers there and the haircut was done and over with extremely fast. she and the other stylist were lecturing me and acting very annoyed. i decided to leave after feeling berated and embarrassed by them. i would understand if they had been busy, but come on- i was the only one there and the haircut was so brief it's not like it was a complicated haircut. i will never recommend this place.

really bad experience. this hair cutter who was doing my hair screwed up my hair. she cut it too short. way too short than the picture i showed her. she told me "oh, your hair is not going to be exactly the same as the person in the picture because your hair is different." she cut it nothing like what i showed her in the picture. she cut it way too fucking short. the person who cut my hair is so fucking incompetent. can't cut hair, so don't ever go to great clips. no wonder their prices are so low. it's because they do shitty work. never going to this great clips place ever again!
